===

Delilah reached for me; slowly, luxuriously, stretching out the moment…until her giant hand stopped just short of grabbing me for whatever “fun” she had in mind. “Just a minute. What am I doing? I can’t just play with you like this, Greg.”

I was delirious with relief. I let out a breath I’d forgotten I was holding and shuddered, putting a hand on my chest to calm my heartbeat from its machine gun pace. Some god up there had given me a break for once, and decided to make this amorous rhino giantess come to her senses and NOT make me her personal pleasure object. “You’re right, Doctor Davison,” I heard myself say. “It’d be too dangerous—”

“Why should I hog you all to myself?” Delilah said brightly, as if I hadn’t spoken. “That would just be selfish. No, a cutie like you should be shared! The more the merrier, as they say!” She gave me a sultry wink and grin, then reached for the phone again.

My hope that had been rekindled just got a cold wave thrown on it. If I wasn’t dead before, I was practically in the grave already now. There was no way I’d survive TWO amorous titanesses playing with me! I tried to beg her to stop dialing, but all I could offer was a weak croak.

“Too exited to speak, Greggie?” Delilah purred, covering the phone’s mic. She licked her lips and winked at me. “Just be patient, you’ll get in on the fun soon enough.” She shifted, and once more I was covered in the shadow of her gigantic rump…before it crashed down right next to me, making the bed creak and launching me into the air. Screaming, I rocketed upward, then fell—bouncing off one of Delilah’s ample thighs. She immediately brought her legs together, trapping me between her thunder thighs.

Rough pachyderm hide ground against me as I was squeezed between mountains of rhino celulite. Sweat and floral perfume assaulted my nose as Delilah gave me a quick squeeze, sighing at my struggles. She patiently waited for the phone to ring…and when I heard the other line pick up, my blood ran cold.

“Heya Toronto! You know how you said I can play with Greg? Well, I figured you need a little stress relief from running this place—come on down and join in! I’ve got plenty of ideas on how we can have fun with Greg…I know it’s been a while since we played with a human. Why not relive some old times?”

No. Nononono. NO! Not Miss Holmes. ANYONE BUT MISS HOLMES! That cow was merciless. She’d made no secret about how she’d stepped on, sat on, and EATEN humans and enjoyed it. Not as a threat, but a simple fact. She’d always been suspicious of me, now she had the perfect excuse to take out any frustrations on the only human who worked for her. And with her to egg Delilah on, the rhino would do FAR worse than she ever could alone. I was so freaking dead…

Holmes and Deliah chatted for some time. I was too terrified of my impending doom to hear most of it, but I caught the tail end just before Delilah hung up.

“Come right down, Toronto! This’ll be so much fun, you’ll see. I promise I’ll hold off on Greg until you get here…oh! And be sure to bring—"

02.content:
Wear that lingerie I bought you--the lace bra and panties! You have a great figure, you should show off your assets more often," Delilah purred, biting her lip and sighing in amorous bliss. She squeed her thighs together, squishing me again. "I'm in my bikini, it'll be awkward if you're all gussied up. See you soon!" She hung up and smirked down at me. "It's your lucky day, Greg. You get TWO big beauties today...of course I'll get first dibs."

I tried to beg for mercy, but she just clenched her thighs again and produced a magazine to read while we waited.

It wasn't long before Miss Holmes arrived--and Jesus Mary and Joseph, she was a bombshell! The bra and panties were pure frilly lace, with fancy frills all around them. Shining white, crisp and clean. They were plus-sized, but fit TIGHT on her giant rump and breasts...merciless slave driver she was, I had to admit Miss Holmes was HOT.

I was still probably gonna die, though...wait, why did she have that box in her hand?

She grinned evilly, her tail swishing behind her as she closed and locked the door. "Delilah; where is he? Ah don't take breaks often, so let's make this one count!" She rubbed her stomach with her free hand.

Delilah slapped her thighs, creating waves that battered me around like a hurricane. "Oh, we'll have fun Toronto--and you should relax more. It's unhealthy to overwork yourself like you do." She reached into the flab with two fingers and plucked me from the trap, setting me on the floor. "What's that you've got there, by the way?"

Holmes grinned, tearing the box open and producing what looked like a yellow toy gun and aimed it at me. "New gizmo from Kelly. She said it's a shrink ray...this'll be even better if Greg's even smaller!" She flicked a switch, and the gun's barrel glowed red. "Business isn't good, Greg. Guess it's time fer some downsizin'!" She laughed at her own joke and pulled the trigger.

A ray of red light engulfed me. I felt pressure crushing down from all sides--no, it was like something was drawing me inward from within. The room stretched around me--

That lasted three seconds before I blacked out.
Miss Holmes's evil laugh was the last thing I heard.

===

Everything was spinning. Stars danced around my vision even with my eyes held shut. I felt like I'd somehow fall even lying down. Eventually I came to and opened my eyes.

...And wished I hadn't.

"Wakey-wakey, Greg!" Delilah sang. Her voice thundered. I looked up, and up, AND UP...and kept on looking up."

Mountains.
They were mountains.

Two all-encompassing goddesses looming over their human toy, pain and fear incarnate in pachydermic and bovine forms. Inescapable, overwhelming, merciless.

I felt like...no, I WAS; an ant before these titanic dominatrixes. Normally I would be ankle-high to Delilah; now her toenail alone was bigger than me. Miss Holmes' hoof looked big enough to crush a hundred of me in one go. Her panties and bra looked deadly as they were beautiful.

I couldn't move, couldn't scream. My legs gave out and I fell flat on my back, looking up at my certain doom with a slack jaw.

Miss Holmes eyed me like I was one of her chocolate strawberries that had gone a little stale but was still edible. "Welp; we know Kelly's gadget works," she mused, examining the shrink ray. "Think Ah overdid it, though--didn't expect Greg ta git THAT small...shoot, Ah can barely see 'im!" She squinted and leaned down. "Ya sure we can play with 'im, Delilah? Looks like he'd break just from pickin' 'im up. What fun is that?"

"Oh, pishposh!" Delilah tutted. "Greg's at the PERFECT size. You overthink things, Toronto. Honestly, he's about...half an inch high? Maybe less? Oh, it doesn't matter. He's even cuter now, and he's more durable than you think--I sat on him, and he didn't even have one broken bone!" She slapped her gigantic rump and leered down at me. "And I'm not exactly a lightweight, am I Greg?"

I could only whimper. They didn't see even me as a human now, just as a toy.

Holmes whistled. "He survived YOUR ass? Day-um! He IS tough. 'Course, he can't put any sunblock on our booties NOW. It'd take him half and hour just to walk across our butts! Come ta think of it, he can't really do his job now at all..." She eyed me and licked her lips. "Kelly said she didn't have a way to UN-shrink him yet; so he'd just be freeloadin' until she came up with one. And Ah don't like freeloaders...haven't eaten a human in a while either..."

Delilah waved her off. "Now now Toronto, you can't just eat humans who could still be useful. For all you know Kelly could un-shrink him tomorrow! Personally, I'd like to keep him at this size for good--he'd make an ADORABLE pet!" She giggled. "But for now...let's have our fun!"

"Now yer talkin'! Git ready Greg, 'cause we play rough!"

Two giant hands reached for me.
I screamed for some god to help me.

None did.


How do Holmes and Delilah play with the shrunken Greg?

1.content:
*KSSSSSSSSSSHHHHHHHHHHHHHH*

The sleep was shot out of my head at the telltale sound of the water slide roaring to life, followed by a beam of light flaring through the window that stung my eyes through their lids. With a tired groan, I rolled out of bed and blearily walked up to the window to see what little I could of the view outside past the red plastic tube. The waves were now turned on and crashing against the sand, and the blustery snowstorm that'd been pounding on the glass dome for two weeks flickered away into a bright blue sky above an an infinite-looking ocean, giving the perfect illusion of a gorgeous beach during the heart of summer.

At least the room saved me a few bucks on an alarm clock.

I opened the wardrobe and pulled out a tall, slim package wrapped in plastic, carrying it with me into the bathroom. After a long shower, a shave, and some hair brushing, I came back out ten minutes later with the bedridden, disheveled me shedded off in favor of somebody good enough to be at a wedding, with a dark black suit, evenly combed hair, and clean skin, but all of that was only half of the trip.

I turned on a light in the wardrobe so I could see my reflection inside. The get up was perfect, but the fire inside wasn't quite burning, yet.

I forced a smile. It came too fast, kind of crooked. "Hello, there, miss. How may I help you, today?"

Nah, too whimsical.

I smiled again, but smaller and softer. "Hello there, miss! How may I help you, today?"

Better...but too next-door neighborish.

"Hello there, miss! How may I help you today?"

Spastic, but getting there...

"Hello, there, miss. How may I help you, today?"

Perfect. Not a single twitch or smirk in sight, and not the least bit forced. I was ready.

...and in time, too, as the red phone let out a ring. I instantly broke character and dove in a mad dash to grab the phone before it rang a second time, and reached so much speed that my back slammed against the wall before I took the phone off its hook.

"Hello, miss Holmes. How're you today?" I greeted, mustering up the same rehearsed voice.

"Howdy. Just fine..." She drawled on the other end with a preoccupied tone. "Y'all ready for the day?"

"Yes, miss! Everything is in perfect order!"

"Good ta hear. Anyways, today I'm gonna have you be workin' in..."

"Today y'all's gonna be busting your fingers in the White Brimstone's main kitchen. Remember, Boy. Y'all better make sure the pantry is stocked, otherwise, we'll have to cook you." "Yes, ma'am." I let out a grunt at that. I didn't know whether or not she was serious or not but being a cook at the White Brimstone was the most stressful job of all. Given that many of the guests are large anthros and big eaters as well, I had to make absolutely sure of several factors. First I had to check the inventory, then there's preparing the food and making sure not to keep the guests waiting. One mistake could be dangerous. Not to mention, I'm pretty sure that at least a few of the guests would eat me if they thought they could get away with it. Well, hopefully I can get the job done today without ending up as the main course.

First I was making a note of the inventory and everything seemed to be in order. Most of it was all kinds of seafood. It was a good thing that Ms. Holmes hired those fishermen the other day or I'd be sunk. After all, a lot of the guests were carnivores and even the herbivorous animals could get pretty ravenous. Of course, that's when I heard a grunt because somebody had snuck up on me. I looked to both sides to see two balck and white furry asses right next to me pressing against me and there appeared to be pink panties and maid outfits attached with long cats tails. Two of the dectuplets had surrounded me. “Hi Gregy.” Both of them say in a sing-song tone. You let out a groan. “Iris,” I said. “Maia. Leave me alone.” The two cat girls then grabbed each of my legs and squeezed them between my thighs and I screamed in pain. “I’m Nike,” said the one on the left. “I’m not Maia.” “And I’m Nemesis.” Of course. It’s not like I care which one of them is which. Who the hell could tell since they look exactly alike.

Nike (or Nemesis) I really don’t care batted at the side of my face as Nemesis (or Nike) licked my face. “Me-ow. Come on, Gregy, how about we both take a break and catch that new Elisa Young movie.” The other of the girls let out a hiss. "No way, Nike, he's coming with me." Nemesis and Nike then hissed at each other and showed their claws before I pushed both of them out of the way. "Girls, girls, girls!" I yelled. "Leave me alone. I've got bigger fish to fry. If Ms. Holmes catches me skipping work, she'll swallow me down with a handful of watermelons." Nike let out a scoff. "You're no fun. Maybe we should tell the boss what you really think of the customers." I let out a moan. Their tomfoolery never failed to irk me.

Nemesis then gave a smirk. "You know, Nike. Maybe we should like Greg work. After all, we're expecting at least three important guests today." I gave a gulp. Special guests always made me nervous. "And which guests would those be?" Nike let out a laugh. "I'll tell you three names, Gregy. First, Elisa Young." Now that got me excited. I had heard of Elisa Young. She was a famous anthro actress who did mainly action and romance movies. She was a 75ft tall anthro hippopotamus with pure teal skin and shiny bluish midnight black hair worn in a beehive style. However, she was most recognizable for the triple heart tattoo on her large behind. Being a hippopotamus she was obviously large, probably even heavier than my boss. I may complain about my job in private but boy would I like to meet Elisa Young one day. I'm kind of a fan. I did hear that she predictably had a rather large appetite and wasn't exactly picky about food.

"Second," said Nemesis with a giggle. "There's Jean of Zaldin." Now that made me nervous. Zaldin was a country that has had numerous quarrels with the country that Gaia 2.0 was located in. Their queen, Jean, was a 67' 1" and obese phoenix with bright green feathers all over her body and sparkling red hair with eyes that shined like topaz as well as an enormous belly big enough to deflect missiles. She's currently in the country and I heard she was there in order to sign a peace treaty with our country and Zaldin. She was also rumored to be hot and cold towards outsiders. If she was at the hotel, I'd have to be on my toes. I neither want to end up in a phoenix's throat or to cause a war. I didn't know enough about the country of Zaldin to know what not to do to avoid offending.

"And the third guest?" I asked nervously. Both the sisters laughed as they walked out. "Try Lady Xanadu." "Lady Xanadu?!" I yelled. Lady Xanadu, now that woman scared me. Not that she was mean. It's just that I wasn't entirely sure about her mental health. Lady Xanadu was a pop singer and a 44' 4" armadillo woman with long pure white hair and a gold-colored shell. She was rather obese but most of it went into her huge boobs and her shelled back that even had spikes embedded into it. She was one of the most well known singers in the world of Neo-Earth. However, she was rather eccentric. How eccentric, try wearing a bikini made out of barcodes. Not only that, no one has ever seen her eyes behind the sunglasses.

If those are only three of the special guests, I was wondering how I was going to please them without getting into trouble or ending up in their stomaches myself. Sure enough, Hera (or Demeter, I really don't care), came into the room. "Heads up, Gregy," she said in just as much a flirty tone as her sisters. "You've got your first guest of the way."

And sure enough the first guest in the White Brimstone was...

There was a loud shaking sound and I realized that the first guest was a particularly large and very heavy guest given the sound of their footsteps. I mean, I shouldn’t be surprised since most of the guests are giant fat ladies who could swallow me whole and my boss herself was so big I don’t think I could budge her fat ass with a bulldozer. But whoever was coming was probably big enough to make Ms. Holmes and her ginormous hulk look small if that was even possible. I felt that it was best to look out to see what Hera, Demeter or whoever that dectuplet was, was talking about.

It was there I looked out and saw someone that A) I never thought I’d ever meet before and B) I always wished I’d be able to meet. It was none other than the hippopotamus goddess of the silver screen herself; the very beautiful and very huge Elisa Young. Standing 75ft tall, she was very obese (but then again she was a hippo so that was predictable). She had an 80ft wide stomach and a huge 90ft wide ass, her most dazzling feature, especially with the triple heart tattoo on her right butt cheek. There was an urban rumor that a meteor shattered upon image with Elisa’s huge rear and Elisa herself didn’t even feel it. Her bright teal skin glistened in the light. I looked up to see her bluish black hair worn in her standard beehive, which is how I got the fetish for the hairstyle in the first place. Surprisingly for a big time movie star, she was dressed casually, although that was understandable. She probably didn’t want to be hounded by fans, even though this was a rather exclusive resort. The hippopotamus was wearing a black tanktop and a pink vest with a pair of tight blue jeans that were coming apart due to her large, fat and beautiful ass. Finally, she was wearing a pair of dark glasses. Damn, I got really hard looking at her.

Unfortunately the cats quickly noticed this gesture and pouted. “Oh geez,” said Nike. “Greg’s been a fan of that pachydermic diva for years.” “What could he possibly see in her?” scoffed Nemesis with a smirk. “I heard a rumor she once accidentally swallowed a guy like him in a salad.” I had heard about this rumor myself and while I wasn’t sure if it was true, it.... probably be worth it.... if I could just be in the presence of a goddess like Elisa Young. At that moment, the divine hippo was taking a seat in three chairs at a table built for our more titanic guests. The third of the dectuplets was about to go out and take Elisa’s order, but I pushed her to the side as she meowed loudly. There was no way I was going to miss a chance to meet my favorite actress. I immediately ran up to the table to call up to Elisa Young. “Hello! Miss Young! Down here!”

Elisa took off her sunglasses and the hippopotamus giantess looked down and appeared to be surprised to see a human on the ground. “Well that’s fast service,” said the giantess with a cheeky smile. “But this dish doesn’t look like it’s cooked properly.” I let out a nervous laugh at what I thought was a joke. “M-My name is G... uh, it’s Greg! And I will be your slave... I mean your server, forever, I mean, today.” Elisa let out a sigh and a slight smile. “So much for incognito. I thought I’d be able to take it easy for once at Gaia 2.0. “Sorry, Miss Young,” I said with a blush. “It’s just that I’m a... I’m a big fan.” Elisa rolled her eyes and smiled. “Flattery will get you nowhere,” she says. “But maybe I’ll give you a hint of my next movie role if I’m in a good mood later.” I didn’t know what Elisa was going to do for her next roll but I remembered her last role in Cheer Ninjas and it was one of my favorite movies.

Candace, the dragon head chef, walked out and seemed surprised to see me speaking with a hippopotamus that utterly dwarfed her. “Uh-oh,” says Candace. “Sounds like somebody is going all fanboy out there. This should be interesting.” The dectuplets that were in the kitchen were hissing as Elisa was looking at a menu. I was anxious as to what she would order. It could be anything since it was a known fact Elisa Young would eat anything. That’s when she decided on a dish. “This looks interesting.” She said as I prepared to write her order down. "And what will it be today, Miss Young?"

1111.content:
"Hmm..." Elisa hummed as she read through the menu, sending deep vibrations through the ocean of fat engorging her body. Even as good an actress as she was, however, I could see her eyes lingering on a certain top-left corner of a certain fourth page. "I guess I'll have this 'Gaian Firesauce burger I'd heard so much about...actually, make it two. No, five. Five."

Of course. The fact that it was the most expensive thing we served didn't leave a dent in its popularity; if anything, getting to pay for it was probably the ultimate testament to how friggin' rich you were. "Of course, Miss Young. We'll have it ready for you right away!"

"Well, with an attitude like that, I'm hoping for fine service..." She smirked as she leaned back in her seat, stroking her stomach as it let out a rumble that resonated through the floor.

With more enthusiasm than any other guest I'd waited on, I ran back to the kitchen, trying not to show off too much of a skip. I didn't do my usual glances around to make sure I wasn't about to get snatched away by some starving patron as I ran by, but all the way across the restaurant I didn't remember until it was too late to dodge a black tail that curled around my waist and fished me off my feet, just a few steps from the kitchen doors.

Whichever-greek-goddess-she-was-named-after swung me straight into her belly and smushed me in with both arms, spinning me around as she scraped my face with a wet, sandpapery tongue.

"Gkk...Nike, cut that out!"

"I'm Maia!" She huffed. "I'd think you of all people would recognize me, Gregory!"

"Ah, just let me go!"

I wriggled out of her arms and hit the ground again, but she took care to let her tail drag along my face as I took off for the kitchen. The whole time, Candace was just a few feet from the door, watching us through the window. "Elisa Young wants five Gaian Firesauces!"

"On it." One claw splashed cooking oil onto a pan sitting on the oven, while the other grabbed a log of ground beef from a freezer built above and began mashing it into pulp. "I'm guessing they're all seventy-scaled?"

"Well..." Peeking over the window, I gazed at the mountain of teal seated in the middle of the restaurant, eyeing the path I'd just taken with a hungry look. "Better make them eighties."

A horde of vibrantly colored heads on top of black suits came running through the parting doors and slid to stops at trained positions in the room, a few of them leaping up and flying to latch onto support beams built along the ceiling. The sight of them in such action distracted me from three of the bird-agents striding towards the kitchen door, and I came to just in time to leap out of the way from being trampled by the two running in.

"Workership liscense?" Demanded the third agent that stayed outside.

"Y-Yeah, sure!" I fumbled more then usual as I pulled out my wallet, flashing him my ID.

"Hmm..." An eyebrow creased over his sunglasses as he examined the card. "Alright. That's a check."

One of the agents peeked his head through the door. "Everybody here checks, sir!"

"Got it." He hit a button on his wristwatch and spoke into the face. "Bring her in!"

Every one of the bird guards' heads swiveled towards the White Brimstone's main doors. They cracked open, then were heaved apart by two grounded rows of birds pushing through, opening the door for a very tall, very wide, and very round body that stood outside, partly silhouetted by the harsher lighting in the Aether's hallways.

Four hefty phoenixes dressed in veils fluttered into the room whilst carrying the ends of a long square of ornately designed fabric along the ground, but even as towered dover the rest of the bodyguards, they weren't even a paper clip on a rubber band compared to the gigantic ruler whose stomach poured out several feet over every end of the material. Jean didn't even look like she needed their help as she effortlessly walked in through the door, despite carrying a stomach that poured out along a length of floor almost as long as the climb up along her thick lovehandles to the top of her shoulders, and wide enough to form the curve of a bell tracing down from the tips of her shoulder blades.

She held her beak high with her eyes shut, flaunting a layer of black mascara that punched two holes within the emerald green luster of her feathers, all dressed up in an exotic flair that was topped by a thin red veil that flared around a head of weightless, wavy black hair.

Her eyes were still closed as she lowered her monolithic legs into her seat, but then she glanced to her right and looked around at the ground. That hit my spark plug and I strode briskly, yet smoothly to her side.

"HEY, YOU!!!" One of her body guards panicked at my speed and rocketed straight at me, strikign the ground only a few feet away from me when I stumbled and faceplanted on the hardwood. "WHAT BUSINESS DO YOU HAVE WITH ZALDIN'S JEAN?!!?"

"Oh, relax, Thespi..." Jean tempered, but not out of compassion. "I highly doubt a human as him'll count as a major threat."

Well, I think I'd made a good enough impression... I mentally smacked myself.

114.content:
"Oh, no." Well, Nike and Nemesis were sure as hell wrong, but for once in my life, Id've given anything to stay squished between the two of them. "Oh, friggin' NO..."

Of anything to start off the season with, of any diva or political figure I could get to sit on my lap with their fat ass, a cobra slinked in through the doors. One almost as tall as Miss Holmes, and just like Miss Holmes was ridiculously fat, with a heaping asteroid of a big belly covered in grayish-brown scales that scraped loud along the hardwood floor of the White Brimstone. Her breasts were absolutely enormous, and otherwise the only part of her body clothed by a taut black T-shirt with garbled silver lettering spray painted along her chest.

From a few years of experience, it'd gotten to be a dead giveaway that you'd be in for a pretty bad day if a snake came slithering in. I'd been sat on by celebrities, nearly been swiped away for standing a few feet close to the buffet, and one time wasn't even as lucky and ended up trapped inside some dumbass horse's stomach for two days, but snakes? Snakes were pretty much the only kind of guest I'd immediately come to fear, especially cobras. It sure as hell didn't help that this one had a friggin' skull painted on her face.

But unlike any of the guests in general we'd get, she actually had three humans at her side walking into the restaurant. They weren't even carrying around any baggage or taking notes as advisors would, they just looked like they were with her for a meal.

"Ooh..." Nike or Nemesis cringed, and for the first time I'd ever seen any of the Dectuplets do, the two waddled away, abandoning me.

"Wait, don't...!" But there wasn't a single waiter in the White Brimstone closer than I was to the snake woman waiting at the podium. "Oh..." Come to think of it, Miss Holmes' perfume smells kinda nice...

But alas, my muscle memory got the better of me and tugged me towards the front doors. Yet as I approached the quadrio, I tried to guide my attention towards one of her humans.

"Good morning, sirs and...madame, how may I help the four of you?" I struggled to smooth out my shaky posture and voice, but they didn't seem to question me.

"One reservation for a 'Toxic Nightshade', please?" He asked.

"That'd be..." I whipped out my tablet, scrolling through the list of guests for today. Sure enough, one of the reservations bore the distinct name. "...Kelly and Eric Monroe, Matt Ericks, and Nick Bastion?"

"That's the one."

"Of course. right this way, sir."

Table forty eight, one of the tables in the furthest corner of the joint. I lead the way for them, with the three other humans standing frontline on their snake's belly, who, to my surprise, I could hear keeping up a slow pace in order to let them keep up a natural pace, which for her was a half of fraction of a decimal of a crawl.

Either out of curiosity or tempting fear, I couldn't help but look back up at her. Given her reptile senses, she easily noticed my movement and glanced back down, and of all things, smiled at me. It wasn't some vicious snarl or predatory grin, but something like a silent, friendly hello.

Huh. First snake I'd ever seen.

"Alright, table forty eight." I guess I should've instantly know where they'd sit. It'd been arranged and set as one table over thirty feet tall, with a more human-geared setup put together on top. "May I interest you in a ladd-"

But when I turned back, the snake was already busy picking the three of them up one at a time, setting them on the table. "Pardon?"

"...never mind."

She continued setting them at their table on hers, and I politely excused myself back to the kitchen as they looked through the menu. I didn't bother to stick around, but I didn't try to sprint away, either.

However, when I got in, every single eye of the staff was staring at me. Most of them looked absolutely flabbergasted, as if my coming back to work alive was the work of some witchcraft, while the others seemed pitiful. The only one who wasn't gawking happened to lay a clawed hand on my shoulder, and I glanced back at Candace.

"You alright there, buddy?" She asked knowingly, her expression somber.

"Yeah, actually. I'm alive, aren't I?"

She knelt down, getting onto my level. "Wanna stick around here till they go?"

"Well..." I looked out the window back at their table. To add more icing on the cake, she was chatting with them, and laughing.
