"It's how it always goes!" She continued. "You're walking home from the movie theater, all alone, maybe mom decides it's not the biggest risk to go down that one alleyway! Well, you go through, and so far, so good, it looks like you're just about in the clear, the exit is in sight..."

"Hey, Kelly, Miss Holmes said you needed some help wi-"

"...and WHAMMO!!!"

In one swift motion, Kelly's dislodged her butt from its prison as she spun around to face me, the tip of her tail coming pretty damn close to lobbing my head off as it swung past. I leapt back, landing assfirst on the floor, but Kelly didn't give me a chance to breath before she tossed a toy chainsaw up in the air and onto my lap.

"Ever the threat of many a street on the city, a chainsaw killer leaps out into the open, wearing the face of his dead cellmate!"

"...huh?" I gurgled out, the crowd murmuring to one another in surprised whispers.

Kelly stared at me through a brief pause, then gestured to me with a hurried look. "He's screaming! The sound of the chainsaw fills your ears, spreading sheer panic through your system!"

I stood up, the chainsaw falling off my lap. "Kelly, what the hell is going on!?"

"He's going insane!" Kelly gritted out. "He's scaring us! People's lives are in danger here!"

"Uh..." Looking down at the chainsaw, I bent over and picked it back up, shakily pointing it at Kelly's face.

"He's snarling like an animal!" Kelly describes, getting more exasperated with each sentence. "Heck, if he weren't a chainsaw killer, then he'd be an actor great enough to get into Gaia 2.0!"

"Oh, uh....hraaaargh!!! SNRRRK!!!!" I growled, forcing out an animalistic grimace.

"He's absolutely off his rocker! I can barely think over his screaming and the chainsaw!"

"SNYRAAAAAARGH!!!! HUUUUUUUURRRRKKKK!!!" I gnashed as loudly as I could, and more or less had a mental breakdown with the chainsaw, madly swinging it around by the handle.

At last, Kelly seemed satisfied as I madly danced around with the chainsaw, and smile back at her audience. "...and as I've covered in my book, 'Death by Nature: Survival in the Jungles of Tree and Concrete,' I'd covered multiple means of disabling a man with a chainsaw, but if you were in a pinch..."

Once again, Kelly swiftly spun around and swung her tail at me, and this time connected it with its target. The plastic chainsaw was totally obliterated, and my hand came pretty damn close to joining the shower of broken pieces that were thrown all over the floor at my side, leaving me startled and unarmed, right in the open.

"...and now that he is unarmed," Kelly continued, her fingers reaching into a pocket that was severely overstretched along her backside. After a moment's search, she drew her hand out and pointed its contents right at me, being a white plastic gun with a clear red visor over the barrel.

"Kelly, what the hell is that?!" I stammered, holding both hands up.

"...you have a number of ways to further disable him, to ensure he never brings harm to another moviegoing family, but today, I'd like to demonstrate for your viewing eyes, fresh on the shelves..."
124.title: Kelly's Defense Bunker.

choices: Snatched Greg off the floor and tossed him in her mouth!
Sat her big dragon butt on him!
Swatted him across the room with her tail!
1241.content:
"...the K-Shrink! Reduce any attacker to tiny size with the pull of a trigger! Not even the toughest psycho can pose a threat to you when he's the size of an ant!" with a grin, Kelly flicked a switch on the gun's side. There was an audible *click*, and the red visor on the barrel began to glow bright crimson. Plastic or not, I know what a gun's safety sounds like.

The crowd watching our little show wasn't impressed. "But he's, like, a human," a slim alligator woman put in. "He's already tiny. What's the point of making him smaller; you can just step on him already." The crowd chuckled at that, Kelly rolled her eyes.

"Well this can just make it easier. Besides, you never know what a crazy chainsaw killer might pull...maybe even something that could take down an Anthro. Ever heard of the Moscow Tripper?"

Miss Gator and several Anthros in the audience winced at that. I was, of course, clueless--had there been some suicidal Russki tripping Anthros I was unaware of? I gave the guy/girl a week before they were caught and eaten.

"Ah, see? It isn't that easy! And what if you aren't facing a human attacker, but an anthro assailant? Can you 'just step on them' then? No, you can't. That's what the K-Shrink is for! Human or anthro, tiny or giant; this little beauty can make any attacker too small to be a threat! So precise and easy to aim, it can even hit an itty-bitty little human!"

Her clawed finger closed around the trigger, one reptilian eye locked onto me.

"Kelly...." I whimpered, too scared to run.

"So, any questions before I show it off?" She quipped, looking back to the audience.

A turtle kid rose a scaly hand. "What's the 'K' stand for, Miss Kelly?"

She shrugged. "Heck, I dunno. I just thought it sounded cool."

She pulled the trigger, and I was enveloped in a red beam.
I felt like I was falling...

===========

I came to a moment later....and wished I hadn't.
Before, Kelly's near-20 feet made her as big as a squat building to me.

Now, I was looking up at a mountain of yellow scales and wide dragon-rear. Her clawed feet were now big as semi trucks, and her plump belly and cleavage jutted out do far--from my ant's perspective--that her face was hidden. I'd dealt with gigantic anthros before, but THIS? This was in a whole new league.

"See, ladies and gents? The chainsaw killer is no threat! Now he's the size of a dust molt, even WITH his chainsaw he'd pose no threat to you and your moviegoing family," Kelly thundered from above, proudly waving her shrink gun around. I risked a look past her and found I couldn't see the audience. I was so small that they were blocked by the counter, which now looked like a skyscraper.

Christ, just how small was I?!

The audience applauded, clamoring to buy a K-Shrink of their own. Kelly, soaking in the praise, held up her clawed hands. "Calm down, folks;
there's plenty to go around...but wait, what's this? It seems our chainsaw killer is stubborn! Guess we'll still have to deal with him...THEN you can buy some K-Shrinks. Who wants to see us finish our killer off?!"

Oh God, no...

The crowd cheered and applauded, egging Kelly on. She winked at them, then looked down at me, over her shoulder.

"Sorry, Greg..." she whispered. "But it's part of my sales pitch."

And then, before I could protest, she...
1241.title: Mini-Greg

12411.content:
She snatched me off the ground easily, gripping my miniscule form between two fingers. I experienced a sense of vertigo as she lifted me off the ground and over her head, paying no mind to the discomfort such treatment was causing me. If looking up at her like a mote of dust on the ground was terrifying, that was nothing compared to being suspended by a living mountain.

"I'd just like to mention that the K-Shrink only shrinks its targets. No need to worry about harmful radiation. Your would-be attacker is completely safe to eat as a tiny-treat!"

"EAT?!" I cried out in terror. My voice was so squeaky I didn't even know if Kelly heard me or not. If she did, she didn't feel guilty enough to look ashamed. "In fact, the shrinking process condenses a person's natural flavor making them tastier than ever before!"

A part of me held out hope that this was all just some elaborate fake out. That hope died when Kelly licked her lips and opened her jaws wide. I couldn't even get out a plea before she dropped me. It was like freefalling out of an airplane without a parachute. The wind whipped at me, there was a roaring in my ears, and I was so scared, I threw dignity to the wind and even tried to flap my arms in the impossible hope to fly away from the hungry maw below me.

I landed on her tongue with a splat. Kelly clamped her jaws shut, sealing me in darkness. I was winded from the fall and defenseless as she used her tongue to slam me against her cheek and sucked on me like a piece of candy. She made exaggerated chewing and moaning sounds as she worked me in her mouth. No doubt it was another strategy to convince anyone still on the fence about buying a K-Shrink. She spoke with her mouth full, and her voice was so loud to my ears it was almost deafening.

"You see," Kelly said, slurping, "the shrinking process condenses a person's natural flavor, making them tastier than they ever were at full-size! Some of you may scoff, but believe me..."

She opened her mouth, giving her audience a view of my battered, drool-soaked form. I tried to call out for help, but then her tongue rose, sending me sliding to the back of her throat.

"... It's not hard to swallow," she finished.

With a gulp, I was sent screaming down her throat. Kelly opened her mouth to show all trace of me was gone. I landed in her stomach and immediately spit out a mouthful of stomach acid. I could hear the wild applause outside her stomach. How nice to know my death was a nice show! Suddenly, the fleshy walls moved around me, and I was submerged beneath a wave of stomach acid as Kelly bowed for her adoring crowd.

Kelly went about her business for the next hour, selling so many K-Shrinks that she ran out and had to put the remaining customer requests on layaway. I wouldn't be surprised if dollar signs were in her eyes during her sale. When the last customer left, Kelly locked the door and hung up a sign in her store window saying, "Out to Lunch." Her stomach made a gurgling noise and she burped into her hand. It was only then that she remembered me trapped in her stomach, even though I'd been begging her to let me out the entire hour.

"Oh right, almost forgot about you, Greg. Maybe I don't need to go out to lunch after all." She patted her stomach, making everything rumble around me and I began cursing her out. Kelly giggled. "Relax, I'm just teasing you. It's usually against my nature to give up a free lunch, but you were so helpful I'll make an exception. Hold on, this will be a bumpy ride."

All around me the stomach began bubbling like in an enormous Jacuzzi. The walls of the stomach compressed and from beyond the fleshy chamber came ominous gurgling sounds. I felt pressure building up inside, like a can of soda ready to explode. The air began sucking at me and I was actually lifted out of the sea of stomach acid when-

"UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!" ;

Kelly let loose with the loudest belch I've ever heard. The air whirled around me and picked me up like a tornado, sending me rocketing up the expanse of her throat and out of her mouth. I was terrified I'd plummet to the floor below but Kelly caught me as easily as when she'd grabbed me off the floor.

"Ta-da!" she said. "Neat trick, huh?"

My ears were still ringing from the burp but I gave her a sarcastic thumb-up. "Yeah, yeah, you're a freaking goddess among anthros. Now will you please just unshrink me so I can get back to work?"

I thought I saw a look in Kelly's eyes, something that terrified me just as much as when she dropped me into her mouth. Maybe I was seeing things. It might've been nothing at all, but for a wild second I was terrified with the possibility that she might not be able to change me back.

When Kelly opened her mouth she said...
12411.title: Short, Sweet and Safe to Eat

choices: She decides to hold onto him for a while.
She entrusts him with somebody else.
124111.content:
"Now, before I continue, and we start getting all emotional," She defended, raising a pudgy finger between me and her face. "Let me just say that scientific discovery has never been a journey traveled over a long, smooth path paved by nothing but total complete successes, always moving from one discrete location to the next."

"Kelly." I spoke hoarsely, kneeling up on her palm. "Change. Me. Back."

"...and through some of those 'not-total-complete-successes' can come new discoveries, ones that wouldn't have been uncovered had everything gone according to plan!" She droned on, desperation starting to sweat over her face.

"Kelly, take out the growth ray that I know you have in your pocket and turn me back to normal size." I growled, fists shaking.

"Thing such as penecillin, a breakthrough in modern medicine that wouldn't exist today if it weren't for a little mishap here and there, which, truly, begs the question on-"

"Kelly, turn me back into normal size in the next ten seconds, or I swear to god, the only 'condensed flavor' you'll be tasting any time soon'll be Miss Holmes ramming you in the neck with her head!!!"

"And furthermore, what is science but a frontier into the great unknown, much like the pioneers of the new world? How different are scientists to settlers exploring a world totally alien to theirs, with counless vicious, venemous, perhaps legally binding and financially detriment obstacles in their way set out to-"

"CAN YOU TURN ME BACK OR NOT?!"

"Not...legally! Yet." She cringed, her finger drooping. "Or financially. Or biomedically."

"...not yet?" I squeaked, probably too quiet for her to hear. "What's 'not yet' mean? How long is 'not yet?'"

"Well, I have the plans drawn up for a growth device that I'd been neglecting due to lack of need, and I'd sent the patent to my legal advisors and budgeteers last week, so assuming they're consistent, I expect them to both have replied in about..." She scratched her chin along her arm, partly concealing her face behind its paunch. "...four weeks."

"Fuh...huh...fuh-fuh-fuh-four weeks?" I slurred, barely even able to hear myself over the blessings already bubbling in my head that you never realized existed before being shrunk. "Four weeks?! I'm stuck like this for FOUR WEEKS?!"

"N-No, I...I mean four weeks until I know whether or not I can start building two weeks after that, or..." She scratched her chin again, this time higher up on her arm. "...five months."

...and Kelly's arm nearly jerked enough to throw me off as I attacked her draconic hearing with a shriek to the high heavens, now the high few feet-turned-acres between me and her ceiling, my voice pushed as far and loud as it could be carried by the utter rage trying to bloodily explode from my chest. It wasn't even gone when I ran out of breath, and I weakly flopped forward and faceplanted into her palm, tired, tiny, covered in spit, and screaming whatever energy I had left into her scales.

"Maybe...maybe this'll add urgency to the patent!" She offered, only the slightest bit hopeful. "Maybe this'll help speed along the process, out of pity, or desperation? Maybe?"

She probably had a point, but all my brain could focus on by then was debating who I wanted to strangle more: Kelly, or that happy-go-lucky numbnuts named Gregory Wiltsead, the guy who came in that one time two years ago with that dumbass smile on his face, expecting a paid vacation when he applied for a job.

"Now, let it be known that I did have a backup plan in mind for todays's results, assuming everything went under control, Which it has, so I don't expect a few weeks of darkness up ahead for us."

I pulled my head up only enough to leer at her. "Well, it's nice knowing you had the most obvious and efficient solution in mind, then."

"Duly noted." She conceded as she reached into her other back pocket, straining to reach past her overabundant rump before pulling out, of all things, a jar. "If you don't mind, though, it's best to start aquainting with the situation ASAP, to better adapt."
124111.title: Decided to change Gregory's last name.

1241112.content:
The mine cart ride that followed was awkward as hell. Kelly was wedged in her seat and I was inside the glass jar she put me in, bouncing around it with every jostle of the cart on its tracts. I never knew how much I missed seatbelts. I still couldn't wrap my head around this. Five months. I'd be spending five months the size of a speck. And that was being optimistic! Maybe it'd take even longer for the enlargement device to be built, maybe the thing wouldn't work, or maybe I'd end up dead under some careless person's foot or inside their gut before the patent ever came through. It really felt like things couldn't get any worse.

As we travelled in awkward silence, I took in my surroundings. It took a few minutes before I realized the buildings didn't match what I expected, though that could've been because of my impaired view.

"Kelly," I asked, "where exactly do you live?"

"Huh? Why are you asking that?"

"Oh, no reason, mostly. I was just a tiny bit curious about where I'd be living for the next five months," I said sarcastically.

Kelly gave me a look like I was crazy. "Greg, you're not living with me."

"I'm not?"

"No, don't be ridiculous. Look at you! You're so tiny and fragile. You need constant attention and specialized care. I can't give you that. I have a business to run, inventions to create, money to spend! I can't afford to waste time looking after you."

"These were probably things you should've thought of BEFORE YOU SHRANK ME!"

Kelly ignored my outburst. "Don't worry. I may be too busy to take care of you, but I'm leaving you in good hands."

"Who's?"

"You'll see," Kelly said evasively.

That did not sound reassuring. She looked away and ignored my pestering questions about where we were headed. A few minutes later, the cart turned down a track and came to a stop. Kelly got out and carried me with her. It was around now that I got a clear view of my surroundings. Kelly stopped in front of a door and knocked. By then I'd recognized exactly where I was and knew exactly who Kelly was going to leave me with.

Who was it?
1241112.title: She entrusts him with somebody else.

12411121.content:
"MS. HOLMES?!" I yelled from my jar. "Are you out of your mind, Kelly?! You're going to leave me alone with her?! She treated me like an insect before I was the size of one! You can't leave me alone with her, she'll eat me alive!"

"You're exaggerating," Kelly said. It was a bald-faced lie and she knew it. "Besides, we both work for her. I can't keep something like this a secret from her. How do you think she'll react if you never show up for work for half a year?"

"Then make a phone call and tell her what happened, don't plop me on her lap!"

"I... don't think a phone call would do it... See, I kinda, sorta, maybe, somewhat got in a bit of trouble before for testing my devices on employees without her permission."

I rolled my eyes. "Why am I not surprised?"

"Yeah, Ms. Holmes wasn't too happy with me. She actually threatened to fire me. Guess we're lucky I wasn't testing out my disintegration ray this time."

"YOUR WHAT?!"

"Anyway," she said quickly, "I think this situation is delicate enough that I need to explain what happened face-to-face. And you should stop worrying. Ms. Holmes is a professional. I'm positive she'll find a new position for you befitting your... stature..."

"... Really? A short joke."

Kelly ignored me and buzzed the intercom to Ms. Holmes's "office." The speaker crackled before we heard our boss's southern drawl, "Who's there?" Her voice was muffled. It sounded like she was in the middle of eating something.

"It's Kelly, Ms. Holmes. And Greg too!"

"Whaddya two want?"

"There's... been kind of an accident at my store. Um, it's easier to show you than to explain."

Ms. Holmes groaned, unhappy that her post-lunch pre-dinner meal was being interrupted. "Fine. Come in."

She buzzed us in. The way Kelly was entering Ms. Holmes's office was the employee entrance. The actual entrance was over ten times as large. While a lot of anthros towered over humans, some were literal giants. Ms. Holmes was one of those. Her "office" doubled as her apartment and bedroom. It wasn't the fanciest room in all of Gaia, but it was the one decorated exactly to its residents tastes. Ms. Holmes was from down South and she decorated her room with mementos from her childhood.

A gigantic bed occupied most of the room. Ms. Holmes lounged on it, a swivel desk built into the wall beside her. The desk and one of the end tables were both covered in paperwork that Ms. Holmes was filing out with one hand. With the other she was reaching into a bowl of chocolate-covered strawberries and shoveling fistfuls into her mouth. When she polished off the bowl, she'd push a button, and a metal chute would send a cascade of them tumbling down to refill her. I knew that the chute also sent down different foods depending on what she selected.

At over 65 feet tall, Ms. Holmes was the biggest anthro I'd ever seen before getting a job at Gaia. She was always fat but at my current size, the cow looked like a mountain of blubber to me. She was covered in bronze fur and she had golden hair tied in a long braid. She wore a light yellow, sleeveless sundress.

"Ya said Greg was with y'all?"

Kelly walked towards the boss even though she looked scared out of her wits. I could see the sweat on Kelly's palms as she held the jar I was in and hoped she wouldn't drop me. She was usually so confident that it was weird to see her cowering before her planetary-sized boss.

"U-um, yes mam. Greg is... right here."

She held up the jar and Ms. Holmes squinted at the speck inside. It took her a few seconds to figure out the speck was me. She swore loudly.

"Fer the love of--What did ya do this time ya dumb lizard? Were y'all experimenting on tha employees again? I warned ya what would happen if--"

"Greg shrunk himself!"

"What?" she said.

"WHAT?!" I screamed.

Kelly muttered out of the corner of her mouth something only I could hear. "Sorry Greg, change of plans. I'm going to need you to take the fall for me on this. Thanks, appreciate it!"

I couldn't get a word out edgewise before Kelly launched into her new act.

"I tried to stop him, boss! I told him not to go fiddling with my K-Shrink. I told him it was a prototype and that I had no way of changing him back until I could start working on my growth ray! I don't think he was paying attention. Please don't be too mad at him. It was only an accident."

"Ms. Holmes! Don't believe a word of what she says!"

Unfortunately my tiny squeaks couldn't reach Ms. Holmes's ears. The colossal cow rolled her eyes like it was just so typical of me to get myself shrunk to the size of a bug.

"Damn it, Greg! How dumb can ya be? It's a miracle a dim bulb like you could survive this long. How long will it take ya to make your growth ray, Kelly?"

"Realistically? Five months."

Ms. Holmes growled. "That's just great. Give him here, Kelly. I need to figure out what's to be done with him."

"No problem, boss!" Kelly said. To me she whispered, "Thanks for taking the fall for this one, Greg. I owe you one."

"I will murder you, lizard."

Kelly dropped my glass prison into Ms. Holmes's gigantic hand. The jar was the size of the top of her thumb, and I was even smaller than that. The wyvern who got me into this mess turned-tail and ran back through the employee entrance. Ms. Holmes inspected me in my jar. Her pupil was as big as me. She did not look happy.

"Well ya finally gone and did it, didn't cha Greg? Finally got yourself in a pickle ya can't get out of. Just what am I supposed to do with ya? There's no place in Gaia I can send ya where ya can do a halfway decent job. Not that ya could do one even when ya weren't tiny. Honestly. Y'all are more trouble than you're worth."

I pleaded with her, trying to tell her my side of the story, but I don't think she could hear anything but pathetic squeaks.

"I paid for months of trainin' for ya, and now you're too small ta do any of the thangs I hired ya for. And now I'm supposed ta wait half a year before ya can even work again? I'd have ta keep ya on me at all times just so ya don't end up dead. But why should I be nice when it's you're own stupidity that got ya in this mess. I should just save myself a heap of trouble and get rid of ya right now... Yeah... Maybe I should... It is lunch time after all. Even if y'all wouldn't even be a mouthful."

I gulped. It looked like this really might be the end. Ms. Holmes threatened me all the time but she'd kept me around because I could actually do my job. Now that she considered me completely useless, she might be serious about finishing me off after all.

What happens next?

1) The Boss's Assistant - Ms. Holmes spares Greg but in exchange for keeping him alive, she has him work as her personal assistant and whatever possible terrors that involves.

2) Employee Termination - Ms. Holmes decides Greg's too much of a hassle at his current size and disposes of him in some way.
12411121.title: Alone with Holmes

124111212.content:
Ms. Holmes turned my jar over in her hand for a moment, looking me over like I was some knick-knack at a shop. Despite her threat, she seemed to be hesitating on what to do to me.
Her lips were pursed in thought, and I prayed I wouldn’t have to see them from the inside.

Then she stopped looking me over…and just for a second, smiled.

Right then, I knew I was a dead man.

I cringed when I heard metal scraping on glass above me—she was opening the lid.
“Well, Greg; I’m a busy heifer. Better get this over with,” she said casually, and turned the jar upside-down.

I tumbled screaming into her free hand, which she instantly closed into a fist around me. I was hit by a fit of vertigo as she moved me close to her face, staring into her unforgiving eyes. Every second I was begging, pleading, but my squeaks either didn’t reach my bovine boss’ ears, or she ignored me. “Now, ya had a few good moments. That Christmas shindig with the Russkie bear family? That was darn good work ya put in. Same when ya found that turtle kid wanderin’ around and stopped his Ma from suin’ us. But…besides that, ya barely scrape by most of the time, and I’ve got enough complaints from guests that wanted to eat ya, but kept gettin’ stopped by yer friends. And now this? Gettin’ yerself shrunk to bug-size from playin’ with one of Kelly’s gadgets? I just can’t abide that. Something else, I’d just fire ya. But now…you deserve somethin’ SPECIAL, ya little sidewinder.”

She licked her lips, and lifted me above her gaping mouth….
124111212.title: Employee Termination

choices: Greg survives, and tries to get Holmes' attention
Holmes is still hungry, and decides to get something else to eat
1241112121.content:
"By the way," Holmes quipped, clearly enjoying this, "Yer fired."

And with that, she let go and I fell into my bovine boss' mouth.

I won't mince words, I screamed like a little girl all the way down. Like an idiot, I flailed my arms about in the hope that I would somehow steer myself away from the gaping maw rushing up at me...it got me nothing but an eye-roll from Miss Holmes.

*Plop!* I faceplanted on Hiss Holmes' tongue, getting a face full of cow slobber just as her jaws clamped shut, sealing me in darkness. Her mouth started watering almost immediately, and before I could even sit up I was taken by a current of spit, slammed about her maw as she swished me around like a breath mint. I almost broke my legs on her teeth more than once, and nearly suffocated when she pressed her tongue--and me--against the roof of her mouth.

"Mut baff", she mumbled without opening her mouth.

Not bad, she meant. Miss Holmes ate humans who annoyed her: she'd told me that point-blank once, said she'd done it since she was a calf. Not as a threat, but simply a fact of life. If she wasn't hungry, she sat or stepped on them. But hearing that casual, businesslike mumble made it worse. Most anthros viewed humans as delicious...but she acted like I was some cheap snack. Even all the swishing around seemed more out of habit than her playing with her tasty human meal.

I was hit by a wave of vertigo as the world tilted...backwards.
Again, like an idiot; I tried to grab onto her tongue, and the saliva made it too slippery, sending me sliding back towards her maw.

I heard Miss Holmes snort derisively at my futile efforts before I fell down a pit, and with one final earthshaking *GULP!* I was sent screaming down her throat.

Didn't stop me from firing off one last hurrah, though.
"KELLY DID IT, YOU OVERBEARING COW!!"

======================

Toronto sighed, tracing Greg's path down her throat with a finger until the tiny lump in her neck vanished into her rotund belly. She gave it a pat and went right back to her work, barely noticing Greg's struggles in her stomach.

"Hmph. Little twit didn't even taste that good," she mumbled. If Greg was going to screw up that badly, the LEAST the little human could do was be flavorful! He was so bland she'd almost spat him back out. "Ain't ate a human in weeks and I just have to get a bland one...maybe I should keep a spice rack at my desk fer the next human I get to eat, Yeah, that's a mighty fine idea."

She made a mental note to do just that before refocusing on her work....and drafting a notice that Greg's poistion had opened up.
1241112121.title: Miss Holmes Eats Greg

12411121211.content:
Toronto rolled her eyes at the barely-audible shouting coming from her belly. "Ugh, still makin' trouble? Fine, Greg; you asked fer it." She stepped off her bed and got to her feet, giving a crooked grin at her stomach. So her snack thought he could defy her? Well, he had another thing coming. Something Toronto's mother had taught her when she was a calf, the first time she'd eaten a human.

The Tummy Two-Poke.

One hand went to Toronto's navel, the other just below her chest. She couldn't supress a grin, and recited her mom's rhyme.

"One hand down on yer belly button; one hand up top; poke 'em both...and the human is slop!"

She poked herself in both places...and let out a brief mooing cackle as her stomach did its work.

====

The world seemed to lurch. The stomach all around him convulsed and spasmed, knocking him off his feet--and sloshing the acid sea into a massive wave that towered over his makeshift raft.

Greg knew he was done for. He could do nothing but let out an unholy scream as the tidal wave of acids capsized his strawberry raft...and plunged him into the depths to his fate.

He and the strawberry sank vanished into the mire, leaving no trace but a spew of bubbles.

===

Totonto smirked darkly, stroking her ample belly. She'd eaten enough humans to know when they'd fallen into the mire of acids within her stomachs. Their struggles felt...different. More frantic and desperate, than a snack who had found a safe haven: even the tougher humans, who could last for days otherwise, thrashed the same way when their time came.

And all it took to show feisty food its place was two quick pokes to her tummy.

"Works every time...thanks, Ma." Toronto mused, looking at her mother's photo on her desk. The older bovine had plenty of tricks for making sure a human digested properly--and they had always worked perfectly. Now that she thought about it, it had been a long time since she'd visited home; too long. Maybe she should go visit one weekend? Yes, definitely.

Her grin widened--Greg's struggles were already starting to fade. At his shrunken state, he'd be digested in no time, not even getting to her second stomach alive--no less than he deserved, after his screw-up. Even better, he wouldn't send her into a burping fit--that was a problem with eating humans full-size. Toronto made a mental note to ask Kelly for one of her shrinking gadgets--eating humans was much more fun when they were bite-sized! Maybe she could try sitting on them when they were shrunken...?

Toronto gave her stomach another pat, enjoying Greg's thrashes as digestion set in, and flopped back onto her bed, getting back to work as if nothing had happened. As she predicted, Greg's struggles weakened rapidly...and stopped for good less than an hour later.

By the time she had a proper lunch, she had already forgotten his name.
After all, he was only food.
12411121211.title: Cow Food

1241112122.content:
I screamed as Ms. Holmes lowered me to her mouth. I was dead, I was beyond dead, I had driven twenty miles past the border of dead, built a house and become the Mayor of Deadtown, that's how dead I was. I said my prayers as Holmes stuck her giant pink tongue out to intercept me. Her tongue gave me a lick like a lollipop and I cringed as her drool soaked through my clothes. Her breath stank of chocolate and strawberries.

Just when I was certain my life was over, Ms. Holmes pulled me away sharply from her mouth.

"What am I doing?" she asked herself. "I can't eatcha."

"Oh thank god. Thank you, Ms. Holmes, I knew you wouldn't--"

"Y'all taste terrible," she said as if I hadn't spoken. "You're easily the worst tastin' human I've ever had. How can such awful flavor stand out in such a small body? I give you one last job, to be a snack, and you couldn't even do that right? Pathetic." She shook her head. "Ah well. Nothin' for it. Time for Plan B."

"What's Plan B?" I asked, terrified.

"Plan B-HIND that is!" Ms. Holmes lifted her ass and smacked a cheek, cackling at her own joke. Again I screamed and begged for mercy, but Ms. Holmes had none. She positioned me behind her raised cheek and dropped me on the bed. The mattress had been worn down into a permanent indent under the weight of her colossal cheeks, causing me to slide down the slope and leaving me trapped in a crater. I gagged at the smell of sweat.

"Ya gotta kiss a lot of ass to make it far in this business, Greg! So pucker up!"

Ms. Holmes let out another nasty laugh and lowered her cheek slowly. I tried to crawl out of the hole I was trapped in, but it was too steep and the sweat-stained fabric was too slippery. Her butt came down leisurely as Ms. Holmes eased herself back into the bed. She was enjoying this. I knew she didn't like me, I'd been threatened enough before to catch on, but I never realized how sadistic she was. My begging only made her giggle. Now the ass was inches away from me, like the moon falling from the sky.

"MS. HOLMES, PLEAS--"

The full weight of Ms. Holmes' butt enveloped me, the cellulite of one cheek spreading out like an ocean of flab. I couldn't move, couldn't breathe. I could only breathe in the scent of her sweat-soaked sundress. Ms. Holmes enjoyed herself immensely. Even though she couldn't feel me, just the knowledge that I was there, suffering underneath her, was enough for her. She wriggled her tush back and forth to get more comfortable. I couldn't even scream as the immense pressure bore down on me. It hurt. Everything hurt. I felt like an insect underneath a fingertip. A mountain of merciless fat was pressing down on me. It was unbearable. It--

CRUNCH

Ms. Holmes hadn't been able to feel Greg beneath her, but she heard the crunching sound and felt the small pop like a grape bursting. She got up and pulled the backside of her dress around to confirm what she already knew. All that was left of Greg was a small red stain. Ms. Holmes let go of her dress and shrugged.

"Ah well, best start the paperwork to replace him."

And just like that, Greg's time as an employee of Gaia 2.0 came to an end. Specifically, a cow's end.
1241112122.title: Kissing the Boss's Ass

choices: The bat lady demands her money back; Velma takes her rage out on Greg.
12411122.content:
“Oh, Veeeeeeeeelma!~” Kelly sang, her voice accompanied by a fist knocking on a door.

“Velma?” I parroted, confused as I looked up to the neon display right above the doors of Velma’s tattoo shop. “You’re giving me to Velma Krueger?”

“Don’t come in!” Came the irritable voice of Velma herself, matching the tone of numerous signs coating the door reading ‘DO NOT ENTER,’ ‘VIP IN PROGRESS,’ ‘READ THESE FUCKING SIGNS, YOU IDIOT,’ and the like. “I’m busy with a client right now!”

“I was wondering if you’d do me a favor or two, dear? I’ll just be a few minutes.”

“I said not to open the door!” She howled back, her voice nearing a shriek. “I’m working on something really important right no-”

SLAM

Kelly thrust her foot through the door and happily strutted into the parlor, taking route to where Velma was hunched over a customer, a confused-looking bat woman seated with her back inked up in colorful tattoos. I couldn’t even see Velma’s initial burst of anger while her maw was open and locked in terror, eyes jittering at an ugly-looking line she’d permanently carved into her client by accident.

“Wh-What’s going on?” The bat lady asked. “Is the tattoo done?”

Maw still agape, Velma’s eyes widened, shooting between her, Kelly, and the tattoo, then faked a smile. “Nothing! Nothing at all.” She insisted in a fake tone, fumbling with her equipment to find a set of headphones that she tenderly placed on the bat woman’s ears. “Just gotta...uh...refill my ink cartridges! Listen to some tunes, and I’ll be back in a jiff.”

The customer’s mouth furrowed in discomfort, but once Velma could see her head begging to bop to the beat of some muffled music, her facade turned to a snarl of rage as she spun to Kelly, pointing a claw at her. “You better tell me you’ve invented the world’s best tattoo remover before I reach over there and throttle you!”

“Why, Kelly, it’s been a Gaian winter since we’ve last met!” Kelly greeted, her tone implying she didn’t even realize she wasn’t the first to speak. “How’s it been, you old dog?”

I could only wish there were corners in the jar for me to hide into as the Velma stomped up to us, Kelly unfazed by the now-gargantuan wolf’s fury. Even in a good (or, more specifically, ‘not angry’) mood, Velma was one of those women whose presence always carried this angry heat in the air that all directly around her could feel, something that extended beyond the height difference. Standing in at over twenty feet tall, the few-hundred tons of jiggling, meaty bulk she carried around served more as a reminder to everybody how easily you could become one with her adipose than an indication of her laziness. Its main bulk gathered before her in her belly, amassed into a behemothic orb of blubber and muscle containing enough sheer mass to sag onto and engulf an enormous length of the ground ahead of her, its formerly white fur painted with the visage of a Pegasi knight grappling with a feral griffon before a coliseum of hundreds. All accented with expansive thighs containing the lengths to surpass her height and a super-magnified set of breasts pushing for freedom against the restrains of her shirt.

...and here I was, now the size of those teeth I feared being between so much.

“It’s just the darnedest thing, meeting you here, too!” Kelly rattled on. “I’d been in need of some help, just the kind a gal like you could give!”

“The only thing I’m gonna help you with if you don’t fix this is gonna be an ACK?!”

Just before Velma could hold up on her promise of strangling Kelly, the wyvern defended herself in turn by shoving the jar, me shrieking all the way, right into her maw, her teeth and pink flesh surrounding her jaws encapsulating me before she spat it back into her paws.

“You’d better hope you’d cleaned this jar where you find out where it’s going!” She growled, her claws digging into and cracking the glass keeping me alive, but when a terrified shriek escaped me, one loud enough I almost thought it came from somebody else in the room, Velma eased up, realizing that something was inside.

Bringing me up to her face, Velma squinted through the strings of saliva before rearing her head back in surprise, incredulously looking back at Kelly. “Kelly, is that-“

“Oh, I see you’ve noticed Gregory! Poor little guy was playing around with my experiments around the shop, and, well, you can guess the rest from there.”

“HEY!!!” I snapped back.

“Anywho, I was wondering if you’d keep him safe until my in-shrink ray can be finished. Mind being a pal?”

“Uh...” Velma mouthed, only able to take half of Kelly’s story at once.

“Perfect! I knew you’d understand.” Kelly beamed, spinning for the door and strutting away. “Ta-ta, you two! Don’t stay up to late!”

“Kelly, Kelly, wait. DON’T GO!!!”

But my pleas were too distant and too insignificant to stop Kelly from leaving, abandoning me to Velma’s whims.

Fortunately, when I turned back to my newly appointed sitter, Velma didn’t seem particularly eager to chomp me out of existence, but only in that she seemed too confused to be angry, unsure of what to do with me.

“...hey.” She plainly uttered.

I responded with a very lethargic peace sign. “‘Sup?”
12411122.title: New Year’s resolution: do some damn writing.

choices: Velma will give Greg a shot as an apprentice
Velma decides to just keep Greg as a stress toy
124111221.content:
"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!"

I wasn't an expert on animal noises, but I didn't have to be to recognize the cry of the elusive "Bat-Lady-Who-Just-Realized-Her-Tattoo-Artist-Dun-Messed-Up".

"WHAT DID YOU TO DO ME?!"

I was left abandoned on the counter as Velma rushed over to her customer and tried to reassure her that she could fix her mistake. Any hopes Velma had of salvaging her sale were quickly ripped to shreds though, as the bat woman proved to be just as ill-tempered as Velma herself. The shouting match that followed was brutal and throughout it all, the bat woman made it clear she'd only accept one thing as an apology: a refund.

Given that Velma's temper was awful at the best of times, I had no intention of sticking around after she was forced to hand over a sizable chunk of cash. I tried to scale the walls of my jar prison, only to slide back down on my ass time and again. I even became so desperate that I went back as far as I could so I could charge the wall of my prison in a bid to knock the jar off the counter and shatter on the ground. Sure, it was practically suicide, but so was being around the big, bad wolf when she was in a foul mood. All my efforts were in vain though as Velma was finally forced to hand over her customer's down payment.

"I was told you were the best. Pathetic," the bat lady said as a final parting shot.

SLAM

Instantly the wolf's eyes locked onto her newfound, miniscule human pet. A vein was throbbing in her neck. She bared her fangs. I gulped. Seconds later Velma was looming over me.

"You. Cost. Me. Money."

"No--NO! That wasn't me, that was Kelly who interrupted you--"

"That dumb lizard wouldn't even be here if you hadn't been stupid enough to fiddle with one of her inventions and get yourself shrunk!"

"She was lying!"

"NO EXCUSES!" the wolf roared. Literal slaver splattered the side of the glass, causing me to flinch. She grabbed the jar in one paw and began turning the lid with the other. I didn't know if I was lucky or not that the lid was stuck. On the one hand, it stalled my execution. On the other, it was only making her angrier. "I hope--playing mad scientist--was worth it!" she said between grunts. "Because now--you're going to be--my personal--CHEW TOY! ARGH! WHY WON'T THIS STUPID LID COME OFF?!"

"Velma, wait! I'll pay you back!"

The wolf barked out a laugh. "YOU pay ME back? How? I make more in a month than you do in a year!"

"... Really? That's depressing. I need to talk to Holmes about a raise."

"If I were you, I'd talk to her about worker's comp... if you survive."

POP

"HA-HA!" Velma gave a triumphant laugh as the lid finally popped off. I squeaked as she grabbed me between two furred fingers and lifted me in front of her mouth filled with razor-sharp teeth. "Any last words?"

I stammered out apologies helplessly in a stream, while my eyes darted around the shop, hoping for anything that could help me avoid my fate as a doggie treat. When I spied her discarded tools, before I could stop myself, I blurted out, "I CAN BE YOUR APPRENTICE!"

"... What?" Her expression made it seem like she couldn't tell if it was a joke. I wasn't sure myself.

"Your apprentice! Yeah," I said, having no choice but to commit to this half-baked idea. "You can teach me everything you know about being a tattoo artist and I can help you with your customers!"

"Oh really? How are you going to do that, shrimp? You're barely qualified to do your normal job when you're regular-sized."

"Yes--BUT! But, we both know that not all anthros are as, uh, big as you! Some are a lot smaller, some nearly human size! If you had a smaller apprentice to help you, I could do all the designs that you can't do because you're too large--not that there's anything wrong with being large!"

I'm not sure if Velma heard that last part. It was clear she was thinking. "And you could help tattoo my clients in those hard to reach places."

"YEAH! Wait--what?"

"Oh yeah, I get all kinds of freaks in here," Velma said. "One wanted a tattoo on her uvula saying "Welcome to Hell". Another wanted human skulls tattooed on all of her toes. One lady? You don't even wanna know where she wanted ink."

That all sounded... horrifying really, but better that than dead. It'd also buy me time for Kelly to finish an invention to turn me back to normal... if she even bothered. "Sure," I said. "I could... help with that."

Velma leaned against the counter, thinking out loud. "It's true that getting the smaller anthros in here could get me a lot of extra cash from my new customer base... but on the other hand it'd take a long time to train you... and there's no guarantee you'd be any good... and Dr. Olivia said finding an outlet for my anger would be healthier for me... You might just be more useful as a stress toy so I don't lash out at customers."

"But the money!" I squeaked. "Think of the money!"

"The money... right..."

Velma thought. I was kept dangling in front of her, while she tapped a claw on the counter. I waited with bated breath--which, if nothing else, helped me avoid breathing in the funky dog breath that washed over me.

What did she decide?
124111221.title: Be Very Afraid of the Big, Bad Wolf

1241112212.content:
“Sorry, bub, but I need a stress ball a hell of a lot more than I need an apprentice right now,” Velma growled, face creeping up well into chomping distance. “And you know what losing a VIP fills me up with?”

“Peace and...tranquility?”

Her feral snarl was promoted to a smirk, rounding out her lard-laden features whilst her tongue lashed out and glistened her lips, saliva pooling in her maw at the mere possibilities that were to be held with me eight inches tall and at fault for ruining a potential buyer. So accustomed to many morning where I told myself that the day was today, the one where I would meet my end in an Anthro’s digestive tract, I shut my eyes and flipped through the cliched slideshow of all I held back at home, every smile of my family and every decision, whether it be happy, smart, stupid, or something all in between that guided me here, seconds from being plunged into the eternal black.

...but not really ‘plunged’, per se, when Velma instead lowered me downwards, claws separating to let me plop on something too soft and plush to be the floor, nor her fur.

Opening my eyes turned out to be another stupid choice when it was set in that I was placed in a chair, which, obviously conformed to her fat ass, stretched at either side like a red football field. Bending her legs, Velma squatted lower and stretched her arms down upon her colossus of a belly, carrying as large of armfuls of the gargantuan, colorful sphere as she could to hoist it up off its vast coverage of the floor, casting the entire seat beneath its shadow.

“Oh, yeah.” She grunted out through her labored grin. “I’m definitely taking my hour off for this.”

“VELMA, DON’T!!!”

WHUMP


....
.


Velma’s fingers loosened slightly, but with the unfathomable weigh they were carrying, it was all the behemoth of muscle and flab protruding from her needed to descend upon the chair and its untied captive. The arms creaked and flexed against the colorful fur-covered paunch that forced itself into the openings along its design, and a pathetic squeal came from underneath her stomach that was quickly snuffed by all the air in his lungs getting squeezed out of him. The crush didn’t kill him, probably didn’t even break a few bones, likely the same science behind if an ant could survive a drop of several feet, but Velma neither lessened nor steadied in her onslaught.

Yes, the idea of eating the little maggot came into mind as she held him before her maw, one of many ideas that passed by which involved snuffing his life out like a candle’s flame...but then again, ending his life wouldn’t bring her the kind of satisfaction that came from feeling him struggle against her, that he knew she could do anything to him she wanted, and no amount of screaming or kicking would lessen his burden. It felt nostalgic, in fact; it brought her back to high school, when she was just ten feet tall, eight tons, and living in the heels of parents rich enough to buy the school into essentially giving her a license to squash and torment any human students whenever she so pleased. Hell, teachers!

Velma couldn’t even remember the name of the bat-lady from before, well drained of any anger of losing her next pay by that point. She allowed her hands to loosen further, forcing even more belly blubber down that fully enveloped what could still let him feel, and reduced the chair to stool by forcing on even more paunch that designed the arms and backboard entirely. When little movement Gregory possessed was completely paralyzed, still alive, but likely loosing the blood needed to stay awake. She could feel his breathing slowing, getting lighter and lighter...

Then she let go entirely, leaning down with sadistic glee at a wooden crunch collapsing beneath her, followed by a deafening boom as her belly smashed upon the ground like a meteor from the heavens. The circle of floor impacted by her stomach engulfed the chair and its remains in its entirety, as if concealing any evidence of what she was in the process of, and yet, on top of the flattened wreckage, she could still feel the little heartbeat of life in him, just a shorter length of torture away from being annihilated in full...

Choice 1: Velma loosens up. With her anger drained, she does consider giving Greg a job. As a servant, that is.

Choice 2: Velma pulls herself off of him, but she’d not over with Greg just. She’s got a lot more humble pie to serve him yet...

Choice 3: *Cartoony squish sound effect, followed by cartoony wah-wah-wah.*
1241112212.title: Velma decides to just keep Greg as a stress toy

12411122123.content:
Greg's life was dimming underneath Velma's gut. She could feel the little man dying, even if he couldn't move. The power she held over life and death was intoxicating and Velma was growing drunk off it. She imagined all the wonderful, horrible, evil things she could do to her newfound little man. Have him pick the food from between her teeth. Use him as an insole when she went out for her jogs. Drop him down the back of her underwear and just feel him squirm. She was focusing so much on the fun she'd have in the future that she didn't pay enough attention to the here and now, as the pressure grew worse and worse for poor Greg, as his lungs felt like they'd burst from the lack of air, as his skeleton gave way and--

SQUISH

A subtle shift occurred under the wolf's prodigious gut. Velma noticed it and the goofy grin dropped off her face. "God damn it," she growled. She leaned back and pulled up her stomach in great armfuls. "Greg? Greg?"

No answer.

Velma sighed and got up. She checked herself in the mirror and, to her non-surprise, a flattened, lifeless Greg clung to her stomach amidst a splatter of blood.

"Damn it, Greg! I thought you were supposed to be tough," Velma snapped at the corpse, as if his death was his own fault. The wolf crossed her arms and huffed, annoyed at the loss of her new toy before her fun could even begin. She starred at the bloody remains on her stomach in the mirror. For the first time she noticed it looked... kind of badass actually. In fact... it was bitching! The red stain and silhouette of a small body complimented the rest of her tattoos perfectly. She couldn't have planned it better! Velma took a mental picture and went to work.

By opening of business next day, Velma had a new tattoo among the tapestry on her body, one that all the other women who came into her shot complimented her on and asked for ones just like it. Turns out Greg helped her turn a profit after all, and Velma could think of no better reward than having a monument to the moment of his death tattooed on her gut for the rest of her life.
12411122123.title: Wah-wah-waaaaaaaaaaaaaah!

12413.content:
Turning back to her audience, Kelly faked a scoff, swishing her tail it was so it was angled up in the air, curled at the tip.

"NONONONONO, WAI-"

WHAP

From then, after the deafening sound and the feeling of her scales slamming into my side, all of time and space seemed to disappear, that the very plane of existence had disintegrated into a void. There was just pain. Just pain, color flashing in every direction, and the roar of the air whistling past my ears as I felt my body soar like a golf ball through what seemed like the furthest reaches of space, or at least, as far as the already spacious room was at a shrunken size.

I quickly realized I wasn't killed, going by the horrified scream that was running its way out of my throat throughout the entire flight, and none of my bones seemed broken by the way I flailed my arms and legs around in the air. Not that it would last, of course. Once the adrenaline had settled and free thought was once again possible, I fought my hands against the wind to curl my arms over my head, not wanting to see the floor. It wasn't a montage of my life passing through my head; it was all the thoughts of what'd be left to clean up afterwards, probably with a few disgusted guests sneering at my body, all broken and bloody.

Everything went dark even with my eyes clamped shut, and I counted off my last seconds, wasting them by wondering who and what I could possibly dedicate my final thoughts to...

WHUMP

...and it was pretty damn soft, not that the impact hadn't knocked the wind out of me. Every bone in my body was shaken up, my head too battered to register anything but the sudden whiplash, but I thankfully remained intact, and it was with a lucky grab in the air that I caught a hold of something, hanging off of it.

With a few panicked breaths, my brain accustoming to the fact that I'd survived, I looked around as I hung with my stomach against something wide, soft, and blue, my eyes still too blurred to make anything out. I could tell my feet were dangling over a whole lot of nothing, so I slowly pulled myself up along the lip of whatever I'd clung onto, avoiding the urge to look down as I brought my foot up and needled it into the pocket, then straddled up so I could work the next one in, following with the rest of my body.

...Ah, fuck. I silently realized, lest I make a sound. ...a pocket.

A pocket to a pretty damn big pair of pants, I could tell, and even then they were tightly packed, with whatever contents I stood upon most likely flattened. Looking to the left, I could see the other orb to what I could tell was a truly titanic behind (now expanded into an awe-inspiring national monument to my shrunken eyes), the pants so taut around their owner's legs that the butt crack conformed between their cheeks threatened to rip them in half if whoever carried it had so much a wafer thin mint.

It was also much darker, I could tell afterwards, and I looked downwards. I gave a whistle, legitimately surprised by Kelly's precision when I saw that my "savior's" ass was tightly packed into one of the Diamond Mines' mine carts, one larger than the one I was riding in minutes ago. The rat in charge of the controls actually struggled to push the door closed with her passenger's mass all bunched up against the walls, but with her cheeks puffed out, she managed to push the door in until it clicked shut, and wiped a bead of sweat from her forehead as she got back in her station.

As the motor was clicked on (the epidermis beneath the denim vibrating slightly), I thought over my plan as all of us were pulled out of the station, holding in the tempting urge to swear revenge on Kelly.

Okay...just wait around for the next stop, try and find a place to jump out, and find Kelly. I thought over, but shook my head at the ending of that idea. No, no...maybe miss Blanc? It probably the forever to get to her, and even then-

But my thoughts were interrupted when I saw a large, furred hand out of the corner of my eye that reached down towards the other cheek, their owner's thick, doughy fingers scratching along her behind. What came next was a great void despair that ate up every organ in my chest, and I shuddered at the realization, suddenly terrified at the notion of who I was adhered to...

124131.content:
Up above, Carly reared up her snout as she felt her own behind, a smile shuddered along her lips. Only then did I recognize the scent of the Cluckbucket's secret sauce, something I damned myself for not noticing sooner. She didn't have her mane tied back in a bun, allowing it to flow freely down her back, so I could clearly tell she was just coming back from work.

After she'd caressed herself to her satisfaction, she turned her eyes back on the tracks ahead, bringing her hand back up to belch into her fist. I could hear a wrapper to something be torn apart, and her body resonated as she gave a hungry moan, loudly biting into whatever super-sized junk food she'd ordered.

Okay, now. I thought, not thinking of anything further than that. Get out now. Get stepped on, maybe. Get kidnapped and eaten, sure. Just GET OUT. NOW.

But in two large bites, her mouth was already freed to lick her fingers clean. She crumpled up the wrapper, and I held in a squeak as her hand came back around her back, coming towards my pocket with the balled paper!

I almost drew blood as I bit my tongue, holding in a whimper, and I inched my way towards the very edge of the pocket, but at a snail's pace, too fast to doge her hand in time...
124131.title: Carly Sorvitz

1241311.content:
Carly's hand drew closer and closer. " I have to make it. I HAVE TO MAKE IT!" Greg shouted in his thoughts. The thick hand was practically over him. Then...

*WHUMP*

Carly's hand made it to the pocket and stuffed the wrapper inside, all the while feeling the shrunken human. "What the hell...?" Carly said plucking Greg's miniature form. Holding him from the back of his shirt, she held him close to her equine face. "H-hey Carly... what's shakin...?" Greg awkardly asks. "Greg Wiltsead!? How did you get so small?" She paused of a moment before resuming her qeustions. "And what were you doing on my ass?" Carly rubbed her rear. "It's kind of a long story..." Greg said. "Wait, I think I know what's going on." The zebra woman gave him a slutry look. "you do?" The human asked back. "I knew that you couldn't resist my jiggly booty, so you shrunk yourself and climbed on to it to get a bit of private time with it. But unfortunately for you I had to cut it short. But action speaks louder than words." The zebra woman giggled a bit.

"Whatever. Could you take me back to Kelly so she could unshrink me?" Greg asks Carly. She jokingly puts a finger under her chin.

"I don't think I'm going to do that Gregkins." She said.

"You're just a cute little human. What if an accident happened and you got caught in it? Nobody would be surprised would they?" Greg couldn't believe what Carly was suggesting. "And from that accident, you were no where to be found. Your dearest lover, Carly, found you and took you into her love and care. Where they both lived happily ever after together, doing whatever their heart's desired." Carly moaned a bit at the thought. The human was speechless.

Carly licked her lips. "But for that dream to become a reality. I need you to... "disappear".." The zebra chuckled a bit sinisterly.

Greg was terrified. Not knowing what to do he tried his best to escape from her grasp. But try as he might, he didn't get very far. "Can we talk about this?" Greg asked. "I don't think you're in a position to be making demands, my adorable little man." Carly cooed. She resumed to talking after she caressed him to her cheek. "And since I'm in a really good mood. I'll let you decide where you're gonna disappear. So many choices." She brought Greg closer to her maw, her warm breath ran over him as she open her mouth wide. The fat zebra brought Greg into a bear hug, squeezing him into her boobs. Greg was blushing as red as a tomato right now. What with the kind of treatment he's been receiving.

"So what'll it be? How do you wish to "disappear?"" Carly held Greg out in front of her again.

"I choose..."

12413111.content:
