Stacey quickly thrusts her head forward and snaps her beak shut over the last of her prey. She feels her throat with a loose hand before pointing at it.

Inside, Greg couldn't move. His body was constricted by the force of Stacey's gullet. "Things cannot get any worse right now..."

*GULP*

Stacey swallowed hard and followed Greg's descent with a finger. She moaned when she felt him plop into her stomach. "Aaaaahhhhh, that really hit the spot." She sighed, her tounge hanging and while pating her belly. Many shouts of colorful vocabulary escape Stacey's insides as Greg pounds away at her stomach walls. "STACEY YOU PAMPERED FATASS!!! I CAN'T BELIEVE YOU ACTUALLY ATE ME!!! COUGH ME UP THIS INSTANT!!!

Stacy just giggled at her belly, watching the various lumps form on its surface. "I'd watch that tounge of yours if I were you. I can make your stay in there... uncomfortable." Without any warning Stacey began to grunt as steam was wafting off of her feathers. The inside of her stomach began to feel more like an oven, and it was cooking Greg. "OKAY OKAY YOU'VE MADE YOUR POINT!! Greg pleaed. Having heard that Stacey stopped.

The birb relaxed as she had her hunger stated. She kneaded and rubbed her belly, getting a bit excited when ever she felt Greg struggle about. This was the first time Stacey has had a living being inside of her, and she was really enjoying it. "Oh my. You we're quite the tasty little morsel..." Greg pounded on her stomach wall. "...oof, feisty too. I might have to do this more often." Stacey chipped.

A couple of minutes later reinforcements arrived. Gertrude was the first to enter. She approached Stacey and saw Greg no where to be seen. "Hey where did Greg go?" Gertrude asked Stacey. "Who?" "The human that was with you." "Ooohh.... hiiim. I don't know. And I couldn't care less. He has no respect for people like me. Beautiful. Charming...." "....bitchy...." Gertrude said under her breath. "Well whatever, let's get you out Miss Ghray." Firmly grabbing the top of the phoenix, Gertrude pushed down with all of her might, causing Stacey to pop into the pool below. The sudden movement jostled Greg's fleshy prison, getting thrown about as Stacey floats to the exit.

She began to climb out of the drop pool, grabbing any unopened candy bars that Greg smacked into the water and felt the weight of her previous meal weigh her belly down. "And I still have my prize." Stacey lifted her pudgy tummy before dropping it, watching it bob up and down "LET ME OUT OF HERE!!" The voice inside of her yelled. "Oh that won't be happening for a loooong time. Don't think I don't remember what you did. Smacking my food away like that." The Phoenix turns to look behind her. She sees her smacked away snacks floating. Most of them were soggy. Others beginning to sog. She stuffed the ones she grabbed back in between her cleavage.

Walking a few steps she saw a crate with attached wheels and a note on it. Stacey inspects the note.

(Take this food crate as a gift of apology. Let's just keep what happened between you and who ever assited you.)

Sincerely. T.H.

"Free food! I'm not complaining." "of course you won't, fatass. "Watch it, pipsqueak. I can make your stay a living hell if I wanted to. You're at my mercy. Don't forget that." Stacey growled then punched her stomach, but smirked. She waddled over to the nearest showers. Approaching it, she gets into one of the shower stalls, opens her maw and sprayed cold water down her gullet. When it reaches her stomach the water trickles down and douses Greg, making him scrunch up from the cold. Once she feels like she's had enough, about half way, she stopped. Stacey feels all of that cold water sloshing around in her. "Wow this feel greats." Stacey placed both hands on her belly, feeling how cool it got. The white phoenix grunts again she starts heating up her insides once again. This time the water she drank begins to turn to steam with no where to escape. Her stomach was now a hot box of vapor and cold water.

"Enjoying the sauna in there?" Stacey retorts, hoping to make Greg's stay as uncomfortable as possible. Greg had no idea how to feel. His bottom half was cool and his top half was warm. It surprisingly... felt amazing. "This honestly... feels great right now." Greg spoke. Stacey's face was flushed with embarrassment. "NO! YOU'RE SUPPOSED TO HATE IT! NOT ENJOY IT!" she yelled. Stacey was annoyed.

"Whatever, I'm not letting you out for a VERY long time." Stacey puffs out her cheeks. She stormed off pushing her gift crate with her.

"Stupid human... ruining my fun... I hate him..." Stacey grumbled.

Where does Stacey storm off to?
131322.title: Stacey just grabs whatever's in reach.

choices: Greg manages to keep the situation going in his favor.
Stacey eventually catches onto his trick.
1313221.content:
Considering where he was and who he was inside of, all Gregory could think to do was curl up on to of Stacey's partly-digested breakfast before both he and it would sink down into her stomach juices, with nought but their sloshing around to keep him company as she trudged off somewhere else into the resort, probably her bedroom, leaving him but an afternoon nap away from ceasing to exist. Not wanting the darkness of an anther's digestive tract to be the last thing he'd see, he tucked his head under his arms, reminiscing of whatever trivial accomplishments he'd made that all carried a chance of lasting more than a decade. At least half of one, he hoped he was lucky enough.

"Oh, don't be so sullen!" Stacey teased, sensing his mood from the lack of movement inside of her. "Couldn't some consider it an honor to become one with a body such as mine, to be immortalized as a few extra inches of curve on a figure that'll be seen and fawned over by countless people? How many humans have you ever known to live with such fame?"

"Well, since you say it like I'm going to magically remain sentient enough to live and see all this..." Gregory thought bitterly. "That leaves me, what, ten days after you leave the resort before you starve yourself sick for your next shoot?"

Stacey tittered. "Well, a good model has to maintain some bounce, so there's a chance I might leave you untouched!"

"What a fucking deal." He deadpanned.

Minutes later, Stacey had reached her room and drew her key card into the lock, and Gregory immediately thought the worst upon hearing a light beep before a door was swung open. Brimming with excitement, ready to escape into a deadly food coma and wake up with plenty of extra poundage on her engorged form, Stacey waltzed right over to her bedroom door, no sparing anything a second glance that could distract her on the trip to her next nap.

Nothing, that is, except for the smell perforating her skull from the parcel she'd been carrying from the beach, even through the thousands of bars' wrappers. She plopped the box on her mattress and ripped through the tape with the point of her beak, the golden foil inside almost shining in their own heavenly glow with the bedroom's lights reflecting off.

"Oh, yes." She growled, seeing at least twenty favors of chocolate just from the surface. "Truly, you all offer the best of tastes..."

Rather then torture her tastebuds with too many seconds deprived of flavor, Stacey grabbed a mound of bars in her wings and bit straight in, beak and tongue slicing through several layers of chocolate, caramel, nougat, peanut butter, and marshmallow rich enough to stave off the taste of foil and paper. Cherishing them all in one gulp, she exhaled in bliss, but chortled in delight upon feeling the unchewed bars rain down into her stomach.

Covering his head from the falling debris, Gregory drew out his lighter and turned on the flame, observing the slabs that he felt land on his lap. Surprised, he held the light up to the labels of Gaia 2.0 chocolate bars, some split in half, but some not even torn open.

Well...it's some compensation. He thought glumly. Despite a thin glimmer of spit clinging to the paper, none seemed to have seeped in as he tore the foil open at one end and unsheathed the bar, its surface still nice and dry. Biting into the corner, he himself found it hard to taste one and imagine not immediately get as big as Stacey was from eating them, his teeth cracking through a brittle layer of chocolate and slicing through the soft, buttery layer of caramel underneath.

"You know, kinda doing a bad job of making my last moments feel...wait..." Gregory stalled, thinking back on Stacey's attempt to fry him in the Glass Tornado.

"Come again?" Stacey asked.

"H...Help!" He yelped, trying to sound terrified. "Help! HELP!!! I'M ALLERGIC TO CHOCOLATE!!! SOMEBODY HELP ME!!!"

"Poor choice of a work field, then." Stacey mused, tilting the package back and licking her lips. She pulled her head back, them swung it own as hard as she could and frantically began swallowing mouthful after mouthful of chocolate, ones so big that her cheeks and jaw ached. She didn't acknowledge the growing tautness in her belly till was pushing the box away from her, having distended by an extra foot or so, but she merely rolled forward and dove up to her shoulders in the box, beak and tongue lapping up chocolate as fast as they could without her wings grabbing them.

"ARRRRRRRGGGGHHH!!!!" Gregory screamed through a mouthful of chocolate, scooping up as many bars as he could before they could land in her stomach acid. "AAAAAAAAAUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHH!!!"
1313221.title: Her apartment, she needs to drop off her gift

choices: Gertrude stops by to investigate Greg's disappearance
Greg tries to formulate an escape plan
13132212.content:
"I'm dying!" Gregory wailed. "I'M DYING!" Greg put his all into the act, wailing and screaming as if he were in hell itself, being tortured. It helped that, if he didn't figure a way out of here soon, he really would be dying. And unlike a certain phoenix, he doubted he'd rise from the metaphorical ashes of Stacey's waistline.

The phoenix rolled her eyes and stopped snacking. "C'mon, human. I may enjoy your internal massage but all this screaming is grating on my ears. Did you expect digestion to be a walk in the park?"

"You don't understand!" Greg said. "I'm allergic to chocolate! Just touching it is making me swell-up and break out in hives!"

"Cry me a river," the phoenix said.

"You're the one who's going to be crying!" Greg protested. "Have you ever digested a human having an allergic reaction before? I've seen it before! It's not a pretty sight. Most anthros are up all night with stomach cramps--and there's gas! Terrible gas! Trust me, your insides are going to be tied up in knots before it gets through with me!"

"... Really?" the phoenix asked. She sounded interested. Greg might just succeed in getting out of here.

"I swear to God, it's true!" Greg said.

There was a long stretch of silence.

"Pleasepleasepleasepleaseplease..." Greg prayed under his breath.

Stacey sighed. "Fine. I'll let you out."

Greg's heart swelled with relief! He did it! He was actually going to get out of here and this dumb bird didn't have a clue--

Suddenly, the bird's stomach contracted around him like a fleshy trash compactor. He felt air rapidly leaving the stomach. But any hopes to join it were short-lived as the phoenix let loose a world-ending belch.

"BBBBBBBBBBBBBBWWWWWWWWWWWWWWAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRR RRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPP!"

"Ahhhh," Stacey sighed, patting her stomach, tongue lolling out of her ebony beak. "Human and chocolate. Tastes just as good the second time around."

"Stacey? Stacey!"

"Hmm? Oh, I'm sorry dear, when I said "I'll let you out," did you think I meant you? Nonsense. I meant that burp. It's been building up for a while now, but I couldn't let loose out of the privacy of my abode. What would my adoring fans think?"

"B-b-b-but... what about what I--"

"Oh please!" the phoenix scoffed. "We both know you're bluffing. And if you're not? Well, I've had difficult meals before. I'm sure I can get through it," she said, kneading her stomach and pushing Greg against her fleshy walls. "Time will prove which of us is right, though. Until then, I'm finally stuffed, and I think it's time for a well-deserved food coma."

"You can't be serious--"

"Of course I can, my dear," Stacey said, pulling open a drawer next to her bed and taking out a pair of noise-cancelling headphones. "Now, be a good treat and keep up that squirming. It feels delightful. I'm sure it'll put me to sleep right away. And, in case I awake and you have shuffled off this mortal coil, I just wanted to say... You're welcome."

"WHAT?!"

"You're welcome for the privilege of becoming one with the most beautiful phoenix in the world. I assumed you wanted to thank me before the end. So, you're welcome."

Greg screamed and punched at her stomach with newfound fury. Stacey had to bite her beak to stop herself from giggling at his struggles. She leaned back in bed and put her headphones on, at once silencing her unruly meal. Within a few minutes, she was snoring softly.

A few minutes after she'd fallen asleep, Greg realized there was no convincing her to let him go. He might really die in here. He took the handful of chocolate bars he'd stopped from falling into her stomach acid and began using them to line the mound of food he'd previously been lying on. Already the food pile had shrunk, so making a buffer was the most necessary course of action. Afterwards, he sat down and tried to think calmly.

He needed to figure a way to get out of here on his own. Either that or wait for a miracle.
13132212.title: Stacey eventually catches onto his trick.

choices: You work at the bar, and an anthro comes over, asking for a drink.
You work at the bar, and a drunk anthro comes over, asking for a "dance..."
132.content:
"Yo, Gregory!"

I turned around. Standing some feet away on the sand was Mavis, waving me down with a small smile on her beak. Her massive, blubbery figure was packed into a bodysuit made out of thick rubber, which had two clear plastic domes visible over either shoulder along the back.

"Hey, Mavis. What's up?"

"Not much, but I'm gonna need a hand with setting the Aurora up. Hop on!"

Mavis shuffled around, flicking her back to fling open the unzipped chamber along her left shoulder blade. I grasped onto the plastic rungs built into the legs, careful not to make too much unnecessary contact with her colossal rump as I climbed over and clutched onto her pods's handlebars, reaching around to pull the chamber back down.

Mavis tugged at the head of the zipper, sealing me within the cramped pod. "Ready?"

"Yup, I'm ready."

Mavis waddled along the sand into a path signed for the Oceania: the largest swimming pool known to either of our worlds. It didn't have the illusory treatment as the beach pool did to look infinite, but standing on the edge, it's furthest ends still seemed to hang far in the horizon, longer and wider than a dozen football fields.

"Hold on!" Mavis called back before tilting forward, and she dove so smoothly into the water that I didn't feel her body hit the surface.

Her feet expertly paddled into the darkness of the deepwater, ignorant of how round the rest of her body was. Far around us, the walls of the pool were covered by windows and doors to rooms built within, like we were swimming through some sort of ancient city that'd sunk beneath the ocean eons ago, but a few lights coming through the murky haze nixed that image.

The light above the surface had trouble reaching us the deeper we got, and the water around us was as dark as midnight, save for a scribble of purple neon lights somewhere in the corner ahead. It got colder, too, but thankfully Mavis' natural padding felt incredibly warm beneath her body's plastic covering.

"Alright, we're almost there!" Mavis called through the water. Even underwater, the doors to the club were given the complete treatment with a synthetic red carpet affixed to the floor, spotlights flanking the entrance, and a bright, enormous marquee overlooking the path inside with vibrant neon lights glowing on the borders, a pink set for "The Aurora" title plastered over in cursive.

The bouncer immediately stepped aside for Mavis. Inside, we glided through the underwater section of the club, which had tables, a bar and dance floor built into the ground, but Mavis swept up and broke the surface, paddling up to a staircase leading up to the ground.

"Alright, the Aurora!" She announced, unzipping the suit and shaking the pod open so I could slide back down onto the icy floor. Her tightly compacted mass sprung outwards an extra two feet in every direction once the suit was removed, but foremost with her belly, which slammed onto the ground in a pompous, yet saggy globe of blubber covered in slippery feathers.

The lights in the club actually came through the floor in a pale white glow, casting an eerie aura on the cavern-like chambers of the arctic resort. It wasn't just during the winter; year round, an chilled mist hung around the ice-coated walls, condensing my breath and causing me to shiver.

"There's an extra coat for you in the jacket hangar." Mavis noted, adjusting her waitress uniform.

"Thanks. So, how can I help things out around here?"
132.title: You're Needed in the Aurora Night Club

choices: It doesn't take too long to familiarize her, and you head back to Mavis.
It takes quite a bit longer than you expected, and it's time for a break!
Mavis offers refreshments before the club gets hopping, much to her delight.
1321.content:
The gigantic penguin waved an enormous, blubbery arm at the DJ booth, which was seemingly vacant for now. Most everything in the resort was reserved for residents of colossal sizes, and the booth was no exception. It was a monolithic plinth, decorated sparsely thanks to the ice, and fitted with equipment most radio DJs could only dream of at the least, the most sophisticated and state-of-the-art decks and mixers, and some not even on the shelves yet. Easily fifteen feet high by twenty or thirty so feet wide, and easily expandable thanks to the way the ice was molded against its framing, it was a monstrous obelisk of monumental decadence and achievement that befit the massive resort. I looked at it quizzically; certainly, I was a man of many talents so far as the resort industry went, but I wasn't particularly adept at mixing music and creating playlists for an entire clientele...

"The sound booth? But, Mavis, you know I'm not-"

She waved her arm again, chuckling this time and causing her bulging mass to quake. "No no no no! You've got it all wrong. I'll need your help elsewhere tonight, but right now, I could use your expertise and advice getting the new girl to fit in. It took a lot of finagling to get another human in here, and especially one that's pretty well known for being good at her job. Running the sound booth at the Aurora Nightclub is a specialized job which can usually just be filled by current staff but...I managed to convince Miss Holmes to get a much better person for the gig who can also help you out if need be."

I blinked. Another human? Seeing humans in this place was rare enough, at 500$ a pop for a VIP pass! Having another one hired was even more ludicrously rare, and you were more likely to find diamonds in a pig trough than to actually see one! Coughing slightly as I tried to get my wits about me, wondering if Mavis was pulling my leg this time, I motioned for her to lead the way and show me this brand-new addition to the resort staff. The massively fat fowl beamed at me before waddling towards the booth, footsteps shaking the ground ever so slightly as I followed after her. Her bloated rolls squished and rolled together across her leviathanic frame, a curtain of obesity that was known as the highlight of the Gaia 2.0 resort experience. I was curious, actually, to see the new 'girl' and see what kind of human they managed to hire to work down here in the Aurora...

Mavis stopped slightly short of the podium, placing her huge hands on her even larger hips. I could hear something from the inside, rummaging around in the equipment, and the sight of a utility ladder caught my eye. That was one of the tools I used if I ever needed to clean much, since here, everything else was up-scaled for the colossal residents and staff. It couldn't be... "Kalinka! Come on out and greet your coworker! I told you there was another human working here!"

"Miss Mavis! Wha-MPH! Buh...chyort.." A soft voice called, a definite accent present from the eastern bloc of Europe, and I could almost feel my eyebrows sliding into my hair as I witnessed the newest addition. The girl crawled out, right around my age, but it wasn't the fact that she was small or that she was human that really caught my attention. It was her clothing.

Stepping out from the chasm of the sound booth was a girl wrapped up in all colors of the rainbow, meshed together with a classical, almost 1920s-ish ensemble that reminded me distinctly of jazz and the Great Gatsby. Sunburst-colored hair, natural or not, flowed from underneath the flamboyant fedora, tied up with a mass of ribbons on the braided side, and wound through on the bobcut side, the fringe of her bangs shadowing two strangely-colored eyes, with rings of purple and yellow that filled the iris. They had to be contacts. To complete this absurd, punkish and clashing look were the bar tattoos, three of them, going across the bridge of her nose and the two tiny lip rings at the corner of her mouth. I was used to gargantuan furries parading around the establishment. This was the strangest thing I had ever encountered in my human existence yet. Staring in utter shock, I hardly noticed as she took stock of me, her slightly unsettling eyes widening before she clapped her hands happily, grinning. "Oh! So this is Mister Gregory you were referring to! Da! Sehr gut, sehr gut! So good to make your acquaintance! You have no idea how well-known you are, da, being the first human here and the longest-serving! I didn't believe Miss Mavis when she told me, but I'm so glad to meet you in person!"

"Er..pleased myself, Miss Kalinka...um..." I stuttered, stunned at her appearance. Mavis chortled, a deep belly laugh that sent her mass quaking again. Looking back from her to the new girl in front of me, I sighed a little, gulping. "So...er...Mavis. What exactly do you want me to do?"

The penguin nodded, her many chins wobbling before she stroked them with thick fingers, looking down at her two coworkers. "For starters, she doesn't mind the cold as much so you don't have to offer her a jacket. She needs a bit of help rigging some stuff up so she can reach all of the interfaces up there...a lot of them are holographic, but at the same time the controls are made for fat hands. She'll probably rattle off a lot of questions to you as well; that's pretty much normal. Er...I'm not so sure how the food really will affect her so...give her a couple warnings. Sure, she'll end up bigger eventually, but being a human, I really don't wanna know how badly it'll go if she lets too loose. She'll be doing the show tonight during hours, so keep an eye on her to make sure she doesn't vanish among the sea of flesh you know tends to come around!"

I nodded, still a little unsure about this. She was bubbly, eager to work of course, and was running a stream of jumbled sentences in several different European languages. How she could keep track of all the dialects and particulars she was going through, I had no idea. Still, I coughed a little to get her attention, those eyes locking onto me. "Alright, Kalinka! Let's get started..."
1321.title: The New Girl

choices: Skip to tonight, and see Kalinka in action!
Stick with them getting everything ready, and/or something interrupts them.
Maybe you had something else in mind?
13212.content:
Mavis waddled off to check up on every other detail of the club while Kalinka and I got to work hooking up the DJ booth, which entailed unboxing and laying out the equipment, arranging the displays according to the map Mavis'd laid down for us, and of course spinning a giant spiderweb of wires underneath the podium that linked all of the equipment and displays together on a crucially specific network. It still took around two hours to dig through over half of the workload, even with the two of us maintaining a decent, moderate pace with one another. Honestly, I felt like I was the one holding the other back, seeing how Kalinka made arranging her getup look as natural as speaking, which was pretty damn amazing for someone working in the freezing cold with no jacket. Even if the thin language barrier was a distraction.

"Alright, how're you guys faring, so far?" Mavis asked as she reentered the dance floor, having set up the tables for the night.

"Pretty good..." I called back, kneeling in front of the podium to plug in a few more wires, while Kalinka inspected her 'studio' as she called it. "How long do you think till we're done, Kalinka?"

"Soon!" Kalinka chirped, shooting us a thumbs up. "We shall be up and singing in one hour!"

"That's good to hear. And hey, why don't you guys take a break?"

"Eh, I could go for one."

"Yes!" Kalinka approved.

"Alright then. Fifteen minutes, and here!" Mavis reached into a bag hanging against one of her lovehandles and tossed us both a can of soda, pulling out a much larger one for herself as she trudged back to her side of the club.

"So, Gregory..." Kalinka leaned over the dashboard, gazing down on me with her chin resting in her palms. "What is it that you do inside of the Gaia?"

"Well, I'm what's known to staff as a 'choreboy.'" I explained, snapping open my soda. "If there's anyplace in the hotel in need of extra staff, or if there's a guest with a special request in need of human interaction, they'd send me over to take care of it."

"Such as?"

"Anything, really. A spare lifeguard, a bartender, waiter, masseuse, pretty much every conceivable job known to man." I snickered.

But in a surprising flair, Kalinka crouched onto the dashboard and hooked her legs onto the lip so she could swing over the podium's mouth, dangling upside down over the ledge so she we could see eye to eye, her hair hanging loose in a waterfall of orange. "Is there anything that I must learn about life in the Gaia?"

"Well, uh..." I scratched the back of my head. "...well, you probably don't have to worry about it as much as I do, but with the size difference and all between anthros and humans, there's sort of a balance to maintain between how far and how far you can get to them, thanks to certain...well, instances that can happen when they're grabbing for things to eat."

"Ah." Kalinka calmly agreed, expertly swinging back up to grab her soda from the station. "Anything else?"

"Well, Mavis also kind of wanted me to warn you about eating right here."

"Eating right?" She asked, cocking her head to the side.

"Well, it's just that most food around here isn't exactly the healthiest to eat all the time, and with most of the VIPs we get around here, there's a bit of a tendency too...well..."

But with perfect timing, a loud belch rang from across the club, where Mavis sat drinking a barrel of soda. I merely pointed her out, making Kalinka giggle. "Oh, I see!"

She bent back up and slinked back into her new dugout. Curious, I got up and walked around onto the steps leading into the DJ station to join her, but I was surprised enough by the workspace she'd created for herself that I forgot what I wanted to say.

True to her DJ expertise, she'd laid everything out in a clean, gorgeously organized manner. The panels were filled with bright, colorful displays, turntables, sliders, and neon decoratives in a way that it looked like her own high tech laboratory, a loy more impressive than the wired mess I still had to work out. There were even controls affixed to the ceiling.

"How're you gonna get the ones up there?"

"That's the question!" She beamed, holding the body of the wheeled ladder.

"So, how long've you been in the DJ business?"

"Many, many years, since I was just a small child." Kalinka explained. "I'd been born to the string, but sometime many seven years ago, I'd uncovered the world of electronics, and it brought music to life beyond the string! It's the music of the mind, not the hand!"

"Huh." I uttered plainly, walking along labyrinth-like array of audio controls and displays. I'd never been a huge of electronic music, but I'll admit I never thought of it that way. "I couldn't even name the first thing about all this stuff."

"Well, it needs a life of duty and passion to fully see!" She noted. "You can come in here sometime so I can show you a few, if you'd like!"

"That'd be fun!" I actually smiled. She was actually starting to get a nice spot with me! "Anyways, mind giving me a hand with the wires, when we get back?"
13212.title: It takes quite a bit longer than you expected, ...

choices: Mavis comes with some good news as cleanup starts!
The portly penguin has to deliver some underwhelming results...if just a tad.
132121.content:
Kalinka had eagerly agreed to help me with the rat's nest worth of wires sitting underneath, which connected her sprawling, organized displays of audio units throughout the gigantic sound booth, chugging down the soda and using that apparently undiminished reserve of bubbly energy to assist me, plowing through the final tasks with ease as the day rolled towards the evening. As we were getting the finishing touches ready on the massive, almost starship-like interior of the booth, I noticed a few guests starting to trickle in, the ludicrously large, lardy, beefy patrons of the Gaia 2.0 Resort piling in for the evening's festivities. During the daylight hours, the Aurora was mostly empty save one or two getting specialty drinks at the bar which couldn't be made at the buffet, but at night, it turned into a stunning display of the most flexible and energetic guests as they partied into the early hours of the next morning. It was quite a sight to see, if at the least for laughs as the enormous partygoers mashed and flubbed together on the dance floor, coupled with the other bodyshapes interspersed between the sea of flesh.

"Here they come. What do you plan on doing? I mean, are you nervous about this at all, considering the clientele?" I ask as we plug in the last few cables, the interior of the booth beeping softly before all the displays hum to life, LCD monitors and neon LEDs of all colors filling it in a swirling kaleidoscope of light, Kalinka grinned widely at me as she keyed up the main controller, soundboards, mixing and turntables coming to life with a small tune of affirmation, the speakers in the facility buzzing as power surged to their cores. If anything, she was certainly fearless!

"I plan on giving them a show! And I won't hide at all. If you're out on the floor, look at the booth. Usually, the glass is mirrored, but I added a couple tricks to the interior, da? If anything, I'm going to be main attraction~!" She brought the wheeled ladder beside her, spinning it lightly as she widened it to give the structure some stability. Sitting up on one of the rungs, she started to establish a connection with all of her keypads and materials, ticking it off the checklist as the Aurora Nightclub began to fill up. Initiating her chosen music media program to begin her show, she smiled at me again. "If you are worried, don't be. This is better than former Yugoslavia, at the very least!"

"What was wrong with Yugoslavia?" I asked, raising an eyebrow and wondering if it was the brunt of a joke.

"Deep bass freaked everyone out when it rattled the windows of eight or so street blocks. I got into quite a bit of trouble with that one~" She stuck out her tongue before letting out a titter of merry giggles, checking the time on her main display. "Oh, you better get going! Miss Mavis probably needs your help! I've got it under control here."

I nod before extracting myself from the completely refurbished booth, the interior glowing like the heart of the Grid. "Good luck!"

She gave me a thumbs up before sliding on a pair of custom earphones, plugging them into the mixtable as she began the countdown to her show.

- - - - - - - - - -

I trotted over to Mavis, the blubbery penguin woman crammed into her uniform for the night and sucking down another barrel of soda, perhaps a bit nervously. It had taken a lot of work to get the sound booth set up in Kalinka's custom and specialized gear, and if something went wrong, it might as well be her head as well as Kalinka's being served on a platter. Toronto Holmes was not wont to simply fire employees, but her punishments were more than harsh enough that they wished they had been fired. Her mammothic stomach gurgled deeply in a bit of distress, a belch and hiccup escaping her beak while a plush palm rubbed at her overly swollen middle. I patted a roll of thigh that spilled next to me, looking up at Mavis with a bit of concern. "That bad?"

"Maybe a little, Gregory! First time getting another human on staff, and to top it off, it's her first night here at the Aurora. On my recommendation. I don't think it'll go wrong, but Murphy's Law has been known to rear its ugly head."

I shrugged a little, looking towards the booth as the normal floor music filtered through the speakers, the lighting underneath the frozen floor illuminating to the beat. The overheads dimmed a little, music dying down as the spotlights and ambiance started to crank up, Kalinka working her best at the booth to get the right mood for her entrance. "Well, I think she's resourceful enough. If there's something wrong, she's probably planned for it."

A huff passed her row of thick chins as they quivered and she shoved a couple snack cakes into her maw to keep her nerves from getting to her too much, stomach whining as it reflects its owner's state of mind. "Oh I hope so...!"

She wasn't to disappoint. Kalinka cracked her fingers like a piano maestro before she began to play, a melodic, soft, cheery tune rolling out from the speakers as she manipulated the sliders to get the perfect balance. The CD deck hummed happily as the lights begin to pulse and glow in time with the upbeat music, floating throughout the Aurora Nightclub. It was her own version of swing music, electrified for a more modern touch and given just a hint more bass so it didn't just get your nerves moving, it got your entire body moving to the deep rhythm that pulsed from the speakers. At first, it was like this, electro-swing and swingstep playing merrily along with a dance beat that couldn't be outclassed by regular everyday tunes I could pull from the radio. The sharp, distorted sounds of trumpets and trombones complemented the rolling bass which caused the facility to quake slightly with every beat, shaking the flesh of the patrons on the floor.

It didn't stop there, I noticed, as it rolled into soft dubstep, drum and bass, and several other genres which slowly mixed and melded into a long, combined rhythm which electrified the room. Whatever her magic was, it certainly worked on the enormous guests which filled the club, smiles and laughter all around as the Aurora Nightclub really started to get pumping. I remembered what she said earlier, about watching the booth, and as I turned to face the soundbooth where she was supposed to be hidden behind a wall of mirrored glass, my jaw dropped.

She must've installed a black light or something! A neon glowstrip or something, as a silhouetted outline of Kalinka hopped and danced to the beat of her own music inside of the room, her bangles, hair, and the brightly colored garments she had on flashing between each of the glowing controls, an occasional disembodied flash of her pearly whites breaking the illusion of a partying shadow. My foot was tapping to the music as she rolled from genre to genre, an endless cascade of satisfying jams which filled the air. I looked up at Mavis, grinning a little. "She didn't disappoint, did she?"

"Well, I have to say it's quite a lot different than what I expected! It certainly fits! It's almost as chaotic as she is. We'll see what the guests have to say afterwards, and if she did well, I'll treat her to something after work as a job well done on the first day," Mavis replied, eyeing me with a twinkle.

"Alright, but what if she doesn't do quite as well as you think?"

She pursed her beak a little, folding her blubbery arms. "I'll get some training done with her, see if we can't make a personal mix for the nightclub...after all, I let her go wild here. Of course, Miss Holmes might have something a bit more serious in mind, but we'll cross that river when we get there."

And thus, the flashing lights and sounds streamed into the night, the bottom of the gigantic pool alight with the funk and rhythm of the newest addition...for better or for worse, the morning soon came.
132121.title: Electrosonata in RGB-Minor

choices: Go to the next day, and follow Kalinka through her job at Gaia.
Skip some time forward, when Kalinka's much more accustomed!
1321211.content:
Without the crazed hubbub of the partygoing guests that'd been flooding us, a silent whine seemed to hang over the club once the entire club was cleared out, save for a few littered cups left on the dancefloor, along with Kalinka and I scrubbing up the leftover trash.

"Well, what did you think?" Kalinka asked.

"I thought it was great! You were amazing up there!"

"Spasibo! Thank you!" She enthused. "...and what had Miss Mavis thought?"

"She thought it was one of our best shows ever!" Mavis squawked ecstatically, shuffling up to fast that she could've easily tripped on and rolled over her own gut. Kalinka and I were far apart enough that Mavis could grab us off the ground by either arm as she slid between us along the ice, victoriously skating around as she hugged us tight against her heaving chest. "We'd made more sales from that show then we'd had the entire year!"

"The entire year?" Wow. Accomplished by a human in Gaia? Call the papers! "That's amazing!"

"...and I owe it all to you, Kalinka!" I swear, Mavis sounded like she was on the verge of kissing her, she was so overjoyed. "I'd done a great good in choosing you!"

"Oh, just another walk in the park for me!" Kalinka shrugged off, jumping between both a swedish and russian accent. "But Gregory here was still an irreplaceable gift!"

Mavis settled down a bit, taking a few calm breaths, and smiled at me approvingly. "You, too, Gregory. Couldn't have seen tonight through without either of you!"

"Eh, just doing my job. Or jobs."

Mavis gave an amused snicker. "Sorry about that. C'mon, I'll take you back up and take care of the rest myself."

.....


Kalinka and I each took a pod on Mavis' back on our trip back to the surface. By the time we'd made it back to the poolside and she'd let us disembark, the screens on the Glass Tornado's dome were emulating a serene night sky, with a full moon shining its reflection on the quasi-ocean.

"Night, guys! Great work today!" Mavis beckoned before diving back down.

"See you round, Mavis!"

"Bye, miss Mavis! I look forward to our further acquaintanceship!"

And with that, Mavis disappeared into the pool, leaving me and Kalinka alone.

"Well, good night, Kalinka! it's been really nice meeting you." I held out a hand for her to shake. She looked down at it and up to me, but rather than take it back, she stepped up to me and grabbed me in a friendly, yet surprisingly tight hug for somebody as short as her.

"Good night, mister Gregory! It's been wonderful meeting you!" She beamed as she broke away, giggling at a blush I could feel warming onto my cheeks. "You are a very cool guy."

"Thanks...you're pretty cool yourself."

As more eloquently as it could've been, Kalinka nonetheless smiled and skipped off, waving goodbye at me. "Bye, bye!"

"Goodbye!" I waved back, watching her till she rounded a corner and out of sight behind some trees.

I could better hear some mellow hula music playing somewhere in the distance now that I was alone, and I took a breath to finally settle down for the day, gazing up at the fake sky. It'd been pretty...interesting, to say the least, but at least there'd been plenty of color and excitement to relish in that I'd never seen for a while. On top of that, I'd made a new friend. A friend I could look in the eye!

I smiled at the day's former energy, standing still in the plaza before I started for the route back to the employee suites.
1321211.title: Mavis comes with some good news as cleanup starts!

choices: "I find it cute. You're so embarrassed by it, it's funny!"
"We have a few good staff members on site I can ask about helping you!"
13212112.content:
A month or so goes by, and all is well with Kalinka settling into her job at the Aurora, I noticed. Her events drew the largest crowds, and even if she wasn't doing a full show, the ambiance she offered permeated the establishment and seemed to soak into the patrons, turning the environment into a club that's always buzzing with energy, even when the night was over and it was time for cleanup in the morning. Mavis was beside herself with joy at how popular an attraction the Aurora had come to be, with none of the hype dying out after a few days or a week or two as Kalinka kept the entire music stash she had fresh with new tracks when she could get them, as well as remixes done by her in order to make sure the club never got stale.

I did keep a close eye on her, however, to try and make sure she didn't blow up like the rest of the residents, as Mavis had asked. With the amount of successes she had, it was something common to see Mavis herself giving her a couple extras during the afterparty or treating her to a couple extra special snacks. Sometimes, the patrons slipped her one or two extra drinks as well, the occasional dessert or hors d'ouerve, leading to her having to take them in order to be seen as polite. I watched her as she tried to keep such a thing to a minimum, even posting a sign that said "Please don't feed the DJ!" to try and deter party members from slipping her too many extras.

It wasn't to last, I saw, as she steadily grew over the weeks. A button loose here, a popped seam there, a tug of the shirt down on occasion, and soon little slivers of soft flesh were pouring the gaps as I watched her walk away from the booth after a good night. Deep blushes and nervous giggles followed the sounds of her seams popping whenever it happened, and she took to hiding from both me and Mavis whenever incidents like that happened, and the next day she had a few more colorful patches covering the holes in her slacks along with newly-sewn buttons with plenty of play. Still, she grew bigger, and bigger still, I noticed.

Until one day, Mavis and I noticed that she was gone from the DJ booth almost as soon as the night finished. The blubbery, bulging giant of a penguin lumbered over, more than a bit concerned as she watched Kalinka's habits grow odder and odder over the past few weeks, her even larger frame quaking with every movement. "I could've sworn she was here earlier....I saw her light show over the crowd, and she freaked out quite a bit during one of her dance numbers in the booth. After that she seemed fine but..."

"As soon as the lights came on and she shut it off, she ran to the back really quick," I finished. I had noticed it. She skittered out with that newfound chub wobbling on her frame, hands clasped to her backside to shield it from prying eyes. I could only imagine what actually happened. So far as heading up to the surface, Mavis was the only one who could taxi me and her back at this point, with the underwater shuttle having shipped all the guests up at closing. "I'll go look for her."

Mavis nodded, her even thicker chins meshing with her bulk as she began to stomp away, fat feet causing the floor to shake. "Alright, just be gentle with her...maybe I have been giving her a bit too much on the side..."

"You and everyone else here. You like her that much!"

"Hey, don't say you don't like her too!" She quipped back before going to get a broom, wanting to get the litter cleaned up off the dance floor.

I blushed a little before shaking it away, concentrating on finding the AWOL DJ who had obviously experienced something unsettling. As I moved my way back towards the storage area, where props and other party favors were kept along with the entrance to the pantry, I heard soft, musical muttering as well as a couple of hiccups, most of it panicked and nervous. Looking around the corner, I found a tall and a bit wide shadow hiding towards the back, Kalinka's obvious sense of style sticking out like a sore thumb thanks to all the flair. She was stroking her middle and grabbing at the newfound fluff, squeezing her soft lovehandles and fretting about her size. Something else was off about her as I stepped around the bend, coughing a little to make myself known. "Hey there! You kinda had us worried..."

The larger Eastern European let out a sharp squeak before turning around, blushing darkly underneath her hair. Turning around to face me, I caught sight of what had been causing her so much distress: she was quite a bit bigger than she was before, not just in girth but in height! She was taller than me, easily over six feet, and to add that, she was a good hundred or so pounds heavier which gave her the fluffy, pear-shaped frame she sported. Looking her up and down, I witnessed the shrunken legs of her slacks, her shoes starting to tear thanks to larger feet, and how she had been doing all she could to keep her clothes from riding up on her considerable new width. Despite all this, the silence was broken by her stomach rumbling, causing her to mutter a soft curse before she hung her head in shame. "D-da...now you see why I've been hiding..."

"Kalinka, you should've told Mavis! At the very least she'd listen to you, even with the guests trying to slip you drinks and food. You could've just put it all aside and eaten it later!" I said, feeling my heart wince as she flinched a bit at my tone of voice.

"I-in my culture, it's impolite not to accept gifts! E-especially from co-workers, supervisors a-and clientele! I-it's a sign of good faith! I-I'm paying for it, t-though...verdammen, I mean, I-I'm taller than you...a-and I know it's something you looked f-forward to, s-seeing someone your own height..." Kalinka replied, fiddling with a couple of her ribbons on her arms, twirling them about her slightly thicker fingers as she looked away. She wasn't like the others here, that was certain; unlike most of the guests, who reveled in their absurd displays of gluttony and growth, the Euro girl was bashful, perhaps a bit afraid of her new size and maybe...worried about me? I sighed, rubbing the back of my head.

"Well...it's not that bad yet. Besides..."

Miss Blanc! (Use magic to take the easy way out?)
132121122.content:
"I bet there's a lot of people in the hotel who could help us out!"

"Really?" The interest was very clear on her face.

"Sure! I think we could try..." But the more I thought about it, the more I realized how little people in the resort woere good at being not fat. Could Mavis help?...nah, she already knows and couldn't add anything. Maybe Garnet could...nah, she's just a slacker at gaining weight. Maybe Oliv-nope. Nope. No way. Nu-uh.

"Gregory?" Kalinka asked. "Do you know anybody who could help?"

"Well, come to think of it, there's not many around here that are really the fitness type, but...hey, wait a minute!"
132121122.title: I'll add the next one, too.

choices: Let me cast a spell from one of the old tomes...I'm sure it'll work!
A special brew should do the trick. I know a few that are what you need...
1321211222.content:
"I know someone who might just be able to help. She deals with magic...crazy, I know, but we have a good shot with her if I know it. Her stuff does work! To be fair, I've never actually tried any of it, but certainly, if it works on anthros and the other guests, it should work on humans just fine," I mention, remembering the colossal, room-filling moth woman that was a near-permanent resident thanks to her sheer size, her suite comprising of at least two rooms that had to be periodically expanded thanks to her vastness. Despite her obscene girth, she was one of the kindest and quietest members of the Gaia resort, keeping to herself but offering reprieve whenever someone needed it. It wasn't quite a getaway, but I DID enjoy her company, even if a quarter of the time was spent watching her glut herself just a bit more. Kalinka looked a little stunned as I mentioned magic, but knowing this place and what it was doing to her already, she shrugged, grinning sheepishly.

"Alright then, tovarisch, lead the way!" Kalinka cheered before feeling the breeze of the Aurora's cold environment brush across her exposed belly, multicolored eyes widening a bit before she giggled nervously, the thought of going out dressed in tatters of her old outfit a little more than embarrassing. "Erm...do you mind if we get me something else to wear? I can't just go w-walking around like this out in the resort, da?"

I suddenly realized the implications as I stared at her exposed figure, the fluffy pear-shape leaking through her pants and shirt as the front buttons were completely decimated by her newfound flesh, flashing the black bra she wore underneath, along with her puffed-up assets and fattened tummy. Staring at the muffin top a little while longer, I was lost in thought before she coughed, just a bit of a warning that I was debating a little too much and spacing out. "Sorry! Yeah, let's go get you something else to wear..."

- - - - - - - - - -

It didn't take horribly long to explain the situation to Mavis, who was pretty sympathetic when she realized that her own habits had been rubbing off too much on Kalinka, despite her words at the beginning of her gig at the Aurora. For a temporary fix, she gave her a large, white shirt fit for bartending duties as well as a wrap to keep around her waist to hide the tears in her slacks. The shoes we couldn't do much for, but so long as they still worked, Kalinka could wear them. Mavis taxiing us to the surface was also going to take a lot longer than we really needed, so we managed to catch a monorail up to the Aether Suites, where our destination lay.

Kalinka had never been in the Aether Suites for any reason since she had been here, content to stick around her room and make sure to keep out of trouble, which was a plus for us. Seeing the vast building in all of its decadent glory nearly floored her, with the scope of the hotel stunning her into silence. It was made for clientele of much more towering sizes-Miss Holmes herself was around 50-60 feet tall! Needing height to match the girth of most of its guests, it was a colossal undertaking similar to the scale of the pyramids at Giza, or even the Roman coliseum. As I began to walk away from the station, I had to tug her along thanks to her awestruck mind, watching as her eyes swam at the grandeur and glamour of the residency. "C'mon, we don't have time for sightseeing. It'll be better if no one catches us here. We'll be home free in Miss Blanc's room, but we've got to move."

"D-da! Ich bitte Sie!" She sputtered as she tripped over her own larger legs, a blush on her cheeks with her stumbles. The Aether Suites were usually no place for a human unless there was maintenance to be done-for us to be here now was certainly a troublesome occurrence, and if one of the guests besides the ones I was friendly with found out...

Well, it was certainly going to be unpleasant for both of us. How unpleasant depended on Miss Holmes' mood that day. Thankfully it didn't take me too long to find Miss Blanc's quarters; her rooms were some of the largest thanks to her indomitable girth. Looking at the near hangar bay-sized doors that would open up into the massive moth's suite, I rang the doorbell gently, hoping that she was awake and not totally engrossed in a new RPG. With my luck, I heard the soft voice flutter from the speaker, a sigh of relief passing my lips. "Yes? Who is it?"

"Miss Blanc? It's Gregory!"

A pause. The sound of a drink being slurped. "Oh, Mister Gregory! It's been a long time! I know Miss Holmes keeps you busy, but I've been missing your company. I liked our two-player free for alls!"

"Yeah, she hasn't given me much time to myself as of late. I'm the jack of all trades, what can I do?"

"Scheduling a visit more often would be a start," she offered, giggling softly before clearing her throat. "So what can I do for you?"

I look around, watching Kalinka gaze at the corners of the massive hall nervously. I knew exactly what she was thinking too; after I told her about some of the things that certain guests of the hotel do to humans...especially to the other staff. Realizing that time was of the essence lest we get caught by the more unsavory members of the clientele, I replied, "Miss Blanc, could you let me in first? I have a friend that needs a bit of assistance, and...well, I'd rather not get caught out here, especially with us needing to be on duty."

The gigantic moth woman paused as she contemplated this. I sweated a little, wondering if it was too much to ask a friend, especially of her status.Hearing the thundering footsteps of the colossal furry residents in the background, I was more than wholeheartedly going to resign myself and Kalinka to finding someone else's help at this point, not wanting to stress out Miss Blanc with another request like this. Grabbing Kalinka's cool, sweaty palm before starting to tug her away from the door, I heard a window-shaking belch erupt from the speaker, the leviathanic moth huffing a little and tittering. "O-oh! Pardon me, Mr. Gregory! I was just finishing up a snack....here, let me open the door!"

A cry of relief issued from the tubbified DJ while I dragged the back of my hand across my slick forehead, relieved that she had just been eating. Loud clicks and churns come from the doors as the giant mechanism which operates the massive entryway starts to unwind, releasing the doors just enough to allow me and a thicker Euro girl through. "Thank you so much, Miss Blanc!"

We slipped inside without a second thought, the doors groaning before the mechanism began to slide them shut once more, hissing softly before creaking with the gentlest slam.

- - - - - - - - - - - - -

The titanic, overfed, plush mass of fat wobbled below the platform we stood on, a huge LCD TV extending from the ceiling in front of it, casting a bright, artificial glow onto our figures. Miss Blanc's face was surrounded by a mass of thick, beefy chin rolls, propping up enormously fat cheeks that quivered with every snack that she levitated into her hungry maw. Her bulk was covered by soft, fine fur, the volume adding to her already ludicrous size, and I could swear that she was growing bigger with every bite. I even heard the room creak softly, a testament to her ridiculous girth, and her bulky little hands pattered at the controls of her game, nearly nestled within massive pillows of flesh she called her arms. Kalinka was too stunned to speak, staring at the sea of impossibly fat moth. I could only assume that her mind was roaming at the possibility of her own body exploding outwards like this.

"So! What brings you here today, Mister Gregory? I see you brought a new friend...and a human too! Though, she's quite a bit plumper than I expected..." The colossal moth woman mentioned, smiling widely. I blush a little, and the colorful DJ manages to wave nervously, still thoroughly intimidated by Miss Blanc's immensity. Hearing her refer to Kalinka, however, I knew it was going to be quite a bit easier to explain.

"Well...she does, actually. She's been trying hard to keep a good diet, but unfortunately, Mavis' habits and the guests' gifts have sorta made her blow up. She was five-nine when she got here-now she's even taller than me! It's worrying her quite a bit." I motion towards Kalinka, who was now nervously playing with her belly fat. The mass of moth beneath us hummed quizzically, taking a bite out of a huge pizza that she was eating like a small bagel, her flesh almost seeming to puff up before our eyes.

She answered after another minute, not unkindly, "I don't see any problem with getting bigger, but I understand she'd be worried. She IS a human after all, and for her to be exposed to our meals like this is startling. I know a number of aethereal techniques which should be able to help..."

Kalinka was nearly floored with happiness as she bowed gratefully, nodding feverishly before she caught her hat as it tipped over. "Y-yes! T-that would be fantastic, Miss Blanc! I...I would like to be small again..."

A lilting giggle floated through the air which tickled our ears, Kalinka sputtering at the gentle sound which seemed to appeal to her auditory expertise. "Then it's settled. Now, I can give you two things..."

(A/N: Sorry for taking so long!)
1321211222.title: No problem, I got it!

13212112222.content:
"...and I think I know just the thing you two would like!"

Miss Blanc swelled out her chest with a deep, heavy breath, gently shutting her compound eyes as she raised both of her arms, her stubby black palms facing us. From deep within her throat came a loud, swarming hum that resonated past the copious flab filling her body and vibrated through the air, tickling straight into my heart, and I assume Kalinka's as well, who visibly flinched at the same time as I.

Behind Miss Blanc, the bookshelf that covered the wall rattled as numerous bottles standing upon the shelves shook in place. Miss Blanc's humming didn't seem that loud, I thought, but the assorted trinkets actually fluttered off their spots and floated through the air, hovering around in the air above her. A mixing bowl from the top shelf joined in, and the bottles poured their diversely colored fluids straight into the mixing bowl, which erupted a rainbow's worth of clouds of smoke between each addition. Miss Blanc's humming rose several octaves, and the bowl floated in front of us to see the clear pink fluid inside shivering under the buzzing sound waves, which actually seemed to help the ingredients bond with one another.

Finally, when her pitch reached its peak, the bowl gave an orange explosion that made me and Kalinka jump. When the subsequent black smoke drifted away, what was left was a pure, crystalline transparence tinted by magenta.

"...it is done." Miss Blanc whispered. She floated a ladle into her hand and took a scoop filled to the brim with the pink-lemonade looking potion, offering it to Kalinka.

"...what's this?" Kalinka wearily asked, swishing the potion around.

"Nothing toxic. Just drink it in full, and by the night is done you'll be as good as when you arrived."

Kalinka's mouth stretched as she brought the potion closer to her face, but she nonetheless threw caution to the wind and drunk it down in an impressively quick swig.

She tossed the ladle back to Miss Blanc, which froze dead in midair before it could hit anything, but she expectantly looked back down at her belly, clearly dissatisfied that it didn't deflate then and there. "When will it happen?"

"Give it a few hours. Let it have a chance to know you." Miss Blanc noted sagely, turning back to a grocery bag stuffed with cheeseburgers, which she started stuffing down by the fistful. "Anything else you guys would like? A drink, or a gaming session?"

"Nah. Sorry, Miss Blanc, but technically we're still supposed to be working."

"Oh! Well, I guess you two better get back to it, then!"

"Yup. See ya, Miss Blanc!" I bid, skipping a few steps on the platforms ladder as I made my way down. Kalinka followed, but with understandable difficulty.

"Danke, Miss Blanc! I'm in debt for your kindness!"

"Goodbye, you two! See you around some time!" Miss Blanc waved goodbye, then whipped out a game controller hitting the power button to the console as we shuffled out.

With everything set, the two of us headed for the monorail station as swiftly and quietly as we could, but the bar was set pretty high on account of Kalinka's weight.

"So, how do you feel?"

"Honestly?" Kalinka patted her distended belly, smiling lightly. "It feels good!"

"Great to hear. Let's go!"

Conveniently, the monorail was just parked at of the station when we'd arrived, and the two of us managed to scrounge an empty car in the back, left alone for the journey back to the Glass Tornado...

.....


The next few hours went through the usual procedure for hooking the place up, but with a nice amount of weight lifted of the three of us' shoulders, some more than others. But as the day kept going into the night, I could sense a bit of worry from Mavis as she occasionally glanced at the DJ booth, worried at each sight of a still unskinny Kalinka wiring the displays.

"So...any luck with that friend of yours?" Mavis asked hopefully.

"She said it'd take a few hours, so I'd say we'll see results any minute now." I recited. "It needs to know her."

"Well, I'm all for first impressions, but I still wanna know if one of my best workers is gonna be alright to work tonight!"

"I'm sure she'll be alright." Come to think of it, Kalinka'd been acting fairly "alright" for most of her weight episode, considering.

"All done here, Miss Mavis!" Kalinka cheered from her station, somehow to both Mavis' joy and nerves. "I could play to my heart's content now!"

"Great to hear, Kalinka...Anything else I should know?" Mavis pressed.

"Well, not that I can think of, but...gh...oh!"

From across the club, I could see Kalinka clutch her stomach and hunch over, letting out a grunt in discomfort. I was a lot quicker than Mavis was in running over to the DJ booth to see if Kalinka was alright, '

"Oh my god, Kalinka, are you alright?"

"I...I feel..."

She never got the chance to finish as her body started to change. Underneath the coat she wore, I could see her body flatten out, for a fraction of a second's fraction filling me with joy at our little journey's success, but snapped back, to my horror swelling out past their former girth.

"Kalinka, what's happeni..." I could hear Mavis run up behind me, but she fell dead silent, backing away from what I could only assume was today's worst possible outcome coming to life.

Slowly, but with a growing pace, Kalinka's breasts swelled out several cup sizes, even for her expanding scale as her body stretched up another few inches, the tips of her shoes shredding apart to expose two rows of pudgy toes with nails painted black. Her stomach bloated out further and further, growing until her marshmallowy flesh puffed out of her shirt till it was only covered down to the belly button. However, most strikingly of all, her butt just kept growing, and growing, and growing, and growing. Her leg's expansion dominated the rest of her body's as the weight of her ballooning thighs kept sagging on top of the almost elephant-thick girth of her calves, unleashing a symphony of tearing that shredded through a good dozen areas of her pants, exposing her dough-like skin to the Aurora's cold air.

The entire time, Kalinka's eyes were clenched shut as what must've been an army of sensations clamored against her body, till finally she sputtered to a stop, barely clothed in the remaining tatters of her colorful getup. Her eyes innocently fluttered open for the first time since growing, able to see me and Mavis gawking at her, utterly horrified.

Choice 1: Understandably, Kalinka flips out!

132121122222.content:
For a mercilessly long stretch of time, the arctic breeze whistling through the club was the only sound to be heard between us three. Kalinka's eyes pointed down her body, growing wider as she crawled back into full reality from the sensory overload she'd just endured, while Mavis and I could take the full brunt of what happened in absolute horror.

"K...Kalinka?" I spoke. "...are you alright?"

Kalinka's face went as awake as she could be, but despite all the (non-literal) blubbering we'd seen out of her, she didn't seem the least bit sickened by the sight of her new, oversized body. Curious, in fact. She'd finally expressed motion by moving her hands beneath the underside and lifting it up a few inches, then dropping it back down, popping off another button from her shirt in the process.

She craned her head back to look down along her back, eyes going huge at the mammoth pair of buttocks that flared from her rear end, the fleshy globes tearing themselves a nice window into their shadowy valley by the tear growing at the very back of her belt look. She pressed her palms into her hips, partially touching the exposed skin jutting from the rips along her jeans as she took in that her behind was, indeed, the behemoth each of us were all seeing.

"...Kalinka?" Mavis peeped.

...and then, against any remote sense of human logic or the absolute terror Mavis and I'd endured, she smiled.

"...hmmmmmm!" She hummed, fingers coming back up to stroke along the vastly exposed skin of her belly. "This...I'm feeling great! Moshchnyy, in fact!"

"Alright, what the actual hell is going on here?!" Mavis demanded, with me thinking just the same.

Looking around a few times, Kalinka turned her attention to a row of barstools bolted into the ground. With surprising grace, she spun around and shuffled backwards towards the seats, lowering her seismic arse down on top of three all at once. Their heads were utterly engulfed by the soft weight of her but dropping down and squeezing through the gaps, crimping a bend into each of their poles.

"I feel with great vigor! I mean, back then I was such a small one, but now..." She gave her belly a gentle smack, unleashing a ripple that tore off yet another button, flaring out more skin. "...I have such body!"

Mavis and I stepped up before the row of seats. She rose back onto her feet, and was going to say more, I could tell, but then she looked at me. She really looked at me, giving me an interest that she'd never given me before, even as friends.

Me standing in my spot felt all the more stiff, especially as she came my way, coming incredibly close...

"...and you, Gregory..."

...and snatched me up to give me a hug tighter and squishier than any of the goodbye hugs she'd often give out.

"You are absolutely adorable!" She squealed, pressing my face right into her cheek.

"Mph! Klnkpha, hld mm!"

"Uh...easy, there Kalinka..." Mavis asked, trying to calm the shakes in her voice. "...I'm sure you're having fun, but let's just take things one step at a time, alright?"

"Oh! Entschuldigung..." Kalinka let me go for air, setting me back on my feet. I stood in place, watching Kalinka as she turned around and skipped away, humming, but my eyes didn;t suck in and digest the image.

What I could digest a lot better was Mavis' face looming over me when I turned around, with enough of her face peeking over her belly and breasts for me to see her leering back with a hellish glare.

"You...have...killed me!!!!" She seethed through a clenched beak, bending forward with each word.

"Mavis, I'm so sorry! I swear, Miss Blanc's never messed up on stuff like this before! I had no idea this was gonna happen!"

"Well, Miss Blanc's better know how to run a DJ booth, and own a forklift big enough to lug her ass around, 'cause what the hell can we do, now?! We go on in twenty minutes!"

"I know! Just...just lemme think, alright?"

But when I stepped around to face the dance floor, Kalinka did all the thinking for me. Mavis herself I could hear pausing at the sight, before shuffling her great bulk around to follow my lead.

Somehow, with all the grace of a ballerina, Kalinka was jovially skating around on the icy floor, spinning with a grace you wouldn't see from somebody half the size se was now exploring.

"...we might live through tonight." I observed. "Maybe if that's how easy the show'll be, we might have an extra day or two for Miss Blanc to make an antidote. How's that sound?"

My words hung around as Mavis stayed silent, but I could almost see her face and shoulders drooping as she let out a tense, yet relaxed breath.

"If tonight's a bomb, you'll be her weight trainer."

1321211222221.content:
Kalinka's upbeat personality after her abrupt transformation to an even more towering, bottom-heavy fatty was more than a shock as Mavis told her to get ready for the show, the auburn-haired girl agreeing far too quickly despite her recent change of circumstances. Her enormous, quivering moons bounded slightly along with her immense, rippling thighs that tugged at what remained of her outfit, the DJ not even shedding her torn shoes as she trotted towards the sound booth. Thanks to its overall size, she was a better fit than one might expect as her hips slid past the icy walls of the DJ booth. It wasn't long before she was readying up her station once more, her girthier backside helping her in reaching the upper decks while simultaneously providing a much better cushion than the seat she had could ever be. Still, I couldn't help but hold a sense of trepidation, sweating a little despite the cold.

It was then that the leviathanic mass of Penguin waddled her way over to me, her rolls spilling across the icy floor as she folded her arms up. "I seriously hope you're right, Greg. If this doesn't go well, it's all of our heads."

I gulped, nodding a little. I had some confidence in this plan, having seen Kalinka playfully shuffling about despite her much larger frame, but watching her squirm inside of the booth and try to get a bit more comfortable worried me.

"The show must go on," I muttered a bit glumly, hoping that tonight's show was as much of a success as her previous ones.

- - - - - - - - -

The night was a complete smash, if not even moreso thanks to the size of their musical host, I noticed. As I helped keep the bar running for Mavis while gigantic, lardy and beefy beasts tore up the dance floor to the rampant beat of electroswing, I kept glancing back to see what Kalinka would do with her much wider body, trying to fit it all in the booth.

I wasn't disappointed by her ingenuity.

Taking some spare neon paint that she had laying around so that she could see the buttons and consoles inside of the DJ's box, she had spread it with her chubby fingers across the vast expanses of her thighs and her stomach, her fluffy rolls adorned with swirling designs and eye-catching flair that quaked and quivered as she danced about as much as she could without destroying her equipment, a flash of pearly whites on a pudgier face letting me know that she was having just as much fun as before, if not more due to the bounciness of her fat. She partied it up with the best of them, Kalinka's thunderous steps rolling in tune with the music as she swapped tracks like a master, never missing a beat despite her lardaceous figure.

"BRAAAAP! Oooh, sorry, Greg. Seems like you were right though. Despite being much more of a fat ass than she was before, she's...well...still got it," Mavis finished lamely, having been chugging down soda like a woman possessed as she awaited the clientele's reaction to the much fatter European woman. She rubbed at her temples, slamming an empty can down on the counter near where I stood. "Pleeeaaase tell me you have some aspirin or somethin'. My head's pounding from the stress egg I was nesting on..."

"Sure, Mavis. At least it turned out well in the end, right? Well, besides the fact that she grew so huge," I offer, putting out a bottle of aspirin fit for someone of the penguin's stature. Watching her swipe it up and down it, I looked back at the DJ booth, the lights flashing and the floor lighting along with the melody pouring from the speakers. I was almost entranced by the wobbling waves of fat flesh that the sunburst-haired girl was displaying before I remembered what I was doing, turning back to the owner of the Aurora Night Club, "Good thing is it buys us time until we figure out what to do with her. Next show isn't for a couple days, right?"

The massive penguin nodded, slumping a little against the counter. "Yeah...get on it, pronto. Since you're going to be helping for a bit until Miss Holmes calls you away, anyway."

Thumping beats and the sound of a saxophone waxed across the dance hall as the night wore on, and the only thing I could think of is getting Kalinka to agree to go see Miss Blanc again.

13212112222212.content:
"Hey, Kalinka?"

After the screaming fist pumping of the guests'd been shooed out for the night, the only sound to be heard in the club was her humming a part of her playlist, even as gentle as her voice was. She didn't even leave the booth after her victory pose for the finale, and just slumped down to brush up the dashboard as the party broke up.

Mavis went off for some paperwork, far more easy headed than from our revelation some hours ago, giving me ample time to business. When I invited myself into the DJ's workspace, she was cleaning up the controls from a layer of hors d'oeuvres, drinks, and even whole sandwiches still sitting on their plates, and was only halfway through gnashing away at her "gifts."

She didn't even notice I was in the doorway until she gave me a stray glance from reaching for another plate, and smiled back. "Well, what did you think?"

"You were great! Gave Mavis a few thousand favors, too."

Kalinka hummed, swiveling her seat to turn back on the DJ board. I didn't speak, instead eyeing the white tracts of blubber that pushed free of her clothing. Along the elaborate design of bodypaint she'd slathered around her stomach, I could see cracks forming on the dried regions where her foodstuffed girth was pulling them apart, with strips of clean skin along the top and bottom as her shirt was pulled away.

If I was ogling her stomach, I couldn't pull away from her legs when I looked down, where the gaping rips in her pants were torn even wider...

"So, I was thinking that tomorrow morning, we'd meet at the lobby of the suites to check up on Miss Blanc. How's that sound?"

For just a few milliseconds, her hand faltered in bringing a burrito to her mouth, face dropping just the tiniest bit. "Da, that sounds...fair."

"Everything alright?"

She looked down at her stomach, at its size and the colorful pattern she'd given it for quite a while before looking back at me, smiling sheepishly.

"Could I stay like this for a little longer more? Vänligen?"

"A little...what're you talking about?"

She spun the seat around to face me, grabbing her belly by some of its folds. "I've been in hundreds of shows, Mr. Gregory, and I'd toured almost every corner in the country of Europe...but that?" She pointed a thumb at the window, back at the littered dance floor. "That was the best show I'd ever had!"

"Really? That was?"

She rapidly nodded, quaking her extra chins as her legs hoisted her up from the stool. "I've never had anything like that before! It was...it was...krasivaya! Pure, singing music!"

"...okay, but how does you being this big help?"

"I've got bounce!" She cheered, smacking her buttock to unfurl a subtle ripple that shook over to the other. "I've got size! I've got body! I even have my very own billboard!" She giggled, holding a hand under her stomach.

"Listen, Kalinka, I know you had a lot of fun tonight, but this can't be healthy! I'm sorry, but we should really-"

"Oh, please?" She begged, in an instant looking more like a child, even though she stood a head over me. "Just a few more pounds? A little longer? It's all I ask!"

It took me a few seconds to respond, take back by her eagerness. "Kalinka, listen..."

"Please?!" She dropped on the floor, almost sending cracks into it as she laced her fingers under the biggest, most heartbreaking set of puppy dog eyes I'd ever seen. "PleasepleasepleasepleasePLEASE!?!!?"

Her blubbering struck me away, pushing me back a few steps. I searched the back of my head for anything I could've used to respond, but came up empty. Somewhere on the way there, however, I scraped along to that flinch I felt when I scolded her this morning, where I could see that little break in her that was torn ten feet wide in front of me.

Against all reasonable doubt... "Just one show?"

"YES!" She gushed, nodding with a gleeful smile.

I tried to think a few days ahead, but couldn't go far, and just let out a tired breath. "Alright. One more show."

"Oh, thank you! Danke!" As though she weighed as much as she did a month ago, she rocketed back onto her feet, arms shooting out to wrap around my chest and faceplant me into her neck, where she rested her chin along my hair and massaged my head with a giddy hum.

"Bmft jtht m mrr shw, alrght?"

"One more show! I promise!" Her arms relaxed, letting me break from her chins and feel the cold air again. "I'll finish here, then help you. Alright?"

"Nah, I...I think I'll be fine on my own."

"Ok. Thank you!"

Kalinka went back to 'work,' nearly impaling the ground with her stool as she hopped over and jumped right on, grabbing for more of her feast. I stood in the doorway before I'd left, watching her hunch over and gorge herself with fatttening food before letting out a foggy sigh and going back to the dance floor.


.....



~ The Next Morning... ~
