132121122222122.content:
Mavis shook the aspirin bottle into an open flipper, but all that fell out were a few white crumbs. "...and you said yes?"

"...AND!" I continued. "I told her we could do one last show! She said it herself that she'd lose the weight, so we should be in the clear, right?"

Mavis groaned and threw up her arms, denting the necks of the stools behind her as sat down by falling onto them. "Gregory, I hunted Kalinka down to help make our jobs easier, but I've had to walk the tightrope two times since she'd been hired! I just want a second where I feel like I'm in control of things, alright?!"

"I know, I know, Mavis! I'm just...I'm sorry, alright?" I sighed, thinking back on how Kalinka...well, hotwired our talk from last night. "I just got caught up in the moment, is what happened, but I swear I'll get this all fixed up. Trust me!"

As I spoke, Mavis' eyes narrowed a little more with every word she heard. When I'd finished up, she held her look in silence, but soon let her face soften out with a tired sigh.

"Like I said, it's just one more show." I repeated. "After that, I swear, I'll take her hand right out off the booth and down to Miss Blanc's room, and everthing'll be right back to normal. Alright?"

"...I dunno, Gregory. A lot can happen in three days, you know."

"Such as...?"

"Me, for example?" She quipped, smacking a girthy arm along her ocean of a belly. "I've put on 2,072 pounds since all this started up! From worryeating, if you don't mind!"

I wanted to retort, but it only died trying to come out as I took a closernlook at Mavis' gut. If it were even possible, it bursted out even further from her body with a great deal of bounce, a lot more than what I'd gotten to know. I didn't even notice it until then, but most of the buttons on her jumbo-jumbo uniform had to be undone to contain its cobstantly expanding build, and I could practically hear the next one geing choked to keep together.

"Same goes for her, too. When she came in, she looked like she'd eaten Olivia!"

Again, I wanted to counter, but I only looked over at the DJ booth, instead. Kalinka was inside, going off the humming and rustling of wires, but she was too hunched over to see more than her back.

Still, I couldn't help but feel that the two hills of her back fat sagged more loose from her shirt than before...

"But," Mavis added. "I'm no braniac on magic, so you're more in on this than I am. Still, this is really important, so I want you to be honest: are you sure about this?"

I turned my head back at Mavis, who looked me right dead in the eye.

"...yeah." I let out. "Yeah, I am."

Her face was still as serious as ever, not changing from my answer until she gave a single nod. "...alright, then. I trust you."

Without us sharing another word, Mavis grabbed the table and grunted, using all her might to push her body's sheer mass back on its feet. I only looked down at the broom I was holding and kept sweeping around the icy floor as Mavis waddled back to whatever paperwork was waiting for her, the rattling of the seats lightening up the further away she became.

Just a few more days. I repeated to myself. Just have to sit around a few more days of what we've already been going through, just with a bit of a watchful eye, and then everything will be fixed up A-okay. Heck, lord knows she wouldn't mind slipping on some more junk in the trunk, so everythin'll just line up in one long, tidy straight li-

"You wouldn't happen to work here, would you?"

There weren't even any footsteps to accompany the voice. When I turned my head to the guest, it may as well have popped out of nowhere when I was smacked by the sight of the vast, white forefront some feet away from me of a wide, wide landmass of flesh with a deep navel in the center, a stomach so overblown that it swelled out over her legs and plopped along an enormous patch of ice in a towering orb of silver-tinted blubber that utterly dwarved my twiggy figure, probably even putting on a few notches for Mavis' belt alone.

After reeling from the giant mass of belly for some seconds, I took some several steps back, trying to get a look at the overflowing mounds crammed into a yellow hoodie along its roof, but I felt something in my heart sink like lead when I saw a shark's snout poking through a head of straight black hair.

Her lips were crinkled up in a grin, sort of like the common sneer that most other sharks'd been evolved into, but something about hers seemed a lot more relaxed and cool.

Realizing I hadn't answered, I went back to sweeping. "Yeah. Yeah, I do."

"You would'n happen to know another human here named Kalinka, would you?" She asked, speaking in an Australian accent as thick as Vegemite.

I stopped sweeping. "Why do you ask?"

"Just a fellow DJ wantin' to check up on some business, is all."

Huh. "That's not some kind of double talk, is it?"

The shark lady let out a snort. "I'm guessin' you don't read Neo-pop monthly, huh?"

I wasn't, but when we heard a long, high pitch gasp being sucked in somewhere at the DJ booth, I could almost tell Kalinka was.

When the two of us looked over at the sound, Kalinka was now standing in view, considerably wider, like Mavis'd described, but her blubber-laden face was lit up in utter astonishment at the stranger in front of me, hands cupped over her mouth. She swished her fingers along her eyes and, proving my theory right, plucked out the contacts to stare and blink with blue, uncovered irises...

...but when Kalinka took in the guest with full clarity, her shocked expression hardened into a snarl of the utmost fury, one that would've chilled me to the bone if the Aurora wasn't already so cold. She stamped a foot down on the booth's panel (actually denting the metal down the center), thrust a finger out at the shark lady, and screamed...something, I couldn't tell it it was in German, Swedish, Russian, or even just English that was horribly butchered by her rage.

Regardless of whether or not she understood what she'd heard, the shark lady smiled in the face of Kalinka's anger, leaning against an icy support beam to revel.

Kalinka rolled over the booth, now so big that the tips of her assceeks actually scraped against the roof as she passed through, and the laws of physics also seemed to forget that she weighed in at several-plus thousands of pounds as she strode over to us, each step she made rippling cracks into the layer of ice on the floor. I flinched and tucked my head down as she came to a skid just halfway between us, close enough that I expected to get smushed between the two of them as she slid on the balls of her feet, but she stopped just in time for me to stand right in the middle of the subsequent stare down, the shark casting Kalinka a wry grin as the suddenly belligerent European girl valiantly kept herself from foaming at the mouth.

"YOU!!!" She screeched. "КРЕТИН!!! HANSWURST!!! ΛΕΚΕΣ!!! SJUKDOM!!!"

"Nice to see the good ole' days arn't totally dead." The shark lady observed, prodding a finned finger into Kalinka's partly exposed potbelly. "Still plenty of changes to catch up on, though, eh?"

"Hey there. Name's Gregory. Nice to meet you." I added, letting go of my hair.

"Oh, sorry, where's my manners?" The shark lady answered, taking a step or two back to offer me her hand. "Cassie Stride, DJ for hire."

"How dare you imply contaminating him with your touch?!" Kalinka spat, smacking Cassie's hand away before I could to dare shake it. Even if it wasn't directed at me, I found myself wincing at the coldness that now laced her.

"Ah, c'mon, Kali, don't tell me you're still stale 'bout Bosnia, are you?" Cassie sneered, a statement that made Kalinka's already flush cheeks even redder. "I thought the audience seemed to be cheerin', don't you think so?"

Cassie snickered. "Well, if it was my charisma they were fallin' for, then you're act must've set the bar pretty low for it to work, bud."

The giant pear, usually so warm, was totally incensed by the mere presence of the shark woman. Her sweet, round face was knotted up in visceral rage and seething venom pouring from her eyes, her pudgy hands clenched so hard I wondered for a moment if her fingernails were going to draw blood. She was shaking from head to toe, blubber quaking at the boiling fury underneath that cuddly outer layer. The thought popped in my head that I would be witness to the first real brawl that had ever happened at the Aurora.

When Kalinka finally managed to control herself enough to speak fluently again, the grinding sound of her clenched teeth leaving the air, her voice left the room absolutely frigid. "Černá srdce podvodník...very well then! How about we see your true colors then?"

Friday this week, you and I have a simple DJing contest. Whoever the guests vote for, whether it be by cheering, tips, or a poll, that person wins. So far as prizes, I will consult with my Tovarishchi on the specifics and will let you know a day in advance of the contest. Honorable, da?" Kalinka folded her meaty arms and tapped a fat foot impatiently, staring at the shark girl with those hard blue eyes.

The sound wasn't unpleasant; I was just wholly unused to her attitude versus other shark guests in Gaia. Sounds like it'll be fun~ Ya better bring yer A-game this time, Kali, if ya want t'prove me wrong~"

"I'll hang around here for a bit anyway; see the sights, maybe get some info on how you've been doin', hm?" The grandiose shark turned around, her tail bopping Kalinka's swollen middle a little as she began to waddle off.

I stood next to the fuming giant as her nemesis left, the warmth returning as the object of her ire disappeared. That didn't stop me from turning to her with an incredulous look on my face, almost at a loss for words.

"Okay, Kalinka...what was that?"

132121122222122311.content:
"Cassie..." Kalinka took in a long, unsteady breath, having calmed to a point where she could mention the name without it being a direct insult. "She was from a time where I was...töricht enough to call her a friend."

"Really?" I asked incredulously, pointing back at the door. "That started out from two long lost friends?"

Kalinka nodded, her face souring both with anger and a bit of...longing, it seemed. "Da. Had things not have gotten so dire between us, in fact, you very well may have seen us come to the Gaia hand in hand, performing as a duo."

"So, whatever happened in Bosnia is what nixed that?" I lead on, taking seat at a nearby barstool. I craned myself away as Kalinka came over and rose her great big butt up to the rest of the stools, effectively stealing the entire rest of the bar for herself as she sat at my right.

"Nyet..." She sighed. "Bosnia was the point of no return, when I knew that things between us would never be the same."

"So, what was the part that changed everything?"

"...I cannot possibly remember, really." She said vaguely, resting her chin on her palms. "For so long, we did everything together. We were born in the very same village. We had been in one another's prescence since we were mere infants, our parents being so close. We were set in the same bassinet together, right on the night of our births, our parents walked us together in the same strollers, it never felt like there was a time when we said we should be friends...it always felt like we just were, for as long as we knew each other.

"Never had I felt like she was never next door, always there to help me when I was in need. Everything I'd done, Cassie was there, cheering me on, or it was the two of us as part of a pair, seeing it through. We'd gone to the same school, went to the same camps, had many sleepovers, and made even more music together, some being the very first ones I'd ever birthed. We weren't just friends...we were familj, never at a moment where one was too far to help when the other was in need..." She shut her eyes, her face and chest deflating with a glum sigh. "...I guess that's why I didn't notice the signs for so long."

"The signs?"

"When she brought one of our songs to school as her project." She replied, her voice warming with anger once more. "That was the very first, but it went right over my head. As our piece, I thought that...that she had just a right to it as me, that it was one of those times where I had to just turn the other cheek and let it sail...I never told anybody, and didn't even ask when we met at lunch, with everything seeming just as normal as before.

"...but then it happened again." Her jaw fastened up. "And again. And again. And again! Cassie just started to walk around, just passing our old songs, the ones we'd conjured as children, all as hers! Not even a mention of my name! It was six songs or so until I finally asked, but she just...sneered at me with that little sneer of hers, the same that she used when she was puppeteering all the other students with her lies and trickery! She...she twisted me around into thinking nothing was wrong, that we were still those friends of old, that...that I could trust her, and...and..." She let her face sink, her hands covering her eyes. "And I did, for so many years, all the way into high school! She was pulling in attention from every which way, from students, teachers, neighbors, even radio stations, passing our work as masterpieces under her creation, shooing me off when I was trying to step up behind her, trying to bring back our friendship!"

And for once, I didn't feel my heart snickering at Kalinka's accent. She hit a pause in her tangent, and the Aurora was totally silent as we just sat there together, me leaning back in shock of the sorrow that now graced the improbably jubilant titans at my side, sickened to hear the happiness in her voice disappear, replaced with what I could tell were years and years of repressed anger and sadness finally coming up to surface after so long. Probably then was the most scared I'd ever felt in Gaia 2.0 when I wasn't the prey of some massive anthro, even while I wasn't the one her anger was directed towards.

"...and then..."

"...Bosnia?" I finished for her.

"Madame Corsage." She snarled, her head coming back up with that same rage as when Cassie was present. "My idol! My hero! Our hero! It was the first time we were going to meet her, to see the one whose footsteps we'd wanted to walk in since our first notes were sung! We were supposed to finally meet her, and...and...and she made me trust her, thinking that..." Her fists slowly relaxed, and her gritted teeth turned to a defeated frown. "...that we were still those young kids, with so little to fear from the other."

"...and she stole your music again." I continued. Not as a question, but a sentence.

"That was the whole reason she invited me..." Kalinka answered, almost ashamed to look at me. "She bought my ticket with her own money...she said we were going to meet our life's goal right then and there, and I fell for it. When I was about to leave the shadow of her booty, I thrust myself out and gracefully jumped out in the clear, ready to hear the resounding boom of her ass hitting the ground from behind. Indeed, it came, and was just as loud and deafening as I'd imagined it to be, but instead, it came from all around, thundering through every bone in my body. I gave a choked cry as I felt what could've been the Great Wall of China fall down on my back, and was promptly squashed and speardagled into the sand by the biggest, heaviest, and most immobilizing weight I'd ever felt sit upon me through my career in Gaia 2.0.

I could breath, I was immediately thankful for as the cloud of sand settled, and her body was just soft enough that I wasn't choking on my own blood, but only my head was allowed to move as it stood out in the open, reduced to only squirming jitters as the rest of me laid utterly flattened beneath tens of thousands of tons worth of rhino ass.

"MISS...HKKKR! DELILAH?!" I'd forced out.

"Hmm...?" She hummed slyly, but barely cared for what her tiny hostage had to say.

He said something again, but it was too choked and strangled for her to make out, again, not that she'd even cared. She was just relieved that she didn't feel any of his joints get be twisted out of place when she'd landed on him, and could thus relish with an easy conscience over how huge she felt with his diminutive struggles squirming beneath her enormous hips. True, she may have towered over her other coworkers, maybe a head or so taller, but it was rare for her to feel all of those seventy-five feet at once, or put the ones along her ass to any use.

"Mnn..." She bit her lip as she caressed her thighs, never getting enough over how far they surged off of her figure when she was seated. For once, she felt like a true queen for her size, and finally had somebody to worship it all.

Still, it was only just from holding him down, putting his freedom down to her choice. There was so much left to do, and most importantly, experiment with...
134121.title: She rolls over, pinning Greg under her booty!

choices: Delilah makes it back to her room without interruption.
One of the other lifeguards sees Greg's plight!
1341211.content:
Delilah pursed her lips, idly wondering what to do with her tiny--and charming, she had to admit--little hostage. The feeling of him wriggling under her rump felt...wonderful, but it was horribly rare that she got the chance to sit on humans; let alone in her favorite bikini, or in a place as ritzy as this. No, she couldn't just lay there on top of him; lovely as that was. She had to do something special.
But what?

She thought of her room back in the Aether Suites. If she could be away from prying eyes...and any of Greg's coworkers who might spoil her fun...then she could play with him in private! She giggled at the delightful ideas that brought to mind; wanting to spring up and carry her little human off right then and there.

But no...no reason she couldn't have a bit of fun before taking him there.
Lifting her head to look at the tiny form of her prisoner, she found him just as she left him: pinned under her cheek, with only his head and neck uncovered. He tried to croak something out, but she didn't bother to listen; only winking at him before laying her head back down...


========

"Ma'am, could you please-- *Urgh!* --get off me?" I ground out, trying my best to sound polite despite the crushing weight of Delilah's rear. When most customers would eat you alive or step on you for looking at them wrong, you learn to ignore little things like being sat on, or called a snack. "I can't apply the sunblock if you're...*Ugh*...sitting on me." I flash my best grin, putting on the charm.

No such luck. She just winked at me, returning my grin with a sultry smirk before laying back down, sighing in bliss.
Great, she was getting off to this. I sighed, stopping my struggles to get free.

...and that was when she started wiggling her titanic rhino ass down on me, complete with a throaty sigh. I was pressed between her bikini-clad butt and the sand below, toss around like a ragdoll as her weight shifted around me; back and forth, side to side; every which way. Each wiggle dragged me further under her booty, eventually surrounding me in darkness as her cheeks completely covered my tiny form. I tried to shout for her to stop, but opening my mouth only got me a maw full of sand, rhino sweat, and black spandex from her bikini.

Between Delielah's crushing weight, the gritty sand, and the ever-present threat of her just straight-up farting on me (again, with giant anthros, that's fatal for us tiny humans! Don't laugh!), I was getting pretty clobbered.
Weirdly, she seemed to be keeping just enough of her weight off me to keep it from being fatal--no bones crushed into jelly or anything. I guess she did like humans after all. Enough to NOT kill me with her little forced dominatrix session, at least.

With one final wriggle, she stopped, sighing in utter bliss above me. By now I was pinned right at the apex of her ass, both cheeks pressing down on me. And I was face up, so unlike when only one cheek had landed on me I was getting the full force of her building-sized bum.

Remembering the threat of flatulence, I tried NOT to think about how I was at ground zero of any gas she might have....when the already-insane weight pressing down on me shot up. Her cheeks hinged upwards, pressing together and compacting me between them as I was flattened. Shouting--and getting another mouth full of rhino flab--I realized Delilah must be sitting up. Like the naive idiot I was, I assumed she'd gotten bored of sitting on me and was finally getting her giant butt off me.

...No such luck. She wiggled her butt down on me one last time and stood up---with me pancaked against her hide like a sticker. I was wedged between her cheeks like a canned fish, adhered to her rear by sheer force and sweat. With her rear no longer pressing down on me, I could see the outside world through a thin slit of life between her cheeks....which let me see Delilah casually move her hands to her wide hips and press her cheeks together, locking me in place.

Yeah; I wasn't getting out of this unless she wanted me to.

As she thundered off to God-knew-where; effectively kidnapping me so she could have a toy, I could only think one thing.

Please don't fart...
1341211.title: Unwilling Passenger

choices: Delilah's there for some new torment
Greg's seemingly alone and tries to escape
13412111.content:
Well this situation was about as terrible as it could possibly get. Trapped between the butt cheeks of an amorous rhinoceros and being taken to who knows where. Sure, I'd been stepped on, sat on, and nearly digested before. They were all risks that came with human jobs at Gaia 2.0--and they didn't even offer hazard pay to boot--but that didn't mean I ever got used to the pain and humiliation. Or ever felt less fear that the next anthro client I came across would end up being my executioner. Especially if that anthro had successfully abducted me without anyone noticing.

I spent half an hour locked in the prison of her behind, munched between her cheeks as she walked. It got even worse the more she walked, the bottom of her bikini wedging up into her butt crack, dragging me along deeper. It was sweltering inside. The heat and the long walk caused her to sweat profusely and the salty droplets would roll down, drenching me. Delilah passed other anthros as she walked. I would try to cry for help whenever I knew one was nearby but Delilah would just smirk and clench her cheeks until I was in too much pain to keep shouting.

I assumed we were heading to her room. On the one hand, that was good. A room meant a telephone and a telephone meant I could call Ms. Holmes and tell her what happened. When she was done laughing she usually sent someone to help me... in an hour or two. On the other hand, being alone with a frisky giant had other dangers. She barely had any scruples on the beach in public. Who knows how far she'd be willing to take it in her room with no one to stop her?

Delilah reached her room. I heard her keycard unlocking her door. From what little of the outside world I could experience, it was much cooler inside.

"Ahhh, home sweet home! Isn't it beautiful, little man? Breathe it in!" Muffled shouts came from her butt and Delilah faked surprise. "Oh that's right. I forgot. You're too busy breathing in the scent of a real woman. Let's get you out of there."

Delilah dug into her crack and fumbled until she could find me. When I was finally released I gasped and took deep breaths, grateful to finally have some fresh air. I finally saw the room and my jaw nearly hit the floor. All the rooms in the Aether Suites were beautiful and fancy, but Delilah's room was the most beautiful and fanciest I ever saw. It must've cost a fortune! Especially since Delilah herself was so large, everything had to accommodate her.

"How can you afford a room like this?" I asked.

"Didn't you know?" Delilah asked coyly. "Gaia 2.0's adding a healthcare facility for its clientele. I've been hired on as head surgeon."

"You work here?" I spluttered meekly. That did not bode well.

"That's right cutie. Play your cards right and I can make it so we spend a lot of time together."

She said it suggestively and I cringed. "I have a feeling if I spend time with her, I'll end up in a full-body cast in that new hospital," I thought.

"Dr. Davidson," I said respectfully. "I'm very flattered at your... interest--But! I really need to get back to work. I don't want to make my boss angry--"

"You mean Toronto? Don't worry about that, cutie. Ms. Holmes is a dear friend of mine! I'll give her a call right now. I'm sure she'll excuse your absence from work... You're... prolonged... absence," she said, wiggling her eyebrows.

"Oh sweet merciful mother of marmalade, I'm a dead man."

I threw caution to the wind and just began struggling in the giant rhino's hand as she called Ms. Holmes. Her grip was too tight from me to escape from.

"Toronto. Hi, it's Delilah! Yes, I love my new home, thank you for making the arrangements for me. I feel bad asking for another favor, but it's a teensy one. That human you have working for you, um..." She looked at me, embarrassed for the first time. "I sorry, cutie, I forgot to ask. What's your name?"

"MS. HOLMES!" I screamed. "IT'S GREG! SEND HELP, PLEASE!"

"Greg! That's it!" Delilah said, ignoring my outburst. "Yes I was hoping you wouldn't mind if I borrow him for a few... hours... Or days... What can I say? I have a weakness for weakness. Oh shush, like you're one to talk! I've kept a record on your love life. I remember that time when--oh, hold on a second."

Delilah broke off her conversation with Ms. Holmes. I'd been screaming nonstop and begging for help ever since my captor got her on the line. It was a slim chance Ms. Holmes would help me out of this mess, but at this point I was desperate. My screams and struggles finally distracted Delilah enough to acknowledge me.

"Sweetie, I know you're impatient. I want to play just as much as you do, but you're being very rude. I'm talking with a friend right now, so it'll be another few minutes before we can get started on the really fun stuff. Oh fine," she said, after mention of "the really fun stuff" caused me to double my efforts to free myself, "I hope this will tide you over."

I screamed in terror as once again I was brought to her massive behind. Only this time, instead of wedging me up the outside of her bathing suit, she pulled back on her bikini and dropped my into her ass crack. I slid between the sweat-soaked cheeks until I was wedged firmly between them, then trapped further as Delilah pulled her bikini further into her crack.

"Now, where were we?" Delilah said to Ms. Holmes, acting as if she hadn't just stuffed a human in her crack.

It was so unfair. I'd just escaped the foul prison of her behind, only to be placed right back in, and now it was even harder to get out. I tried to wiggle my way to safety, but whenever I neared the edge of the fabric, Delilah would just clench her cheeks until I was pulled back into a secure position. Despite her claims that the conversation would take a few minutes, Delilah and Ms. Holmes droned on and on for an hour. Eventually I blacked out.

When I woke up...
13412111.title: Delilah makes it back to her room

choices: Delilah bends down and snatches Greg up in her mouth!
134121111.content:
My first conscious thought was, Oh, good; I'm alive. I didn't open my eyes, but I felt a soft bed beneath me.

I'd been getting short of breath before I blacked out. My head was still spinning and I felt like crap, but I was alive. And this bed was nice and soft; better than the tight place I'd been before--

And then it all came rushing back.

Miss Delilah, her trap with the sunscreen, being trapped under her gigantic ass; tapped INSIDE said ass, abducted back to her room...and her getting permission from Holmes to use me as a toy for God knew how long.

Yes, of course I screamed like a litle girl. That scream died as soon as I opened my eyes, though, when I saw my rhino captress looming over the bed--her bed--aiming a sultry smirk down at my tiny form. She still had the bikini on.

"Aww, you enjoy your nap; Greg?" Delilah cooed with mock sweetness. "I hope you're nice and rested after that, I have soooo many fun things in mind!" She bent down and winked at me, licking her lips. "You ready to see what a real woman is, little man?"

If you're a real woman, then no. I WANTED to say that, or anything to refuse, but all that came out was a weak stammer.

Delilah giggled. "Oooh, silent treatment eh? Perfect. Always prefer a man of action over a talker." She stood up to her full 75 feet, and then, *Whump!* A hand slapped down next to me. Slowly, streching out the moment, she slinked onto the bed; more muffled impacts announcing each limb and the bed creaking under her weight, until she was poised on all fours above me, her back arched and her hands at my sides blocking of any escape.

Somehow, she looked bigger now than she did standing up, like an amorous mountain looming over me. I now saw that Delilah was, indeed, an utter bombshell by any standard. She wasn't a stunner despite being fat, her girth MADE her beautiful--curves all around, kept just toned enough to NOT have any fat rolls or unsightly bulge.

Even with my fear making me shake, I could see this rhino woman was smoking hot. Too bad she'd probably be the death of me.

"Mmm, you look so tiny down there," Delilah purred. Her yellow eyes danced over me. "That's one reason I love humans so much--you little things just make me feel all my 75 feet. And I can play with a human guy in ways I could never with an anthro man...ways like THIS!"

I let out a scream, and the torment began...
134121111.title: Delilah's Playtime

choices: Delilah FINALLY spits Greg out, satisfied for now
1341211111.content:
"You know little man; I'm proud that I don't eat humans," Delilah purred. "I honestly can't see how other anthros can think someone who can talk back to them is nothing but food. It's kind of disturbing, really." She shook her head, frowning. "Besides, I'm an herbivore! Why would I eat a human anyway, even if I DIDN'T see you as people just like anthros are?" Her gaze drifted off to the side, like she was daydreaming about something.

I blinked. Her terrifying seductive act had completely dropped. "Uh, y-yeah; it's kind of terrifying, worrying about getting eaten all the time...I've had parents tell their kids it's okay to eat me!" I nodded along, subtly inching out from under her shadow. Hopefully this swing in her mood would let me--

*Thump!* Her thumb lifted and slapped down on my chest, pinning me to the bed.
Dammit. Guess she wasn't quite so distracted.
Well, at least I wasn't on my captress's menu.

"But so many of my patients tell me how tasty humans are," Delilah went on, "and even a gentle anthro like me has those pesky animal instincts sometimes..." her eyes flickered and snapped back to me, her seductive look back in full force.
Then she licked her lips.

No. No! NO! OH GOD NO! I struggled beneath the rhino's thumb, but it didn't budge.

She giggled, now looking VERY hungry. "So, little Greggie; since our good friend Toronto said I could do whatever I wanted with you...and I'm ALWAYS ready to try something new, we're gonna have a little taste-test! I'll just spit you out once I've had enough; wouldn't want to be finished playing with a handsome thing like you too soon, after all...!"
Delilah lowered her head toward me, her salivatting maw opening up to accept its human snack.

"WAIT! WAIT! Come on, Miss Delilah! I..I was just under your behind, remember?! You sat on me! Isn't eating something that's been down there unsanitary?! You're a doctor, remember?!" I pleaded, futiley thrashing about like a madman. That line had saved me from becoming lunch many times before; after a hungry anthro had picked me off the floor or their foot. It would work with a health nut, right?

"Nice try, sweetie; but I washed you off with soap and water while you were out. You're clean from your time under my tush."
Dang. She'd thought of everything.

I kept on screaming and flailing as the amorous rhino giantess's jaws enveloped my torso, leaving my legs kicking at the air as she rose to a sitting position with my upper half in her mouth. I got a face full of saliva and rhino tongue, nearly drowing right there. My ears were assaulted by a thuderous MMMM.... within her maw: she must have found me delicious. With another moan, she slurped my still-kicking legs in like spaghetti noodles, fully trapping me within her mouth.

"Oh lawwd...sho tashty...wahf haff Ah bem mishing..." Delilah moaned, sounding near delierious with pleasure. Even slurred from talking with her mouth full (of me), I could tell she was over the moon. "All thish dyme..." She purred, swallowing the flood of saliva as her mouth watered. It saved me from drowning, but that was the least of my worries. Her massive tongue slammed me against the roof of her mouth and she sucked on me (NO! NOT LIKE THAT!) like a human candy.

I was carried by floods of saliva dangerously close to the waiting pit of her throat, then shunted into her cheeks where her tongue lashed at me from behind, battering me around like a sack of potatoes even as she enjoyed my apparently wonderful flavor.

She made as if to spit me out several times, only to stop short and leave me pressed between her lips and her gums. (And unsurprisingly, her dental work was flawless. Not a trace of plaque anywhwere.
I got a VERY good look at those pearly whites when her tongue bucked under me and tossed me onto her back molars. I screamed as the top teeth slowly descended, thinking I would be chewed into paste....but they only lightly pinned be down as she carefully chewed--painful, but it didn't draw blood or break bones. Still made her shudder and moan something fierce, though.

It went on like that for...hell, I don't know how long. I was battered, scarred from her teeth, and nearly ran out air several times. (She let my head stick out from her lips every once in a while so I could get some fresh oxygen...then slurped me back into her mouth for more playtime.) All I knew was she kept it up until I felt ready to pass out.

Finally, FINALLY; it stopped. I was left on my back on her mercifully still tongue, hearing her amorous; exhausted panting echoing around my prison. "Shweet...Jheezhus...vhat wash...imcrebible..." Delilah slurred. Something in her tone told me she was fanning herself as she said that. The whole affair must have aroused her something fierce.

Why yes, I DID find it hot despite all the torment. Hormones are fickle things; don't judge.

"Is...is it over, Miss Delilah?" I groaned. After this, I was never taking an assignment on the beach again. Even being Holmes' secreary would be better.

"Yeah...vhat's enuff...of vhat..." Delilah said, sounding a little more coherent. "Vo were tashty, Greg..."

"Thanks...I think." I managed.

I felt her mouth move around my tiny form, and....
1341211111.title: Jaws of the Rhino

13412111112.content:
As her mouth moved around me, I sighed in relief, believing she was finally going to spit me out like she promised. At least until I realized I was moving backwards.

"Miss Delilah! You're sending me the wrong way!" hoping this was just a literal slip of the tongue.

"Ah o."

"You know?!"

Her tongue rose, sending me sliding to the back of her waiting throat like a giant waterslide. Groans came from the black abyss below me, a monster in the dark demanding to be fed. I desperately began trying to crawl back up her tongue, using her taste buds as handholds, but the pink surface was so slick with saliva and I was so exhausted that my grip kept slipping off. I would slip off only to make wild grabs to save myself.

"Ar ooh ivin e a las tashte, Eg? Oo're sho swheet."

I slipped again, rolling head over foot down the tongue, eliciting a deep moan. I only just managed to grab a last handhold on the edge of her tongue. My feet dangled off into space in her throat. Her breath was hot and steamy like an underground volcano. The groans from her stomach turned into roars of hunger.

"MISS DELILAH!" I screamed, barely hanging on. "YOU SAID YOU'D SPIT ME OUT AFTERWARDS!"

"Arry, abee. Animuh instincshts."

"YOU'RE A RHINO! YOUR INSTINCTS SHOULD MAKE YOU A VEGETARIAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAN!"

I hoped those wouldn't be my last words as my grip finally gave way and I was sent plummeting down her throat. Delilah swallowed and, with a single finger, traced my descent down her throat, down her chest, past her ample bosom, and finally into the mountainous, gelatinous orb of her stomach. She laid on her back on her bed, fanning herself, and breathing heavily. I heard her smacking her lips to get the last remnants of my taste and heard a dull thumping as she patted her belly. My arrival trigged an expulsion of gas rising up her throat, which she let out as a genteel, Urp.

"Pardonne-moi," she said with a giggle.

I flailed in her stomach acid as helplessly as a fish out of water. Spying a half-chewed orange slice in the distance, I paddled my way over and used it as a makeshift life raft while I caught my breath.

"Oh, Greg," Delilah breathed. "You were just so scrumptious!" she squealed. She scrunched up her face as she heard muffled squeaks coming from inside her stomach. "Sorry, sweetie. I can't hear you. Give me just a sec," she said as she rummaged through her drawer. "Here we go!" She pulled out a stethoscope and pushed it to her stomach. "Can you repeat that, sweetie?"

"YOU ATE ME!" I screamed.

Outside, Delilah rolled her eyes.

"Yes, sweetie," she said patiently. "I thought that was abundantly obvious... but, maybe I shouldn't be so surprised. It's probably a traumatic experience to be swallowed whole. I guess I'm just lucky I'll never have to go through such a thing."

"Lucky you," I seethed. "Now get me out of here before I digest!"

The colossal rhino let out a deep belly laugh. Unfortunately for you since you were inside that belly, and ended up being submerged and sloshed around by waves of stomach acid.

"Don't be silly, sweetie. You're not going to be digested! At least, not for a few days."

"How the hell do you figure that?"

"I'm a doctor, sweetie, remember? I've had plenty of anthros come to me with a human they ate not digesting properly. Based on the eater's preference, I can either extract the human... or give them something that can help move them along. Anyway, the point is that different humans have different levels of endurance, it's one of the reasons why you weren't crushed like a bug beneath my booty. In my professional opinion, you have at least Type 3 endurance. That's the second highest endurance level there is! Meaning you should survive at least for three days."

"Type 3? What makes you say that?"

"I'm friends with Toronto, remember, Greggie? She told me all about you and the all those funny "accidents" that keep happening to you. She also told me about the time she accidentally ate you while you were on room service detail and ended up wedged in her hamburger. According to her, you survived three whole days in her stomach until a burp sent you flying out. Surviving that long means you're at least Type 3."

"I DON'T CARE ABOUT A SCIENCE LESSON! I WANT TO GET OUT OF HERE!"

"I know you do, Greggie," Delilah said soothingly. "But that's not gonna happen any time soon. You were just so delicious! I can't believe what I've been missing all these years. I wonder if all humans taste this good or if it's just you. But it's not just the taste either, it's the sensation! The knowledge that you're trapped in there, completely at my mercy, unable to escape unless I allow it. Your life is literally in the palm of my hand... actually, it's literally in the bowels of my belly, but you get my point... I can get used to this feeling... It's so intoxicating."

I muttered curses under my breath. I knew she was insane but this was a whole new level of crazy. I didn't know I was especially endurable, but it did explain how I survived so long in the belly of my boss. I figured it was some kind of miracle. But special endurance or not, that didn't make me any happier about being stuck in the stomach of this rhino. Especially if she planned to keep me trapped in here for days on end!

"Okay," I tried to say as calmly as possible, in the hopes it would hasten my release. "May I ask when you plan to let me out, Miss Delilah?"

She let out a throaty laugh, and said...
13412111112.title: She swallows him whole! D:

134121111122.content:
"Oh my dear Greggie...so polite. If more humans were like you, maybe us anthros wouldn't be so eager to squish and eat you littlee things." Delilah spoke sweetly, like an adult to a naiive kid. "You'll get out, alright..." She trailed off. Ominous.

I had to fight the urge to snark back about her compliment: most anthros would crush or eat humans without a second thought, regardless of how much ass they kissed. If I had a nickel for every time I overheard some version of "Why do they let the food walk around like that?", I could have bought Gaia 2.0 off Miss Holmes in a heartbeat.

"Thanks, I think..." I mumbled. My fleshy prison shook as my rhino captress laughed again, the waves of stomach fluids nearly capsizing my citrus raft. "So, when will you let me out?"

"After you're digested, of course."

The world stopped. Everything felt cold, numb. I went so rigid part of my brain was worried I'd been paralyzed. My mouth felt dry, and I had to struggle to get a word out. "W-wh-what?" I croaked, praying I'd heard wrong.

"I said, you'll get out after you've been digested. Like all food," Delilah answered, still in that 'talking-to-a-kid' tone. "You were so delicious, and after finding out what I've been missing all these years...might as well go all the way. Sorry Greggie, but Doctor Delilah Davidson is going carnivore." She patted her belly once, and from within the pit it sounded like a death knell.


"BUT YOU CAN'T!" I pleaded. "YOU LIKE HUMANS! YOU'VE TREATED HUMAN PATIENTS! YOU SAID YOU DON'T SEE HUMANS AS FOOD! You--" I stammered, grapsing at straws in my panic. "Uh, you had so much fun sitting on me!"

"Oh, having you under my booty was great fun, and I did have a fetish for human guys, but...after tasting you, tasting a human; I realized what I'd been depriving myself of. And besides, all those times I've stepped on humans, sat on them, squeezed them between my melons; made them massage my feet? Those were just animal instincts. Same ones that made me swallow you. It's just what I am, so; like I said, why not go all the way?" Her tone told me she shrugged her shoulders at that point. "Besides, Toronto told me you signed all your rights away working here, so you knew the risks. It's just nature, sweetie. Food chains and whatnot."

'LET ME OUT! PLEASE!! I'LL DO ANYTHING! YOU CAN KEEP ME AS A I'LL DO ALL THOSE THINGS! YOU CAN SIT ON ME ANY TIME YOU WANT!!"

Another throaty chuckle from Delilah. "Sorry, I've made my decision. The Doctor is out, little guy. Goodbye, my little morsel."

I heard a *click*--her putting the stethoscope on a table, sealing my fate.

"MISS DELILAH! MISS DELILAH!!!"


Delilah ignored Greg's muffled pleading. It was cruel, but she didn't regret consigning him to his fate. He had been so delicious, his struggles in her belly so wonderful...she had to do this. No way would she back out of something this wonderful. She sighed in bliss, patting her belly as she pulled up a pillow. Greg kept struggling and squirming, and whenever he seemed to waver, she poked her belly and riled him up again.

It felt lovely. It felt...right. This was what humans were for.
Well, this and sitting on them.

=========Three Days Later===========

I wasn't getting out. Not the way I wanted to, at least. After three days in Delilah's gullet, I was delerious from dehydration, my orange raft had almost completely melted into sludge, and all my attempts to talk Delilah out of digesting me had failed. I'd begged, I'd bargained, I'd even offered to become her PET forever...she turned me down. I'd even tried to make her throw up somehow, but being a doctor she knew plenty of ways to calm a human-disturbed stomach. It'd all been for nothing, and she'd always used the same line.

"Sorry Greggie, but I've made my decision. I'm a carnivore now. You're cute, but...I'm predator, you're prey."
Every time, in that same 'talking to a kid' tone she'd used when telling me I'd be digested alive.

A hissing sound broke me out of my skulking, and I saw bubbles boiling around my new raft, a doughnut, as it sank into the mire of acids. There were no other scraps of food to leap to--on the third day, she'd apparently decided to finish me off for good and had only a protein shake for breakfast. No solid food lifesavers for me this time, and I'd hopped to a pizza crusts and bagels than I could count.

So this was how it ended. Eaten alive by a horny giant rhino woman, who decided to become a maneater on a whim after years of being kind to humans. God, I was an idiot to take a job at Gaia. The place was a deathtrap for humans.

Garnet finally looked pleasantly surprised, but not as much as any other time we'd hung out. "Sure, come right in!"

She shut the door, unhitched the lock, and opened it all the way, inviting me in. Like with the doormat, the interior made it pretty clear that she'd spent a while making the space her own, as the walls were covered by posters of famous heavy metal bands, and hastily folded clothes sat around in the dresser's drawers. The bed was horribly made, and a projector sitting between the pillows shone a movie onto the ceiling, clearly some kind of campy slasher flick.

"So, uh..." I began, stepping around a few socks sitting around on the floor. "Anything you'd had in mind to do?"

"I'd wanted to see the end of this movie, if that's alright." She said, plopping back onto the bulky layers of blanket on her bed. "If you wanted to do something else, though, I'm open!"

I shrugged. "Nah, I can watch for a while."

She patted the other half of the bed, and I sat down myself. It wasn't made up as pretty as all the other room's bed, but any part of my body that touched the mattress felt as though it were released from the aches and pains of reality, letting in a soothing bliss that eased all of my muscles as I laid back, sighing contently as I watched the scene above. It was of some cartoonishly big-breasted cheetah screaming her head off as she ran straight through the bushel of a forest, her chest weighing her down as she was chased by some witch-masked guy slicing his way through the branches with a sickle.

When I turned my head along the pillow to look at Garnet, I could tell from her eyes that she just wasn't getting into it.

"Everything alright, Garnet?"

"Hm?" She asked, tilting her head my way.

"You seem kind of...I dunno, off today. Something happen?"

"Oh, no...no. Nothing happened." She answered with a tone that definitely sounded like something'd happened.

I rolled over onto my side, holding my head up with a fist. "Garnet, C'mon. What's going on?"

She was about to spill it out, but whatever it was, she was taking her sweet time to get to the moment of truth. She took in a slow, steady breath, covering her eyes with her wings as she fearfully let it all back out in a shaky sigh.

"Garnet?" I asked, now filled with worry.

"...mother's coming."

What.

She gulped, practically forcing the rest of the words out. "She called this morning to tell me that she'd decided to check up on me early, and she'll be Sapphire me to find out how Rhodes I'd been doing. She'll also be Sapphire Rhodes my sister to Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes the hotel, and Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes my Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes and Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Greg? Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Sapphire Rhodes Greg?"

"Huuuuurh...?" I slurred, my jaw hanging agape until I snapped it shut. "I-I-I-I...I-I-I'm sorry...what?"

She sat back up, resting her bill upon her wings as she folded them along her knees. "She and my sister'll be here in a week, and they'll be checking up on my progress. You know," she stroked her feathered hands along her meager potbelly "whether I'd made all the thousands of dollars a night worth it."

And like that, my expectations of a carefree week of fun were all dunked headfirst into a whirlpool of terror and existential agony. Sapphire Rhodes. The Sapphire Rhodes, a name that I was terrified to admit I shared a sliver of the multiverse with was going to be in my country. In the same structure as I was, turning around all the same corners and trekking along the same paths I might've walked on the floors long ago, probably drinking the same water or breathing the same air molecules I once had.

Sapphire Rhodes, the mastermind for a business that probably took in more corporates than employees, its arms reaching to grab buildings right out of the ground from across the world. Sapphire Rhodes, a woman with more power to do as she pleased than the queen of England herself. Sapphire Rhodes, one of the most outspoken (and successful) advocates against the fair treatment of humans under facilities owned by anthros, even if a quarter of her arguments were just venting on what piles of filth she saw them as.

Sapphire Rhodes.

"Oh...my...god..." I mouthed out, eyes staring into oblivion.

"Gregory?"

I looked back at Garnet, snapping back out of my daze, but was hit with a double of worry when I looked back at her. Right then, I realized how close I was getting to finally seeing gone of my favorite guests in all the resort see herself out.

We looked into one another's eyes again, showing each other a look of fear that helped us read one another's minds.

"How long, again?"

She looked away. "...three days."
1511.title: Wanted to write with these characters for so long.

choices: They arrive at the White Brimstone...
15111.content:
Three days.

Three days until Garnet's devil of a mother would come to Gaia 2.0.

Three days until she came to "check up"on her daughter--no, my best friend--and berate her for not getting fat enough; living up to some "family image". And for not eating or enslaving ME, a human; like she did. Then Sapphire would drag Garnet away: from Gaia, from me, from FREEDOM...

And I'd never see her again.
Assuming that bitch didn't just crush or eat me in front of Garnet as punishment, of course.

I'm a pretty chill guy. In my line of work, you have to be. I've reined in my temper when dealing with rude guests and staff, most of whom see humans like me as food. I've faced down an angry Miss Holmes and kept my fear in check when anyone else would have been in tears. I've nearly died in a hundred ways working here, but I still haven't broken. I’d grinned and bore it, because I’m that kind of guy.

But this? Learning I could lose my best friend, one of the VERY precious few anthros I'd met who treated me as an equal, because her mother decided to be a tyrant?

That made me see red. My fists clenched. No. This would NOT happen.. Not if I could help it.

"We won't go down without a fight," I growled through clenched teeth.

"Huh...?" Garnet mumbled, still in shock. She looked down at me, curious.

"We're going to White Brimstone. Ordering EVERYTHING. Hell, you can eat the tables! If Sapphire wants you plump, we'll make it happen!" I climbed onto Garnet's leg. "No way in hell are we just going to skulk and wait! She's NOT going to just cart you off, goddammit! You're my friend, and I'm NOT letting that happen!"

Garnet looked confused for a moment…and then everything was a blur and I felt myself getting yanked upward, faceplanting onto her ample feathery chest.. She was constricting me in a hug, her wings and arms wrapped around me. She craned her long neck down and nuzzled my head with her beak, cooing. “Thank you, thank you Greg. You can’t imagine what a relief this is…Mother would never let me off the leash again…Oh, thank you!” She choked out a happy sob, word failing as she kept nuzzling me.

I hugged her back—and NO. I DID NOT “take the opportunity” to cop a feel on her breasts.
She’s my FRIEND, goddammit. I wouldn’t do that to her at a time like this. “We’ll get through this,” I promised, looking up at her.. “We’ll do it together.”

Garnet wiped a tear and smiled, picking me up toward her face. “Thank you, Greg.” She said quietly. Then she brought me to her beak and kissed me.

Just for a moment, we allowed ourselves to forget everything. Just savor the moment, an anthro and a human—no, two people—keeping each other afloat.

You think it sounds mushy? Well screw you, we were happy.
And then we let it pass. Time to get to business.
“Okay,” I announced, “We’ve had our moment—”

“A moment I needed,” Garnet interrupted, now looking calm and determined. No fear, no tears. Good.

“We HAD OUR MOMENT,” I continued, “But now we get serious. Sapphire sent you here to fatten up, we’ll do it. Raid the restaurants, bum bacon fat from the fryers…hell, even Denise’s crazy formulas if we have to! We’ve got three days, and I have the week off. Let’s use them!”

“Damn right we will!” Garnet exulted, standing up. “I’ll fill this room by the time Mother gets here!”

She all but kicked the door open as she carried me from the room, marching down the hall on a mission.
We spotted a certain zebra making her way towards us. She spotted me, smirked, and turned around showing her massive striped butt through the hole she’d cut in her pants.

“Hey sweetie. Bet the birdy doesn’t sit on you like I do. Why not ditch feathers for fur?” She purred.

“Blow it out your fat striped ass, Carly,” Garnet growled. “We’ve got business to get to, so quit your ‘Greg-is-my- boyfriend’ crap.”

She stomped down the hall, leaving a slack-jawed Carly in her wake.
I laughed all the way to the White Brimstone.

Bloody hell, I loved this swan woman!
15111.title: Epic Meal Time

1512.content:
After having breakfast at the employee lounge, I didn't waste any time running back up to my room, switching out again from my casual attire to red swim trunks and a T-shirt. I was eager to drop by one of my favorite places to work in, let alone casually be inside; The Glass Tornado.

When the monorail zoomed out of the tunnel and out into the summertime dome, I actually flinched at the synthetic sunshine pouring in through the windows, overlooking a sandy beach against a wavy ocean with a bright blue sky above, a plaza with dozens of other pools and all kinds of shops, and a tall, rocky mountain right on the back end, with colorful water slides sprouting from the top and streaming into or around the rockface.

The monorail gently skidded to a stop inside a station perched above a horde of trees, conveniently built facing the beach, as I disembarked and headed for shore. For the crapton of stuff to do around the Glass Tornado, I just thought of starting simple and unfurled my towel onto the sand, opting to just lay back and watch the clouds pass.

It was still pretty early, leaving me with plenty of space to claim. I could still see some giantesses in the very distance, including a familiar bulky green figure hunched over at the snack bar and another brown spot wading through the sand, but as things looked, I'd have plenty of time alone to just sit back at stare at the sky.

For all the times I'd worked there, it still stunned me that it was winter outside. If you'd kidnapped me, carried me to the Glass Tornado's beach, and tore the bag off my head only there, I'd easily be convinced. The clouds drifted from screen to screen at flawless angles no matter were under the dome you stood, with no tangible shape or pattern to their design, while the "sunspot" in the ceiling drifted over the landscape in real time, casting light over the land that maintained the exact feeling of standing outside.

You know, for somebody borderline megalomaniacal who had gladly sent me off into some insane schemes, it actually wasn't that hard for me to say that miss Holmes was a friggin' genius.

But they came too late for me to react when a set of footsteps stomped up behind me in the sand, the mountain-like body of its owner blocking out the light of the fake sun...
1512.title: I changed it so that it's a week off.

15121.content:
"...the hell are you doing here?"

Ah, great... Leaning my head back, all I could see was brown. Two massive, brown-scaled asscheeks avalanched on top of a metal board partially submerged within the sand, twined by a black thong partly covered by a stubby tail. A few deep creases rolled inward along Olivia's towering backside as she leaned back to look me over, her head craned against her flabby shoulder with a confused sneer.

Guess I'd zoned out pretty damn far if she could sneak up on me.

"Miss Holmes gave me the week off." I stated simply.

"Bullshit. There's no way miss Holmes would give anybody the week off!"

"You honestly think I'd say that if it weren't true?"

Olivia paused, briefly looking away as she mulled over my words, but glared back down with a brightened flame. "Why the hell would she give you the week off, and not me? You're a human!"

"I dunno. Just luck of the draw, I guess." Truth be told, I'd amassed an army of comebacks over the years that I could've laid on her, but certain past experiences taught me to fight off the urge.

151211.content:
Olivia's arms tensed, like she was about to fistfight me for having more free time than her, but she merely scooted her bulk around the other way, leaving a wide path of upturned sand in her wake as she shuffled her ass platform down along the beach. I sat up, watching her with contempt as she trudged off into the sunset, grumbling to herself.

"How the hell did she get a job here?"

"Excuse me, sir?"

"Hm?" I turned my head to a tall, lanky figure standing behind me, one with bright turquoise skin. It was another dragon, one with short, scruffy brown hair and yellow eyes, clad casually in a black tank top and a blue bating suit.

"Would you happen to work here?' He asked gently.

"Well, it's actually my day off, but if it's somethi-"

"Oh, I'm not asking for something, I just wanted to know..." He pointed to Olivia. "That dragon you were just talking with...what's her name?"

"Her name?" Wow. Someone actually wanted to expand their knowledge of Olivia Moenk's existence. "Olivia. Why?"

"Olivia..." He mulled over silently, and then, of all things, smiled. Without looking at me or saying anything else, he grabbed something from inside his pants' pocket and jammed it into my shirt's, quickly following the rough sand path with a vague perk in his step.

"...The heck was that about?" I pondered aloud, pulling out the tip he'd slipped me. Well, at least I got a few- "HOLY SHIT!!!"

In my hands was a fan of five hundred dollar bills.
151211.title: Olivia stomps off, grumbling angrily...

1512111.content:
The White Brimstone was a buffet of fatasses pouring over their seats anytime you'd walk in, the clamor of their ruthless chomping mixed with classical music played over the speakers. The shortest out of all of them were still tall enough that my hairline could meet their shoulders while they were hunched over the tables, whereas the others were huge enough to be held high over a house's room, and fill out just as much property, rarely even conversing as they always sat and stuffed themselves sick with twenty course meals laid on several white-clothed tables' worth.

Truth be told, though, when you step in as a customer, the White Brimstone still looked like a damn good place to eat. The atmosphere was nice and clean, the food actually looked good enough for commercials, and the place smelled friggin' amazing. The giant christmas tree on top of the kitchen was a nice centerpiece, too.

Might as well visit Candace, while I'm here. I mulled over. I weaved through the tables to get into the main kitchen, but I kept a weary eye around me, trying not to get too close or too far from the other patrons. I'd seen cases workers delivering meals so large to our customers that they'd accidentally get swiped up in the meal, more often than not getting swallowed whole, with a 50-50 chance of coming back to work the next day.

Miss Holmes would still chew them out for being tardy.

Thankfully I'd managed to avoid getting snatched away on my way to the main kitchen, where the place was in its usual bustle during the morning.

Except for Candace.

Candace's station was perched in the center, right in the very bullseye of the restaurant. Normally when I'd come in she'd be completely mellow, easy to get a nice hello from, but now she was using the artillery of muscles throbbing within her body to constantly jump between three different cooking stations with impressive speed for somebody so big, with a frantic expression that implied somebody'd bomb the place if she didn't cook just right.

"Hey, Candace. What's up?"

"Sorry, Greg! Can't talkie....must cookie!" Candace tossed a handful of chopped onions into a simmering pan, which erupted in a cloud of steam.

"Candace, is everything alright?" I was actually getting worried. Candace was never the type to scare.

"Would you marry me?" Candace blurted out, hunching forward to flaunt her behind at me. "If you absolutely had to marry somebody right now, like if you had a gun to your head, would it be me?"

"What the hell is going on?"

"I'll tell you what's going on!" Candace spun around, thrusting a batter-laden whisk only inches from my face. "Blake Rainestone is going on!"

"What's Blake Rainestone?"

"Only the most beautiful....thing to ever grace the world with his presence!" Candace said, dreamily, her voice cracking. She yanked down on a string that hung from behind one of the oven vents, unrolling a movie poster that overlooked her work station. "...and he's gonna be in Gaia 2.0 for a whole year!"

The poster was for some movie called Blades of Amber 2. I'd never heard of it, but sure enough, I could recognize the sole figure against the black backdrop. It was the same guy who'd tipped me on the beach, even if the action-star snarl on his face and the gun in his hands were a bit of a detraction.

That, and a smudge of lipstick kissed against his cheek.

"Hey, I saw that guy before!"

Candace instantly froze, her knife stuck in mid-chop. "...you did?"

"Yeah, in the Glass Tornado. He tipped me five hundred dollars!"

Candace stared straight into oblivion for several second before, to my utter horror, she sniffled. "He...he tipped you five hundred dollars?"

"Yeah...but-"

In a flash, Candace was bent over me, grabbing my shoulders as she barked an avalanche of questions into my face. "WHAT WAS HE LIKE WAS HE BEAUTIFUL DID HE LOOK HUNGRY DID YOU KNOW WHICH WAY DID HE WENT SHOULD I SWITCH OVER TO LAUNDRY IF HE-"

"CANDACE!!!" I screamed, surprised that I could instantly shush a muscle-packed dragon towering me by several feet.

"...sorry." She said meekly.

"It's alright... but I just saw him for a few seconds." I explained. "Olivia was giving me crap for having the week off and not her, but when she went off he came up to me, asked what her name was, and tipped me for telling him."

Candace said nothing. Her face didn't change, gazing deep into my eyes with a completely blank stare.

"...Candace?"

"...he asked for Olivia's name?" She finally spoke, her mouth quivering. "...and you gave it to him?"

"Yeah. No big deal."

But Candace looked like she was about to throw up. She weakly stumbled back up, clutching the nearest counter to stay upright. "He's interested...in Olivia. My sister."

"Ah, come on, he's only met her for a day!"

Candace's face still wrenched in disgust at the thought, slamming a fist into the counter hard enough that the cabinet beneath actually cracked. I could almost see hundreds of dreams shattering in her mind, a single tear trickling out of her eye, but her head slowly rose back up with a newfound energy in her face, her eyes visibly blazing orange in a terrifying snarl of determination. "...that's all it takes..."

"...Candace?"

"Chauncey, Edward, I'm gonna need you on fryers A and F! I'm going on break!" She called to two others working in the kitchen, untying her apron. "Greg, I'm gonna need your help."

"Help? With what?"

"You'd met Blake longer than I have, so you can arrange things with him a lot easier!"

"Listen, Candace, I think you're overreacting just a teeny little bit. How could I even-"

But Candace took me by my armpits and gently lifted me up so that our eyes were level, allowing her to give me the most soldier-serious look that anyone had ever given me in my entire life.

"If you help me out and get me to meet Blake Rainestone, I'll make a deal with Miss Holmes that'll get you free food from the White Brimstone for the rest of your life."
1512111.title: OOC is srs bsns

choices: Gain lots of weight so she can compete with Olivia!
15121111.content:
Candace shrouded me under a long shade as she held me against her tense abs, leaning over me as I sat on her lap. The two of us huddled together within a bushel against the beach near the gym, spying through a gap in the leaves on Olivia and Blake, who were now talking with one another some few yards away.

"Look at that." Candace growled. "I threaten to quit my job so she can have a job for once, and what does she do? She steals Blake Rainestone from me!"

Damn. There's that mystery solved.

Candace looked like she could hear them talking a lot better than I could, either by her draconic senses or obsessions, but I had to lean in to just barely make out what they were saying.

"I don't know, I was just thinking maybe we could have dinner together in this place's restaurant." Blake offered politely. "I could even pay, if you'd like!"

"Oh, crap, he's already asking her out!" Candace dreaded.

"Really?" Olivia asked. "Like free food?"

"Sure! I could order you anything you'd desire!"

"Damn. I'm game!"

"Really? You are?"

"Name a time and I'm there."

"How about seven tonight?"

"Seven, and I'm gonna get the extra-extra table special, alright?" She demanded.

"Of course! Meet you then!"

As the two went their separate way, Olivia didn't look the least bit excited by Blake outside of mouthwatering anticipation, but he was shaking in utter glee as he ran off victoriously, joyfully leaping into a front flip and spitting out a green ring of fire in mid-stride.

"He's got a fat fetish." Candace deduced.

"Come on, there's no way you can know that for sure."

"Honeybuns, I work at the Brimstone, and I'd been serving fatasses like Olivia and their husbands for five years. That's a fat fetish."

"Okay, but what're you gonna do about it?"

For a long time, Candace said nothing. But her hands slowly met before my face, her fingers rubbing together, and I looked up to see her narrowing her eyes Olivia, a mischievous smirk tugging the corner of her maw...
15121111.title: Later, in the Glass Tornado...

choices: A day later, on Gregory's first day of fattening duty...
A week later, Candace is making a bit of progress!
A week later, Candace'd been going all out!
151211111.content:
...then she pursed her lips, her claws holding her chin in deep thought. Her lips mouthed out a long list of silent words, but her mind was filled with enough intrigue for them to be heard as a string of breathless whispers.

"six thousand calories a day with eight thousand equaling a pound, and with every meal being approximately two thousand a double in consumption would be"

"Nope." I said, shaking my head as I left her lap and stepped out of the bushel. "Nope, nope, nopity nope."

"Oh, come on, it's just a few thousand pounds!" She argued, not asking me what I thought she was thinking. "Just look around, it's not gonna be anything conspicuous!"

"Candace, listen." I turned around and grabbed Candance by both shoulders. "You're my friend. There's a really short list of stuff that'd to far for me to help you with, but listen, this shoots a straight hole through it."

Candace snorted a tiny puff of smoke. "How?"

"Because this isn't you, Candace! The Candace I know doesn't go around and pout about having some pop idol in her arms to cuddle with forever, or gain a crapton of weight to impress some guy that she'd never even met before! If anything, she'd be the kind to smack the sense back into anybody thinking about that kind of crap!"

But Candace pouted, folding her arms along her broad chest. "You're no fun."

I wanted to say something else, but instead, I simply shrugged, walking away from her. "Well, do what you want, but I'm not gonna be a part of it."

"Alright. How's Christmas and New Year's, then?"

I froze, my foot stuck in heel-toe.

"Help me out, and Miss Holmes'll give you the rest of the year off." She spoke with total honesty.. "Heck, maybe a few days into January, if you wanna play around with your presents a little more!"

For a few seconds, I stood still in thought, then turned around. Candace's head stood over the bush with a serious, trustworthy-looking face.

"So, how's that sound?" She asked. "It sound nice?"

.....


"...and here we are, the humble abode!"

After a quick stop back at the Brimstone, Candace'd swapped her white chef's outfit out for a more casual light blue T-shirt and black jeans. Later on, for the something-dozenth historical landmark that was getting thrown at me for the day, I got to see Candace get the monorail to stop at her house's station in Limestone Ridge, a stop that the train'd normally plow right through on a normal run. It wasn't even much of a station, at least not as well built or streamlined as any of the other resort's stops, but let the train open right onto a stretch of dirt path that was blocked off by a metal gate a short walk from the train, stylishly held shut by a brass lock fitted on where the fences met.

Candace's claws picked into the back of her shirt's collar and pulled out a loop of twine hanging around her neck, with one end tied around a similarly brass-plated key. She unlocked the fence and, with almost no visible effort, pulled the two towering gates apart with the raw might of her arms, inviting me to follow as she stepped through and entered her front yard.

As nice vast as it looked, Candace's home wasn't exactly big enough to be a mansion for her, but stood more along the lines of a pretty rich-looking house somewhere in the hills of California, sitting on top of a long set of brick stone stairs. Like with The Glass Tornado, it'd be pretty hard to step into Limestone Ridge and adapt to the fact that you were still indoors, as the house stood at the very tip of a hill that was shrouded in a dense forest of oak, the backyard laid along the edge of a very deep, gorgeous ravine that was split down the center by a wide river, the half over yonder decorated by a small community of wooden cabin-esque manors visible through a mesh of pine trees.

Taking my bags with her, she lead me to the front door, where she flipped open a panel built on a metal pole standing near where the keyhole would've been. After punching a few numbers into the keypad, she laid her claw on the screen, which scanned its print by a thin green laser. The red bulb at the bottom turned a bright green, and I heard something mechanical click out of place with the lock.

"Just for the fun of feeling rich!" She chuckled, opening the door and standing at the side, waiting for me to enter. "Go on in!"

I looked at her, then into the house, and I went past the doormat.

As I'd expected Candace's home to look, it looked like the home of someone with a considerable amount of wealth and prestige, but she didn't go all out and gold plate everything in sight, either. The foyer was a cavernous living room whose ceiling went up to the very arch of the roof, its slope punched through with a rectangular skylight. The kitchen and dining room were just two little buds that stemmed off the room's space, and a walkway traveled along the roof of the two that traveled past a wide expanse of window overlooking the back, accessed by a staircase sitting to the left of us.

"The guest room's this way." Candace noted, guiding me to a hallway at the foot of the steps. She pointed to the doors she walked past. "That there's my studio, which I'd appreciate you'd not go in, that door there goes down to the basement, where I think we'll be hanging out for the most of your stay, and right there's the library." but then we passed by a door held shut by a plethora of padlocks, and her face grew deathly serious. "...and that's my hoard. DON'T GO IN THERE."

"Y-Yes, ma'am!" I stammered, saluting out of reflex.

Candace saw the gesture, and her hardened look softened with a touch of guilt, and she continued to last one. "...and this is the guest room, where you'll be staying."

She opened the door at the very end, which lead into a more standard, yet homely-looking bedroom. The bed, dresser, wardrobe, and bathroom door all looked a bit scaled up for what a human would've normally lived in, but everything looked passable enough for me to spend a few nights.

"Not bad." I observed, nodding. I took my bags from her and set them on the table at the bed's foot, snapping open the latches. "So, what happens now?"

Her claw came down on her shoulder. "As of now, Gregory, you're on lazy duty." She answered, her tone almost sounding like she was knighting me. "You're here to cook me up some grub, and make sure I don't make any unnecessary movement. Got it?"

"Got it." I replied, nodding once.

"...and I'd say right now's about time, or maybe the qualification round." She continued, smiling. "Sound up to three firesauce burgers, and two platters of sugar fries?"

I was. It sounded pretty much like just a scratch under the size most other customer's orders. "Yes, Ma'am!"

"Alright! Sure hope I chose right with you, kid."

.....


"Here you go, Candace!"

Although she wasn't a man, Candace's basement had all the fixings of someone's man cave. The walls were all hardwood and decorated by movie posters, the tv was wired to a market of players and consoles arranged within the stand, and a mini bar sat along the wall behind the couch, all on top of a thick bed of maroon carpeting.

Even if I hadn't seen her eat anything, the bulkiness of Candace's muscles almost made her look fat by the way she comfortably sat within the armchair. Her tense abs almost gave her a bit of a pot belly, and hand in hand with a life of taste-testing, she already had a bit of roundness in her abdomen to start off with.

"Thanks, Gregory! Just put it on the tray here." She answered excitedly, motioning her head to a poker table standing before her. The silver platter I carried in felt pretty weighty, holding three of the most expensive meal in the world and a heaping pile of one of the sweetest, most fattening side items to grace us with its presence, but for good measure, I threw in a tall glass mug of champagne soda.

"Alright..." Candace began, intently staring at the first burger she grabbed, taking a moment to savor the moment and hold it before her maw. "...no turning back. Ready?"

"Ready."

With that, she opened her mouth wide, and bit down on her first chomp.

Candace thought for a moment before answering his question... with another one. "Say... have you ever heard of a Great Gaian Tuna?" "No, what is it?" "The Great Gaian Tuna is a monster of a fish. It can grow up to 6 feet and its meat has the highest amounts calories on the fish market. But there's a catch to getting those calories. You must eat it raw." "Soooo, what's your point?" "Well there's going to be a shipment of them heading to the White Brimstone today. I'm sure they won't mind if we took a couple of them." Greg couldn't believe what she was suggesting right now. "YOU WANT US TO STEAL FROM THE RESORT!?" Candace quickly grabbed Greg and pushed into her fat belly. "Ssssssshhhh, not so loud" Candace shushed Greg. After about a minute she released him. "Candace we could lose our jobs for this. Miss Holmes might actually eat me alive if she finds out."

"Fourth of July and Easter." Candace said. "Huh?" Greg said confusedly "I'll add the Fourth of July and Easter to your day offs, Miss Holmes doesn't allow human-exclusive holidays so I'll convince her to add those to your day offs." "........"

Then we take a few and book it. Here they come!" A white truck with a blue fish on top slowly backs up. Two able bodied anthros jump out the truck. The first was a muscular bear anthro and the second a hefty cat, both male. They unhinge the lock on the truck's back doors and open them. Candace and Greg thought they would be out a rack of dead tuna, they were dead wrong. What the two anthros pulled out was a giant fish tank with many tunas swimming in it.

"You have got to be kidding me..." Greg literally just fell to his knees. "Oh stop over exaggerating." Candace picked him up and put him back on his feet. The two anthros left the truck, probably to get equipment. "Okay now's our chance let's go." Candace perked and ran, with all of her expanded curves wobbling about. Greg followed behind.

The two of them approached the tank seeing a ladder on the side. "So who goes up?" Greg asked. "You go, I'll break the ladder if I go up." "What no, you go up." Candace glared at Greg, then cupped a hand at the side of her face. "Huh...hear that? Sounds like organ music!" "Organ music?" Greg asked. He reluctantly climbs the ladder and makes it to the top. "Okay Greg you can do this." He said to himself. Greg drove his arms in and grabbed one before tosing it down. Olivia grabbed it by the tail. "Okay try getting one more." "Oh come on!" "LEMONADE, GREG." "the things people will do for love." Greg squeaked again. He grabbed another and dropped it. Candace grabbed it by the tail as well. "Okay let's go." Candance ran to her place. "Hey wait for me!" He slid down the ladder and followed.

Back at the manor, the two of them saw their fruits of labor. Laying there were two big tunas flopping about. "Now what?" "Let's take them out back I know the perfect way to eat them." The duo each grabbed one by the tail and dragged the two fish to the back of Candace's manor.

"You are going to drop them into my mouth." She finished. "Whatever you say boss." Greg tugs the two fish and brought one on to the board. He picks it up, practically hugging it, and looked down where Candace was. He saw that she's standing below with her maw wide open. "Well, here goes" He says before dropping it. Sadly, from the floor of the empty pool, there was barely anything in sight or reach that could've helped her out. Nothing, that is, until she caught a stray glance of the diving board, sparking an idea in her mind.
