155112.content:
"...Aether Seaside?" I whistled, pleased to know that I'd be visiting the Glass Tornado.

"A ceremony under the sun, two whole weeks with the ocean as our backyard..." Melanie rambled, leaning her head on Peter's shoulder. "Doesn't it sound just wonderful, sweetie?"

Peter gave a low grunt, still immersed by his impromptu feedbag.

"Very well, then!" I said as I snapped my lighter shut, suddenly filled with a newfound energy for what the next few weeks had in store. "Shall we get checked in?"

.....


"Oh...my...god."

I held in a snicker as Melanie let out a gasp, hands cupped over her maw in amazement as the elevator doors opened directly into the Aether Seaside's penthouse. Even her assistants stalled as she went right in and made herself known to the suite, her smile becoming almost illegally adorable as she gleefully took in all the red leather cushioning wrapped around all the room's the furnishes, the deep crimson hardwood floors, and a highly modern chandelier that sat suspended over one half of the room, overlooking a little living area with a brick fireplace and a wide plasma screen tv, the other half a kitchen and dining table suited up with the most pristine marble countertops. All of the wall away from us was made out of windows, an arching balcony outside that gave a spanning view of the Glass Tornado's pseudo-ocean. The sunlight alone shining through the veranda and skylight enough that the room was decently lit with all the lights off.

"It's beautiful!" She swooned, flaunting an impressive ability to easily move around as she swayed her way over to the balcony door. "It's even better than what I'd been hoping for!"

Peter, who was finally finishing off the last survivor of his sugary hoard, gave a listless nod as he stuffed a solitary snack cake into his maw.

I suspiciously glanced his way, then shook my head. "...and it's even better when it's not just a good view!" I added with a smirk, hitching up some of their bags from the baggage cart. "If you guys want a tour, I'll just get all your bags laid out, maybe give the two of you a little while to get stewed before we-"

"Actually..." Melanie said thoughtfully, still looking out at the balcony. Her face had gone from utterly ecstatic to inquisitive, her eyes narrowing in tense concentration as she took a step back and held her arms out, forming a vague rectangle with her fingers. "...I think I want it here!"

"The tour?" I asked. "Well, I guess can give you a little run through of all the stuff available here, but-"

"Not the tour, silly!" Melanie giggled. "The ceremony! The balcony would be a perfect place to hold it!"

I furrowed a brow. "Excuse me?"

"Come on out, Peter!" She said enthusiastically as she slid open the door and went outside, while Peter slowly obeyed and followed after. "I can imagine it right here! The altar, the seats, all the seats and tables, it could all happen right here, right next to the view!"

"You sure?" I asked, coming out and going to her side. "I mean, there's a whole lot of other sights to see around here, and not even at the Glass Tornado! You don't want to see them?"

"It'd be nice, sure." She shrugged. "But right now, I know that this is exactly what I want!"

"Well...if you insist..." I answered, voice tapering out. I looked over to Peter, wanting to observe his reaction, but he almost seemed utterly devoid of sensation when there wasn't food on hand, with nothing left to satisfy his apparent tastes. Again, he hadn't even acknowledged the view as he went up to Melanie's side, taking her hand.

"You want more, dear?" She asked. Peter nodded, but he didn't seem excited, or even smile. "Of course. Gregory?"

"Yes, miss?"

"Have some lunch served up here, would you?" She poked Peter in his stomach, which had rounded out enough from his feasting that its gray fur was partly exposed from his shirt. "Don't wanna keep my hubby waiting!"
155112.title: ...Aether Seaside."

1551121.content:
"Miss Grove, Mister Bestwick," I gave a bow. "Lunch...is served."

Melanie gave the air a sniff, already licking her lips as she inhaled some of the steam coming off the sheet of plates laid out on the dining table. "My, it smells wonderful! Thank you!"

She unfurled a napkin along her breasts, then took a knife and fork to daintily cut herself a bite of hay-steak from a plate right in front of her. With the legs of the table jacked up a few notches, her head sat comfortably level with a five course meal of hay-burgers, hay-stew, hay-lasagna, hay-chili, or whatever other variations of fatty foods existed that could've been stewed out of hay, her shoulders shuddering as she felt the flavors hit her tongue, but she didn't lose control over the first bite. She eagerly began cutting herself the next hunk of faux-meat, but still took the time to swallow her meal and continue at a leisurely pace.

As large as her section of the feast was, however, it seemed huddled into a corner by the sheer amount that she'd had ordered for Peter. As the two ate at opposite ends of the table, watching him in action made it harder to hide the growing feeling of confusion within me; Peter hadn't given her any sign as to what he wanted or how much of it he wanted to eat, but once something edible was placed in front of him, he just reached in with his hands and scooped up whatever was on the closest plate with his bare hands, eating it up like he was living through a famine.

"Are you enjoying the hay-ratatouille?" She'd ask, or some other stray comment along those lines, which Peter would respond to with a grunt. "Me, too!"

Beneath all of her belly blubber, the weight of the food she'd eaten was barely visible up until she'd knocked over the first half of her meal, where I could squint and see a vague, yet considerable food baby growing within her stomach, but the minor layer of pudge that rounded Peter out couldn't disguise how grotesquely bloated he was becoming. His stomach ballooned enough that his shirt rode up under his chest, exposing fur that thinned out along a layer of skin that was painfully red, but he either ignored or wasn't aware of whatever agony it was in and tortured it by sending in more. He didn't even seem pleasured by the food, his eyes still locked in that same bored look that now seemed totally indestructible; he just ate, his arms mechanically going through the motions of going forward and back from the plates like it was some natural reflex that was all his brain knew how to do.

The two didn't speak, but Melanie watched him gorge himself like he was giving her the world.

Eventually, all the plates in front of him were licked clean, the ones down in the center too far for him to reach and he bent forward against his distended gut.

"Here, sweetie, let me help you..." Melanie offered, rising up from her seat. She grabbed the crank for the legs on her end of the table and wound it up, making them rise so the entire table was on a slant. All the plates slid down towards Peter's waiting mouth, and he did an impressive job of keeping the flow coming towards him in control by shoveling in whatever was about to pile up.

Noticing all the empty plates bunching up in front of him, I sprung into action and dove under the table, grabbing at whatever fell off before it could shatter on the floor. I grimaced at how clean the plates were; all of them were utterly devoid of smudges and stains aside from a thin layer of saliva that coated them all.

It was two whole minutes of plate catching until I finally heard Peter breath out for once, leaning back on his chair with a winded sigh. Melanie's hands came down from behind him and pressed deep into its tender flesh, letting her fingers run through her fur as she stroked it up and down.

"Mmn...oh, Peter," I could hear her bite out. "Just let it all in, and let yourself rest it all off..."

She then grabbed at his stomach, pulling up to coax him to rise out of the chair. The two went over to the living room, with Peter's walk reduced to a stagger as the weight of his overly bloated stomach hung down on him like he was cradling a medicine ball. When they were out the couch, he let himself fall down into the cushions on his side, his face pointing away from me as Melanie sauntered over behind the couch, eyes low and loving as she reached down and massaged his tight middle.

"Gregory?" She said distractedly. "Why don't you go ahead and take a break?"
1551121.title: Lunch arrives, Gregory watches them eat.

15511211.content:
"Honey, you absolutely have to give some of these truffles a taste! They're absolutely magnificent!"

"Oh, Peter, are you still hungry? Don't worry, I'll just order up another lunch."

"Another rip? Don't worry, dear. In a place like this, that can't be the first time that's happened!"

In all of a week's work of gushing, praise, and sensual rubbing, Peter never answered with anything louder than a distracted snort or a low nod of his head, often still left with several plates before his mouth was free to move. Give Melanie credit, if all her constant pandering was genuine, she certainly wasn't a gold digger; never once did I witness Peter act remotely charming or romantic towards her, and yet she returned his munching with all the love that her heart could give, always standing near him with a twinkle in her eyes, like his mere presence was a rare privilege.

Watching the two of them be with one another drew on into more of a chore, however. Nothing insufferable, mind you, but most of the days went by in total silence as the two of them just stood around with Melanie always squished against his back, nuzzling him from above. I'd tried losing myself in the wedding preparations to find any kind of a distraction from them, but without any direction as to what they specifically wanted the ceremony to be like, being forced to stay in the penthouse for such a long time got all the more tiring. Melanie never broke out of her infatuation enough to tell me what her specific desires for the arrangements were, and with Peter's stomach getting bigger and bigger, none of the suits we'd had tailored for him never lasted any longer than two days, and he showed absolutely no emotion as he ripped his way through both Octavia's patience and thousands of dollars worth of material.

"Lower...lower...lower...lower..." I instructed to Miles. He stood on top of a super-reinforced metal stepladder sitting beneath the wedding arch, one hand busy feeding him a burrito while the other was held over his head, carefully lowering a bouquet of plastic roses down in front of the archway's crux. "lower...lower...lower...aaaaaaand...there!"

He stopped his arm, then held the burrito in his mouth to use both hands to fasten down the bouquet.

"Alright. Looks good!" I approved, shooting him a thumb's up, then turned around to observe the rest of the scene behind us. "Looks...well adjusted."

So far, were it not for the fact that it was being held in Gaia 2.0, the wedding looked insultingly plain, the arrangements probably not even mounting up to a thousand dollars. The railway of the penthouse's balcony was all wound up by vines of bushel that were periodically dotted by pink roses, and the empty flooring was spanned by a wide semicircle of plastic white chairs that surrounded the altar. One end of the balcony was reserved to a dining area made up of similarly bland tables and chairs, draped by white table cloths with the plates, utensils, and floral centerpieces all laid out, while the other end was a dance floor complete with a DJ booth, lights, and two tables sitting against the guard rail, a long one for the buffet, and a round one for the cake.

Miles came to my side, joining me in looking over the preparations as he pushed the last of the burrito down his throat with one finger. At any other time, a job as easy as this would've been something out of a wet dream of mine, but as it all sat right in front of me, I couldn't help but feel disturbed by the cheapness of it all, to see it in a world where bottled water came with golden leaves floating inside.

"Mind going through a quick brush-through, Miles?" I asked, and the immense goat gave a nod before walking towards the dance floor, already tearing open a bag of pork rinds. I made my way over to the sliding doors and into the living room, listening for Melanie's voice.

"Another popped button?" It came from over at the master bedroom. "Oh, well. We can visit Octavia tonight, then."

"Miss Grove?" I spoke, going their way. The door to their room was wide open, the lights inside turned on. "We've got the preparations set up for the wedding, and I was wondering if you wanted to..."

"Anyways, you should definitely try one of these churros!"

The two didn't notice me as I came up the doorway, continuing as I stood frozen in place. Peter didn't answer her.

"Aw, what's the matter, sweetie?" She asked, lips pouting slightly. "Don't you want something to eat?"

She and he stood facing one another, Peter with his arms outstretched while dressed up in a new suit, and Melanie with her head shaking slightly as she looked down at a few button's that's been popped off along his stomach, exposing a sliver of the gray, piling ocean of mass hidden within, its middle darkened by his belly button. He was still a deal shorter than her, but ever since switching from the real world's food to that of Gaia 2.0's, his weight'd skyrocketed in record time, and thus his once humble potbelly had quickly exploded out into a unyieldingly monstrous gut that proudly amassed in a massive orb that had a garment straddled along its underside that kept it from getting dirtied up, overwhelming all of his entire being's shape from the ponderous hills of his chest to a wide expanse of the wooden floor.

"Well, at least give them a taste, then. Wouldn't want these to go to waste, would we?" There was still that sing-song essence to her voice, the kind she used whenever she was showing her affection, but something about it was now laced with a hint of aggression, like part of her was daring him to say no. That wasn't what shocked me, though, what truly chilled me to my bone about the scene playing for me.

It was that, as Melanie held a silver platter of churros in front of his face, he wasn't opening up and downing it all down. In fact, he seemed intimidated by it.

As Peter took the plate back, clearly at ends on whether or not to eat it, I caught my guard back and sidestepped back into the hallway, clearing my throat. "...Miss Grove?"

"Hm?" I could hear the floor creak under her footfalls before she leaned partway through the door, smiling earnestly. "Yes, Gregory?"

"I'd, uh...wanted to talk to you about the wedding arrangements!" I answered, having to remember why I wanted to see her in the first place. "Would you like to have a look?"

"I'd love to!" She merrily replied, coming out all the way. She lead herself down to the sliding doors, eliciting some giddy squeal as she saw all the floral decorations ready for the big event, but it was partially turned to white noise as I halfheartedly followed behind, gaze lingering on the light coming from their bedroom...


.....



"Mn..." I groaned. "...I give up."

The stress of the wedding was eased up by Melanie's approval of all the decorations, and what'd I'd seen happening with Peter was only a vague afterthought by then, but for whatever reason, my bed just wouldn't let me fall asleep that night. I'd spent hours tossing and turning around, trying to find that magic position that I could never quite remember, but it remained as elusive as ever. I was wide awake when I just decided to get up and leave the bed behind, deciding to take a break from the darkness of the butler's room.

As quietly as I could, I strode across the penthouse and over to the balcony doors, the sky of the dome outside having been converted into a starry night as I made my way out. The pseudo-moon cast enough light to see all the decorations as silhouettes, their shadows visible along the ground.

I went over to the guard rail and, careful not to disrupt the bushel, folded my arms over the rim and stared out at the ocean, the moon's reflection refracted into a swarm of shimmering lights. It was rare sight, to see the Glass Tornado in nighttime mode, and I gave a smile as I took advantage of the privilege, taking in a deep breath of the crisp, warm ai-

THUMP

"...huh?" I turned my head over to the noise, looking down near the other end of the balcony.

THUMP

The sound came again, but this time was accompanied by two burly arms bursting through one of the penthouse's windows, making me jump. Their hands waved around till they both found the wall outside, and they pushed down, the owner's head and part of their chest wriggling their way out.

"The hell?" I swiftly ran over to them, still trying to make as little noise as possible, but I nearly stumbled when I was close enough to recognize who it was, despite it being so dark.

It was Peter, his chest's mounds keeping him wedged firmly within the window as he tried to force his way through. His eyes were clenched shut, teeth gritted as he pushed against the wall, but it kept him held tightly in place, and he soon resigned with a tired sigh as his shoulders drooped. An almost hopeless look crossed his face as he caught his breath, his head hung low, but then his eyes twitched my way and went wide as he realized I was standing there, watching him in utter confusion.

"Hey...hey, hey fella! You've gotta help me!" He desperately pleaded to me. "Listen, you've gotta get me out of here!"

I didn't immediately answer, still reeling in the fact that I was hearing him speak for the first time, and all the questions in my mind all came out as one. "...excuse me?"

He started trying to push himself through again, speaking through a clenched jaw. "Gotta...get...out of here! She's crazy!"

"I..." I rubbed my forehead. "I'm sorry, sir, but you've gotta explain to me a little more. What's going on?"

"She's friggin' crazy, is what's going on!" He explained, shooting a thumb behind him. "I'd just met her last week! I hadn't even heard of her before, but one minute later, she's always hanging around me, treating me like I'm her boyfriend! I'd used to be a friggin'...
15511211.title: Sometime later in the week...

choices: Melanie notices that Gregory was eavesdropping, and yanks him in!
Gregory slips past them and goes to the fire escape, and runs off to get help!
155112111.content:
"Come again?"

"She...did..." He grunted out, trying again to wriggle free. "...did...something to me! I don't know what it is, but anytime she's around, there's always this weird shit going on that makes me d-"

He was cut off as he felt himself get sucked back in by a little, eyes bugging out.

"No..." He said softly, then began scrambling in a panic to push his way out. "No, no, nonononononoNO!!!"

But with a loud schlup, his chest slipped past the window frame as his entire body slinked back into the room. His fingers dragged along the wall's molding till they were dearly clinging to the windowsill, and he gave one last fearful whimper before another yank tugged them loose, pulling him all the way in.

"The hell?!" I thought aloud, hearing a tussle inside that was minced with his pleas for help. I took a fondue pot off the buffet line and set it down on a chair, then got up on the tabletop to watch in on the scene, having to stand on my tiptoes to see over the windowsill.

Peter grabbed for anything in reach as he got dragged along the floor by his ankles, Melanie with a bemused look on her face as she threw him back onto the bed, sinking an elbow down into his belly to keep him pinned on his back.

"Now, sweetie," she began sternly. "You know I won't be comfortable being around you if we don't look issues like these right in the eye. If our marriage is going to stay intact, then we need to found a relationship that's built off of communication and mutual respect! Don't you understand that?"

"I ain't gonna marry you for shit, you bitch!" He spat at her. "The fuck kind of relationship you looking for when you've gotta pin me down to the bed, anyway?!"

Melanie reared her head back, but not out of surprise. She seemed more ashamed than anything, her head shaking out of pity. "Sacrifice is the backbone to every good romance, Peter, and I'd like to think I'd given plenty of myself to make you happy. I'd gotten you into Gaia 2.0, of all things! Is it too much to ask for anything in return, to see a little bit of effort on your part? Where is it, Peter?"

"I don't know, but you sure as hell ain't gonna find it here!" He retorted, rocking about to break free of her. "C'mon, just...lemme go, you psycho!!!"

Melanie's frown deepened, and she reached both hands behind her back. "Well, I'm sorry, but I don't like us being as far as we are if one of us can't trust the another. However," She pulled her shirt up, stripping herself into to a lacy black bra. "I can fix that."

As she threw the shirt down on top of his stomach, and as he craned his head up to look at his topless captor, Peter froze. The darkness of the room helped cover up the seams, making it look as though Melanie's body really was mostly naked, but as both of our eyes adjusted to the dim light, we could both see that she was actually dressed up in some slim-fitting garment that closely matched the color of her fur. The anger on his face ebbed away into a look of remembrance, a realization whose implication seemed to bring on a slew of terrible memories that filled his heart with a great well of fear, distracting him long enough for her to take off her pants and throw them on top of him, as well.

"No..." He sputtered, his lip quivering. "N-No...no, please! DON'T DO IT!!!"

"Take a deep breath, dear." She spoke evenly, her tone devoid of any sarcasm.

She spun around, bending over so that her big behind was hovering just above his face. He desperately pushed against her cheeks, trying to wrestle himself as though she were about to smother his face, but she didn't lower it onto him. Not yet, at least. Whilst humming a merry tune, she brought her hands down to the root of her tail, fidgeting with the head of a zipper that traveled along the valley of her butt crack.

She pulled it down, and when the zipper was unzipped enough that her compacted behind was able to freely push its way through, she churned out a moan of overwhelmed pleasure as the lower part of her corset was thrown off by her legs exploding in mass, instantly transforming her body's shape into that of an enormous, white pear that was wider than the bed. The weight of her newly gigantic butt cheeks was enough for them to hang low and swallow up Peter's head, his arms and legs thrashing about as he tried to let loose some muffled screams, but Melanie still made sure to let herself lower down and bring all the crushing weight of her body on top of his chest.

Ignoring his thrashing, she flipped open a tiny beauty mirror and began to check up on her make up, and through the entire debacle, I just stood still in terrified silence, ignoring the pain of standing right on the ends of my toes as I watched, unsure of what to do. The movement of his limbs eventually began to simmer down, as did the urgency in his voice, and I feared the worst as he briefly held them up with what looked like the last errant of his strength, keeping them erect in one final pose of resistance before they slumped down, limp at his sides. Having noticed he'd stopped moving, Melanie looked over her shoulder and got back up, the weight of her buttocks still resting on top of him even when she was standing up nice and tall, and she actually had to reaching down with her hands and hoist them off of him, straddling to the side. With Peter's head allowed to breath air again, his eyes were wide and drained of emotion, but to my relief, his chest was still rising and falling from his breaths.

Melanie came low, and with her stomach and breasts as large as they were, she had to do so by rolling onto her back, the extra padding on her behind angling her feet up as she brought her muzzle to Peter's ears.

"Listen to me very closely, dear." She spoke, making his ear twitch. "You want to eat. You have to eat, to eat everything in reach at every waking hour, always getting bigger and bigger. Try as you may, though, you're never full. You're never big enough, never satisfied. Always hungry for more. Do you understand me?"

Peter sucked on his lower lip, than gave a single nod.

"Good." She said approvingly, coming in to give him a kiss on the forehead.

As she got up on her feet, picking up the downed half of her corset, I saw my cue to duck, maybe scram over to Miss Holmes' office to beg for help, but the notion of making a single sound terrified me too much to move. To even breathe, which I didn't know I was holding in until I caught myself and, as slowly as I possibly could, bent my legs down to slip away from view...
155112111.title: ...track runner, for christsake!"

15512.content:
I'm going to be honest: many people knew that Melanie was bi-sexual, she'd been seen on many dates with many different men and women. It's just that no one expected her to finally settle down.

But she did have good taste. And this woman was quite beautiful.

The bride was a leopard woman, in her mid-twenties and somewhere between 15 and 18 feet tall. She was covered in orange fur with black spots, had black hair reaching her mid-back in a ponytail and green eyes. She might have been smaller then Melanie, but she was still huge. Her breasts were like overinflated beach balls, barely contained in her top. Her belly was twice her breasts size, and like Melanie's, it wobbled with every little movement. Her hips were nearly 10 feet wide, and her butt stuck out like a shelf. She was wearing a black jacket with a blue top under it, white jeans, and a pair of blue platform heels.

The woman was looking around the lobby, clearly impressed by the opulance around her. Her smile was reaching from ear to ear. I decide to walk over to introduce myself.

"Hello there." I say in my most professional voice. The woman looks down at me "My name is Gregory. I'm assuming you're Melanie's soon to be wife?"

The woman nodded. "My name is Tina Blake, soon to be Tina Grove!" The woman said, in a cheery Louisiana accent. "I ain't never really been to a place so grand lookin' before! It's amazing!"

"We do pride ourselves on giving out guests the greatest luxary possible." I say. "I will be assisting you and Melanie with your wedding."

"There's my blushing bride!" I hear Melanie say as she walks over. She kisses Tina on the cheek, then looks at meet. "I see you've met Tina already."
I nod. "Is there anything I should know to make this the best three weeks of your life?" I ask.

"Just one thing." Tina says. "I have Gannett's Syndrome."

I'd heard of that. It was a rare condition tha caused the infected to perpetually gain weight, even if they don't eat. There's another guest here with it, but from the looks of it, Tina's far nicer.

"Don't worry." I say. "We'll make your stay as comfortable as possible. Now, where would you like to go first?"

Melanie and Tina looked at each other, whispered to each other for a second, then looked at me again.

Melanie was the one to answer. "We'd like to go..."
15512.title: Here Comes the Bride~

155121.content:
"If you don't mind, our wedding is being held at one of the ledges in Limestone Ridge, and I'd like to make sure that things will go smoothly." Melanie said. "The wedding planners were supposed to arrive before us."

"Of course." I replied. "We always make sure things are in tip-top shape here at the resort. Please follow me to the monorail." With that, I turned and headed in the direction of the monorail station, Melanie and Tina following behind.

----------
It took a few hours (Limestone Ridge is a bit out of the way, even for Gaia 2.0), but we did arrive at Limestone Ridge's station. The three of us got off, and left the station quickly.

I had to admit, I always did enjoy visiting the Ridge. Home to probably the worlds only indoor mountain, Mt. Ciel Divisé, everything was made to be beautiful. I'd even heard rumor that Mt. Ciel Divisé was here before Gaia 2.0, and is hiding a lost platinum, but no one's found it.

"Welcome to Limestone Ridge." I said in my most professional voice. "Now, where will the wedding be taking place?"

"Ski Lodge 12." Melanie said. "It's supposed to be half-way up the mountain."

I nodded and motioned for the two brides-to-be to follow me to the sky trolley, which was connected to the station. The three of us got in, and the trolley started to move.

"So, if I may ask, how did you two meet?" I asked.

"Well," Tina started. "Melanie held a contest. Whoever one would get to visit her studio. I was the winner. I went, and Melanie took a liking to me. After the day was over, she asked me out!"

Melanie grinned at the memory. "We dated for a few months, and then just like that, I asked Tina to marry me. And here we are." She said.

"I'm very happy for you two." I said. Just then, the trolley stopped. "We've arrived."

We stepped out of the trolley, and made our way to Ski Lodge 12. It was actually the smallest of the lodges, but still huge. It was also the newest lodge.
When we got to the lodge, a male gecko man greeted Melanie. I assumed he was one of the wedding planners. After a short discussion with him, we all entered the lodge.

And it turns out...
155121.title: A Mountainous Wedding

choices: Tina's fit was about the music, right? Confront the DJ
1551212.content:
"And here we are, ladies! The latest and greatest of our accommodations at Limestone Ridge, Lodge Twelve!" I made a sweeping gesture around the lobby, and couldn't hide my smirk at how the two women's eyes lit up. The whole place was a huge timber cabin, with one wall dominated by windows that gave a fantastic view of the mountains outside. As for the interior, the wood floor was polished to a sheen; even reflecting the plush seats and old-timey rocking chairs by the roaring fireplace. The chairs circling a glass-top coffee table neatly decorated with flowers and candles. A massive flatscreen TV rested on a classy wooden shelf, tuned to a jazz channel for atmosphere; on either side of the shelf were large bookshelves packed to the gills with literature.

Miss Holmes may have been a ruthless, hard-driving heifer of a boss; and made no secret that she found humans delicious, but she knew how to decorate.

Melainie smiled at the promise of a warm fire, and she scooted over there almost immediately, Tina following her. They sat close to the fire and warmed their hands as I kept schmoozing it up: "Lodge Twelve is our smallest lodge, but that doesn't mean we skimped on amenities. You ladies will find all the comforts of our larger lodges here...with an added benefit of privacy. Less chance of papparazzi, or fans pestering for autographs."

They both chuckled at that. The whole lodge was empty save for us--the brides-to-be must have rented out the whole place for their special day. There wouldn't be anyone in here besides the two of them.

I clapped my hands together. "So, ladies...make yourselves at home! You can rest assured we'll make your special day unforgettable!"

I got a little applause for that, Tina leaning down to nuzzle me. "Aww, you practiced that little speech just for us; didn't you?"
"Such a gentleman!" Melaine added.

I'd actually made it up on the spot, but they didn't need to know that.

"Ahem..."
We all turned to the voice. It was the gecko wedding planner who'd come in with them. "I hate to interrupt, but; uh, we have some details to clear up...starting with the music." He brandished a clipboard, looking nervous.

I sized the guy up. He was on the scrawny side, wore thick glasses and a grey three-piece suit that didn't quite look right with his green scales. The outfit looked so fresh he might have bought it this morning--the creases on the pants looked sharp enough to shave with. But what struck me the most was his size: 9 feet tall, give or take a few inches. Most anthros I'd seen at Gaia 2.0 were BIG--some "only" as tall as a street light, others could look an office building in the eye. Hell, the resort's maximum allowed hieght was 100 feet...and I'd heard we were planning some expansions to cater to anthros even BIGGER than that! So, when you've been around anthros who could LITERALLY hold you in the palm of their hand, seeing one who'd be at home on a human basketball court is a bit odd.

(And no, I wasn't spacing out or staring. All that went through my head in a flash. With my job, you learn to think quickly.)

"What about the music, Mister...erm--" I trailed off. I realized none of us had caught his name.

"Larry Izzard. No relation to Eddy Izzard the comedian, and yes; I know that makes my intials 'L. Izzard'." He provided, nervousness falling to roll his eyes. His jittery mood returned as he looked at the clipboard, and the two larger ladies. "Uh, Miss Tina did request the playlist be largely composed of Melainie's 'greatest hits'. But it seems there was an issue with timing and rights; so...ahem, our DJ put a substantial number of COVERS on the playlist." He winced, looking like...well, like a HUMAN who just pissed off a giant anthro.

Tina's cheery mood fell like an anvil. "What?" she hissed, claws coming out. Melaine's eyes widened, Larry and I took a step back. "Covers? Covers?! It's our special day, and the DJ won't even play my sweetie singing her OWN MUSIC?! We get some karaoke?! I don't--I can't--That's---UGH!" She stomped her foot, making her ample belly jiggle and wave. "That's ridiculous. Fix it!"

Then Tina's anger delfated, and she hang her head in shame. "Oh, listen to me! I'm throwing a fit like a bratty child; and over something so trivial! I'm sorry for snapping..." Melanie hugged her and we all assured her it was fine; eventually her bright mood returned and she was calm again.
But in the pit of my gut? I knew this was gonna be rough.

The thing about those "brides-from-hell" shows I mentioned? The brides who KNEW they were being Bridezillas were WORSE than the ones who thought they were right. They could swing from a screaming fit to crying apologies at the drop of a hat. And that just primed their mood to be on MORE of a hair trigger, even if they were normally friendly and pleseant.

Larry gulped. "Ah; it's okay ma'am. We'll get it sorted ASAP, you two just relax."
I nodded along with him, helping to get the pair settled in.

An hour or so later the pair were off skiing, leaving Larry and I alone in the lodge. We'd set out charts and plans for the wedding, trying to get everything organized.

And our first order of business was...
1551212.title: Tina became Bridezilla

info.brief_description: The life of a human in a resort filled with giant anthros...
info.description:
At the lower edge of New York's upstate, the much famed resort Gaia 2.0 exists as the largest one that's ever come to exist in the world, complete with a world class restaurant, a VIP casino, an indoor golf course, an indoor simulated beach, and even its own private train line. Gaia 2.0 meets universal acclaim as one of the most ambitious vacation spots ever made, but only for the wealthiest clients. Our story begins on December 15th during a particularly brutal snowstorm for the winter, yet guests are still able to find means of trickling into the suites.

Only the highest of the highest 1% could afford to live more than half a day, that being anthros, the highest of the social circle in the world. Any human wanting a peek inside can buy a $500 visitor's pass for an hour inside. That, or they're hiring...

The Tour


Aether Suites: The main hotel, built with beautifully furnished rooms, fine dining, a spacious courtyard complete with a swimming pool and a tennis court, and easy and quick service willing to step up to every desire at every moment. The Aether Suites connects to every facility in the resort, with miniature tentacle locations built in the Glass Tornado and Limestone Ridge.

The White Brimstone: The resort's most famous restaurant, boasting a five-star rating that even then can't match anything served. Every single ingredient down to the condiments is made and farmed from scratch, making anything on their menu impossible to recreate. Their most expensive meal costs 10,000 dollars, and their least 300.

The Glass Tornado: Not just the pool facility of the resort, but also a perfectly simulated tropical island beneath a dome that constantly maintains a warm environment, even in winter. A wave pool surrounds the entire body of land, crashing waves along its sandy shores, while the heart of the island is a mountainous landscape built with numerous boardwalks, pools, saunas, spas, cantinas, and a diverse waterpark descending from its tallest peak. Their deepest pool is not only over 200 feet deep, but features underwater suites for more aqua-savvy guests, along with an air-filled alcove deep below containing the Aurora night club.

Aurora Night Club: An arctic-themed exclusive night club at the very bottom of the Glass Tornado's main pool, open nightly and available by regular water taxis that travel down from the surface.

Diamond Mines: The basement for the Aether Suites, and also a cavernous shopping mall that's home to the biggest collection of brand names, beauty services, and (of course) food chains in the world.

The Opticuluum: A gigantic movie theater that houses screenings for everything from films that'd been classic for decades to films whose releases aren't due for months. The deluxe theaters screen films with all the style and service of a gigantic opera house, using projectors that perfectly replicate the scratches and dirt of classic film, but some of the newer theaters host act as one of the rare market for the groundbreaking video tech known as CinevieTM, one of the most expensive, yet immersive feats of seeing ever invented.

Limestone Ridge: Like the Glass Tornado, Limestone Pastures is a mountainous indoor region under a dome that conjures a perpetual springtime season, giving guests wanting a hike the freshest air you could find indoors, or even let them test their hand at a gigantic eighteen-hole golf course. Aside from a branch of the Aether Suites built inside, guests also have the oppurtunity to live in enormous cabins, one of which is actually Miss Holmes' mansion and office. (Created by The 12th Doctor (non canon))

The Rainbow Dome: A vast, skygrazing sports multiplex in the upper regions of the resort (positioned on top of the Glass Tornado and near the Fate's Hand) where guests are allowed to spectate or participate in a wide variety of sports from around the world. There are stadiums inside dedicated to everything from baseball to (via virtual reality) skydiving, but for guests who aren't interested in games on the field, there's also an enormous video arcade that hosts some of the most immersive, addictive, and creative mediums of virtual gaming in existence. (Created by Keroro04)

Fate's Hand Casino: Easily the most expensive circle of the hotel to get into, and of course the most expensive to be be able to stick around inside. The casino occupies the five-story penthouse of the Aether suites, and is so immersed in its sinful luxury that even the hot tubs have poker tables, but it's also a hot spot for its drinks and stage acts. However, as flashy and luscious as the place looks, it's generally the most feared by the staff to work in, given the occasional rowdy or drunk gambler.

There's rooms local only to the casino that are the most expensive out of all the hotel's other rooms, the Golden Suites, which all share their own pool and cocktail lounge in a dome at the very top: the absolute highest point in all the resort. It's also home to the world's largest roulette wheel; the Fate's Hand, breaking the record at 115 feet wide.

The Monorail: A high speed tram system that transports residents or workers on a cycle through every facility in Gaia 2.0.

Worker's Quarters: Although it's the only place in the entire resort where customers are forbidden, they aren't really missing out. This section is nowhere near the luxury of the Aether Suite's rooms, but is still clean and furnished enough that workers don't want to leave.

Characters


The Good


Gregory Wiltsead

Species: Human.

Height: 5'11"

Age: 22.

The main character of the story. Gregory was one of the poor, poor souls who sought for a Gaian job in the hopes that it'd be just like one big vacation, blissfully unaware of what lay inside until his first job at the White Brimstone. Being a Gaia choreboy, he's an expert chef, bartender, blackjack dealer, translator, bodyguard, swimmer, masseuse, musician, singer, hairdresser, and even magician thanks to months of training and experience working in the resort, but those skills alone won't guarantee his survival. On the job, he tries to give off a very charming demeanor around customers and an obedient dedication to his duties, but in the coffee room, he's just as cynical as anybody with every job known to man could be.

His job consists of anything the resort needs; a spare cleaner, waiter, clerk, lifeguard, or even just a servant to pamper any of the guests for a certain time.


Garnet Rhodes

Species: Swan.

Height: 7'4"

Age: 24.

Garnet isn't really "skinny", given enough pudge to give her a distinct pear figure, but she's still a perky little twig compared to a vast landslide of Gaia 2.0's patrons, or the twenty-so generations in her family line. Being the daughter of the infamous billionaire Sapphire Rhodes, she was sent to live in Gaia 2.0 at the wishes of her mother to put on a few (thousand) pounds to live up to the family image, a task she'd sadly neglected her entire stay.

Despite the two being so closely related, Garnet is the sheer opposite of her mother. She has no immediate desire for fame and fortune, and is instead more content to just sit around and play guitar in her room, with little taste for the fashion or luxury from the lifestyle of a wealthy family. She'd taken a strong fondness of Gregory for his easygoing personality against the resort's insanity, and the two have managed to form a strong friendship...a friendship she lives in great fear of her mother coming across.

However, despite a great resentment for her mother's hateful attitude, she still manages to care for and respect her as family.


Candace Moenks

Species: Dragon (European.)

Height: 10'5"

Age: 89 (36, by dragon years.)

Candace is the head chef of the White Brimstone, and a muscle-packed titan that'd make even other dragons turn head, with dark brown scales and jet black hair that two red horns peek through.

While already a friendly and laidback soul, she has a special respect for Gregory for being able to hold his weight as the smallest member of the staff with nary a (visible) complaint, and thus is always willing to offer him a few words of advice or meal out of her fridge. Her talent for cooking is unmatched by many, one of her specialties being the use of her own breath to roast her dishes.

Being a dragon, Candace has the rare ability to solidify fire. Aside from being a great ingredient for her meals, it also boasts extraordinary healing properties, in a way making her an unofficial nurse of the resort.


Miles Brillcott

Species: Goat

Height: 10'4"

Age: 25

Another choreboy, but one nowhere on par with Gregory's weight class. Miles is an absolute behemoth in mass even by the standards of someone with his towering stature, but his enormous weight is downright skinny in the wake of the vast amounts of food he consumes without relief throughout an entire day. It never seems like he's ever full or satisfied, perpetually shoving down large handfuls of junk food that he somehow keeps hidden on his person.

He eats even in the most tense or dangerous situations, but when he hears the call, he's still a hard worker and loyal friend who unquestioningly throws himself into the line of fire to save others.

He rarely feels the need to speak, but when he does, he does so in an incredibly soothing, articulate manner, and with a ripe British accent.


Miss Blanc

Species: Moth.

Height: 24'9" (Is always seated, full height is hard to estimate.)

Age: 318.

Not many of the staff know much about Miss Blanc other than that during however long she'd been a guest, her thorax had somehow grown to the point where it completely occupied what was once the room next door, while her staunch obesity renders her unable to stand up or walk around. As such, she leads a very lazy lifestyle of reading and snacking that only fattens her up even worse, but recently had been able to taper off into a more manageable speed.

Thanks to her insectoid senses, she can perceive or interact with things that are impossible for mammal eyes to see. While the other workers tend to steer away from her, Gregory took an interest in Miss Blanc for her mysterious, yet gentle nature, and she in turn gladly welcomes him to the lonely confines of her room.

She spends most of her free time studying on ethereal arts, but she also loves playing video games.


Gertrude Carmine

Species: Orca.

Height: 28'9"

Age: 26.

The lifeguard at The Glass Tornado's beach pool, and also a kind, albeit whistle-crazy neurotic that goes into panic mode at even the tiniest act against the pool rules. While some wouldn't be surprised at how colossally fat she is, given she's literally a whale, she's an extremely fast swimmer that can slice through water at neckbreaking speeds, able to stop and turn on a dime.


Mavis Thymes

Species: Penguin.

Height: 9'11"

Age: 36.

Although Miss Holmes, the owner of Gaia 2.0 owns and operates every inch of the resort's flooring on her own hand, Mavis is her vice, manager, and extra hand for the Aurora Nightclub. However, while Holmes is quick to send in any of the staff to get a job done, Mavis seeks to lessen their workloads and actually tends to hire herself for most of the jobs in the club, rarely asking anybody to help her out unless she thinks it's absolutely needed.

Mavis is very fat to keep herself warm in the coldest areas of the resort, but is still a very skilled swimmer, not unlike Gertrude.


Michelle Orrid

Species: Cockroach.

Height: 10'9"

Age: 27.

A relentlessly fussy maid stationed in the Aether Suites. She may be enormously fat, but if there's anything she's not, it's a slob; she refuses to leave her room if she isn't totally convinced every inch of her body's been properly rinsed and loofa'd, and can't step foot into a room without finding something to snark over.

She has high standards of hygiene whenever she's working with others, but tries to make up for it with enough wisecracks and praise for her coworkers to enjoy being around her.


Kalinka Tuporev (created by Iruiel)

Species: Human.

Height: 5'9"

Age: 21.

A radio DJ and radio/electronics/electrical specialist from Eastern Europe. She's bubbly, friendly, and is good with her music, but if a client wants specific styles, is willing to go to great lengths to make perfect soundtracks for a night or two. For this, getting a gig, even if not permanent at a place such as the Aurora Nightclub at this prestigious resort is a big deal for her. If not fit for that duty, she's certainly got a lot of heart and can do most menial tasks easily.

Extremely flamboyant thanks to her attire, which generally consists of a pair of normal slacks, white dress shirt, but a hand-stitched vest of a myriad of colors and patterns, coupled with handmade braids, chains, and ribbons adorning her arms. She wears loafers or high-tops, depending on what she's doing, and on top of her head, she wears a put-together fedora complete with several feathers of varying colors-depending on the day or how she's feeling. Orange-auburn hair, with braids on one side and a bobcut on the other.


Raine

Species: Raccoon.

Height: 8'6"

Age: Early twenties, by estimate.

A nickname given by Gaia 2.0's staff to a very heavyset Raccoon who lives somewhere between the walls of the Aether Suites. Nobody knows who she is, where she's come from, or even how long she's been freeloading in the resort.

In person, she's a very quiet, yet quirky and creative soul who enjoys taking minor trinkets left laying around in the hotel for herself, assembling them into elaborate sculptures or inventions she houses inside her hideout. For somebody of her weight, she's actually very agile and stealthy, and also a brilliant escape artist who can think her way out of almost any tough spot.

While there is a great effort by the staff to hunt Raine down and kick her out (all of which have been met with failure), she doesn't mean any harm towards anybody inside, and actually has a knack for yanking people out of harm's way, even carrying them to her hideout safety.


Katrina Reinhart

Species: Kitsune.

Height: 9'11"

Age: 30.

Although she's rather fat, Katrina was an ambitious and lively prodigy in her theatre classes prior to her employment, and had a close shot at making a name for herself as an actress but certain financial troubles forced her to put her dreams on hold and find a job operating one of the Diamond Mine's mine carts, one of the resort's most common jobs.

She's deeply ashamed of her job, and doesn't go out of her way to chat it up with others, but she has a deep sense of compassion for workers who get the full brunt of everything the resort throws at them.


Lisa Meroni

Species: Dove.

Height: 10'10"
